subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: PIL filed in the High Court of Gujarat for framing a policy and rules for preserving and enhancing employment of waste pickers all over India, September 2009
summary: SEWA files Public Interest Litigation to appoint a High Powered Committee to frame a policy and mandatory rules for preserving and enhancing employment of waste pickers all over India. This can be done by integrating them into city and solid waste management policies with special reference to the right to work and life of women as well as the Valmiki and Dalit community.

subject: Water Resources
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding rehabilitation for those displaced by the Narmada projects, 26/07/2011
judge_name: J. M. Panchal, B. S. Chauhan, Deepak Verma
summary: Supreme Court notes rejects the appeal of the appellant for granting agricultural land to landless labourers to the extent of 2 hectares.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding management of plastic waste, 22/02/2018
summary: Report has been submitted before NGT by the Central Pollution Control Board prepared by Central Institute of Plastics Engineering and Technology on the degradation of the plastics. NGT directs report to be submitted periodically once in two month showing degradation which should pass on every month or 30 days.

subject: Water Resources
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding nationalisation of all the rivers in India, 27/02/2012
judge_name: Swatanter Kumar, S. H. Kapadia, A. K. Patnaik
act_referred: Inter-State Water Disputes Act 1956, River Boards Act 1956
summary: Supreme Court says that it sees no reason "why any State should lag behind in contributing its bit to bring the Inter-linking River Program to a success, thus saving the people living in drought-prone zones from hunger and people living in flood-prone areas from the destruction caused by floods".

subject: Industry
title: Supreme Court order on Sterlite Industries to pay Rs 100 crore for polluting environment, Thoothukudi, Tamil Nadu, 02/04/2013
judge_name: A. K. Patnaik, H. L. Gokhale
act_referred: Air (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act 1981, Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act 1974
summary: The appeals are allowed and the impugned common judgment of the High Court is set aside. The appellants, however, are directed to deposit within three months from today a compensation of Rs.100 crores with the Collector of Thoothukudi District, which will be kept in a fixed deposit in a Nationalized Bank for a minimum of five years, renewable as and when it expires, and the interest therefrom will be spent on suitable measures for improvement of the environment, including water and soil, of the vicinity of the plant of the appellants after consultation with TNPCB and approval of the Secretary, Environment, Government of Tamil Nadu.

subject: Forests
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding construction activity in the area around Kapurthala Estate or the Savoy Hotel which have been declared as forest area
act_referred: Protection of Tree Act, Urban Planning and Development Act, Indian Forest Act
summary: NGT in its Order restrain any persons including M/s Trak Chemicals Pvt. Ltd. from carrying on any construction activity in the area around Kapurthala Estate or the Savoy Hotel which have been declared as forest area under the provision of the Indian Forest Act.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding plastic collection and burning in the area of Mundka and Nangloi villages of Delhi
summary: NGT directs the Police to ensure that no plastic is burnt in that area nor any plastic waste is carried out from that area.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order on Sterlite Industries (India) Ltd., Thoothukudi (Tamil Nadu), 15/07/2013
respondent: Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board & Others
summary: NGT after going through the report submitted by the Special Expert Committee stated that it does not indicate that the company is polluting and the stack sampling or ambient air quality monitoring it is not being found that the industry was emitting SO2 gas or substances which were in violation to the prescribed standards. The Special Expert Committee makes certain recommendations to further improve the working of the plant of the appellant industry which the industry has undertaken to comply.

subject: Environment
title: National Green Tribunal order  on Rohtang Pass and its environment dated 29/07/2013
summary: NGT directs the Himachal Pradesh Government and all its concerned Departments to submit to the Expert Committee appointed by the Tribunal a report as to what steps it has taken to comply with the directions of the High Court as well as the report submitted by NEERI.

subject: Water Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order on dumping of debris and construction on the bank of the river Mutha dated 16/08/2013
summary: Tribunal directs removal of debris dumped on the river bed and proper disposal in accordance with law. The Tribunal also made it clear that any dumping of debris or waste on the river bed, i.e., the blue line or even the green area of river Mutha is prohibited.

subject: Environment
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal on fixation of lower noise level impulse at 90 dB(A) at 5 meters from source for manufacturing and sale of firecrackers
summary: The matter relates to fixation of lower noise level impulse at 90 dB(A) at 5 meters from source for manufacturing and sale of firecrackers instead at 125 dB(A) at 4 meters from source which is prescribed by the Ministry of Environment & Forests (MoEF) vide Notification dated 05.10.1999.

subject: Environment
title: National Green Tribunal order on fire crackers, 31/10/2013
summary: NGT has been appraised of the fact that State Pollution Control Boards have kept the District Administration and the State Government informed on the requirement of allowing the fire crackers within the permissible decibel levels and in some cases, samples have been taken and sent for analysis and which are found beyond the prescribed limits, action against the concerned persons has been proposed to the District Administration. It has been submitted that as regards the ambient air quality, air pollution and noise pollution levels, the State Pollution Control Boards have deployed teams with monitoring equipment at various places in the State and results of the samples so taken during the festivities of Deepawali would be monitored as required by law. NGT expresses satisfaction with the measures adopted by the State Pollution Control Boards and the District Administration.

subject: Mining
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding levy of cess on mineral rights by state legislature of Rajasthan, 06/12/2013
act_referred: Rajasthan Finance Act 2008, Rajasthan Environment and Health Cess Rules 2008, Mines and Minerals (Development and Regulation) Act 1957
summary: The case relates to the constitutional validity of Chapter VII of the Rajasthan Finance Act, 2008 which provides for levy of cess on mineral rights. The respondent was granted a mining lease for extraction on major minerals. As per the amendment brought in the year 2008 it was required to pay the environment and health cess imposed under Section 16 of the Act. The State Government, in exercise of the powers conferred by Section 19 of the Act, framed a set of rules called Rajasthan Environment and Health Cess Rules, 2008. Rule 13 of the Rules provides for the head under which the cess collected under Section 16 of the Act is to be credited.

subject: Mining
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding illegal mining in Village Chhinnawara, Tehsil Pahadi, District Bharatpur, Rajasthan, 24/01/2014
summary: A penalty of Rs. 8,00,000/- (Rupees Eight Lakh) was imposed upon the Appellant, who has sought time for depositing the same.

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding construction and completion of barrage in Madhya Pradesh, 29/01/2014
summary: The NGT order states that "Construction and completion of barrage does not require environmental clearance as stated by MoEF. To ensure that there is a proper passage of fishes from the barrage to the downstream, the Project Proponent shall construct a fish pass at its own cost".

subject: Health, Food Safety, Pesticides
title: Supreme Court order regarding Euthanasia, 25/02/2014
judge_name: P. Sathasivam, Ranjan Gogoi, Shiva Kirti Singh
summary: Supreme Court refrains from framing any specific questions for considerations by the Constitution Bench as the Apex Court invites the Constitution Bench to go into all the aspects of the matter and lay down exhaustive guidelines in this regard. The matter has been referred to a Constitution Bench of the Supreme Court for an authoritative opinion.
case_status_comments: Matter referred to a Constitution Bench of the Supreme Court

subject: Governance & Institutions
title: Supreme Court judgement on transgender community, 15/04/2014
judge_name: K. S. Radhakrishnan, A. K. Sikri
summary: Supreme Court declares that Hijras, Eunuchs, apart from binary gender, be treated as “third gender” for the purpose of safeguarding their rights under Part III of the Indian Constitution and the laws made by the Parliament and the State Legislature. The Apex Court also upheld transgender persons' right to decide their self-identified gender is also upheld and the Centre and State Governments are directed to grant legal recognition of their gender identity such as male, female or as third gender.

subject: Forests
title: Judgement of the Kolkata High Court regarding payment of market fee in relation to the transaction of Tobacco and Kendu Leaves in the notified market area for manufacturing Biri, 06/05/2014
act_referred: West Bengal Agricultural Produce Marketing (Regulation) Act 1972
summary: The petitioners are claiming that they are engaged in manufacturing 'Biri'. They purchase raw materials i.e. Kendu Leaves and Tobacco from outside the State and utilise the same for manufacture of 'Biri' in their own manufacturing unit. They are neither storing for sale nor processing for sale nor they are engaged in purchase and sale of Kendu Leaves or Tobacco in the notified market area. These two items are agricultural produce under West Bengal Agricultural Produce Marketing (Regulation) Act, 1972.

subject: Water Resources
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding water level of Mullaperiyar dam, 07/05/2014
judge_name: R. M. Lodha, H. L. Dattu, Chandramauli Kr. Prasad, Madan B. Lokur, M.Y. Eqbal
act_referred: Kerala Irrigation and Water Conservation (Amendment) Act 2006
summary: State of Kerala – is restrained by a decree of permanent injunction from applying and enforcing the impugned legislation or in any manner interfering with or obstructing the State of Tamil Nadu from increasing the water level to 142 ft. and from carrying out the repair works. A 3 Member Supervisory Committee is constituted which shall supervise the restoration Full Reservoir Level (FRL) in the Mullaperiyar dam to the elevation of 142 ft and shall inspect the dam periodically, more particularly, immediately before the monsoon and during the monsoon and keep close watch on its safety and recommend measures which are necessary. Such measures shall be carried out by Tamil Nadu.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding leather and plastic burning in the scrap markets of Mundka and Tikri Kalan, Delhi, 15/10/2014
summary: National Green Tribunal directs the NCT, Delhi, North Muncipal Corporation, Delhi Pollution Control Committee and Police Authorities to inspect the area and submit a Status Report.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding construction in the city of Shimla of Himachal Pradesh in relation to 17 green areas, 01/09/2015
summary: The Tribunal in the present order noted that "despite our orders no study in regard to load bearing capacity of the Hills at Shimla, and impact of further density in construction on sewage system, water supply, collection and disposal of Municipal solid waste, transportation and Environmental ecology has been placed on record".

subject: Governance & Institutions
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding the constitutionality of the Haryana Panchayati Raj (Amendment) Act, 2015, 10/12/2015
summary: Petition dismissed. The Applicants had challenged the constitutionality of the Haryana Panchayati Raj (Amendment) Act 2015.

subject: Health, Food Safety, Pesticides
title: Judgement of the Delhi High Court regarding ineffective implementation of Pre-Conception and Pre-Natal Diagnostic Techniques Act 1994, 17/02/2016
act_referred: Preconception and Pre-natal Diagnostic Techniques (Prohibition of Sect Selection) Act 1994
summary: Delhi High Court rules Rule 3(3)(1)(b) of the PNDT Rules " is ultra vires the PNDT Act to the extent it requires a person desirous of setting up a Genetic Clinic / Ultrasound Clinic / Imaging Centre to undergo six months training imparted in the manner prescribed in the Six Months Training Rules".

subject: Air Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding registration of heavy commercial diesel vehicles which is BS-IV compliant for carrying petroleum products, 12/06/2017
summary: NGT allows the registration of heavy commercial diesel vehicles subject to the condition that they are BS-IV compliant

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding industrial pollution caused by lack of functional CETP, Loni, Ghaziabad, Uttar Pradesh, 12/06/2017
summary: NGT imposes a cost of Rs. Rs. 2 lakh per day to be paid by UPSIDC till the STP is made functional and the orders are complied with.

subject: Land, Agriculture, Animal Care and Fisheries
title: Petition filed in the Supreme Court of India regarding Maharashtra Animal Preservation Act 1976, 04/08/2016
summary: The issue is whether the High Court of Judicature at Bombay was justified in upholding the validity of Section 5, and consequently Sections 5A and 5B, and 5C of the Maharashtra Animal Preservation (Amendment) Act, 1995, thereby extending the complete ban on the slaughter of cows to bulls and bullocks without even considering all the submissions, facts and quantitative data submitted by the various petitioners before it? The Petitioner has also raised the issue that whether the complete prohibition of the slaughter of bulls and bullocks can be considered reasonable given that it is not even correlated to the depleting cattle wealth of the State of Maharashtra and nor is it a hindrance to enhancement of such cattle wealth?

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding declaration and identification of Ramgarh Taal as a wetland, Uttar Pradesh, 09/08/2016
summary: This application seeks declaration and identification of Ramgarh Taal as a wet land in accordance with the provisions of Wet Land (Conservation and Management) Rules, 2010. NGT directs that till a decision is taken by the State of Uttar Pradesh it shall not permit any project to come up on the submerged area or catchment area of Ramgarh Taal lake and shall ensure that activities like washing of clothes, animals and dumping of waste material in the lake is stopped.

subject: Land, Agriculture, Animal Care and Fisheries
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding the acquisition of 33 bighas and 1 biswa of land in the Vasant Kunj area of New Delhi, 09/09/2016
act_referred: Right to Fair Compensation and Transparency in Land Acquisition, Rehabilitation and Resettlement Act 2013
summary: The matter deals with the the correct construction of Section 24(2) of The Right to Fair Compensation and Transparency in Land Acquisition, Rehabilitation and Resettlement Act, 2013 with respect to 33 bighas and 1 biswa of land in the Vasant Kunj area of New Delhi.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding the complete cordoning of a public road for the work on Kidwai Nagar East re-development, 02/09/2016
petitioner: National Building Construction Corporation Ltd & Others
judge_name: T. S. Thakur, A. M. Khanwilkar, D. Y. Chandrachud
summary: The Court makes it clear that as the project for re-development has received the statutory approvals, it is necessary to facilitate the completion of the project on schedule.

subject: Land, Agriculture, Animal Care and Fisheries
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding acquisition of agricultural lands belonging to poor agriculturalists by a housing society, Karnataka, 15/09/2016
respondent: Trinity House Building Co-Operative Society & Other
summary: Supreme Court rules that the transfer of the acquired lands by way of alleged sale deeds are illegal.

subject: Health, Food Safety, Pesticides
title: Supreme Court order regarding information on sex determination online in India, 19/09/2016
act_referred: Pre-conception and Pre-natal Diagnostic Techniques (Prohibition of Sex Selection) Act 1994
summary: Ranjit Kumar Solicitor General submitted before the Apex Court he has been apprised about the “proposed list of words” in respect of which when commands are given, there will be “auto block” with a warning and nothing would be reflected in the internet, as it is prohibited in India.

subject: Water Pollution
title: Order of the Madras High Court regarding disposal of sewage water into river Amaravathi and its channels, Tamil Nadu, 28/09/2016
summary: Madras High Court directs State of Tamil Nadu (Municipal Administration) and Karur Municipality to stop draining the drainage/sewage water into Amaravathi river within Karur Municipal Limit and the said exercise shall be completed on or before 30.10.2016.

subject: Health, Food Safety, Pesticides
title: Supreme Court order regarding Cauvery river water allocation, 30/09/2016
summary: The Apex Court in its Order said that the State of Karnataka is flouting the order of the Court and referred to Article 144 of the Constitution of India which clearly states that "all authorities in the territory of India are bound to act in aid of the Supreme Court" and directs the State of Karnataka to release 6000 cusecs of water from 1st October, 2016 till 6th October, 2016. Supreme Court also directs the Cauvery Management Board to study the ground reality and submit a report.

subject: Water Resources
title: Supreme Court order regarding Cauvery water dispute, 04/10/2016
summary: Supreme Court directs the State of Karnataka to release 2000 cusecs of water from 7.10.2016 till 18.10.2016.

subject: Health, Food Safety, Pesticides
title: Supreme Court order regarding threat to life due to stray dogs, 04/10/2016
respondent: People for Elimination of Stray Troubles & Others
summary: The matter relates to threat to life, health, movement and sometimes security of the human beings due to stray dogs.

subject: Health, Food Safety, Pesticides
title: Supreme Court order regarding vector borne diseases in Delhi, 04/10/2016
judge_name: Madan B. Lokur, L. Nageswara Rao
summary: Supreme Court directs a meeting to be convened by the Lieutenant Governor to resolve issues relating to the better management of the problems faced by the people of Delhi due to dengue and chikungunya – and other issues, if so advised.

subject: Land, Agriculture, Animal Care and Fisheries
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding Petroleum and Minerals Pipelines Act 1962 providing for the acquisition of land, Gujarat, 05/10/2016
judge_name: Uday Umesh Lalit, V. Gopala Gowda
act_referred: Petroleum and Minerals Pipelines (Acquisition of Right of User in Land) Act 1962
summary: The matter relates to Petroleum and Minerals Pipelines (Acquisition of Right of User in Land) Act, 1962 enacted by Parliament to provide for the acquisition of right of user in land for laying of pipelines for the transport of petroleum and minerals and for incidental matters.

subject: Water Resources
title: Supreme Court order regarding Cauvery river water distribution, 18/10/2016
judge_name: Dipak Misra, Amitava Roy, A. M. Khanwilkar
summary: The GS Jha-led Supreme Court appointed team submitted its report before the apex court after inspecting the Krishnaraja Sagar and the Kabini dams in Karnataka, and the Mettur and Bhavani Sagar dams in Tamil Nadu. Apex Court notes that the Committee has not suggested with regard to any quantity of water.

subject: Health, Food Safety, Pesticides
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding drug price overcharging, India, 21/10/2016
judge_name: Madan B. Lokur, R. K. Agrawal
act_referred: Drugs (Prices Control) Order 1995, Drugs (Prices Control) Order 1970, Drugs (Prices Control) Order 1979, Drugs (Prices Control) Order 1987
summary: Supreme Court validates the notification dated 13th July, 1999 issued by the Central Government under Paragraph 7 of the Drugs (Prices Control) Order, 1995 prescribing the norms for conversion cost, packing charges and process loss of raw materials (other than packing materials in conversion) and packing and process loss of packing materials in packaging and allows the appeals filed by the Union of India.

subject: Health, Food Safety, Pesticides
title: Order of the High Court of Uttarakhand regarding use of adhesive solutions as drugs by children, Uttarakhand, 25/10/2016
summary: The matter is regarding availability of Iodex, Fevi-Quick and any other adhesive solutions to children below the age of 18 years. Chief Secretary, State of Uttarakhand is directed by the Court to ensure that the Iodex, Fevi-Quick and any other adhesive solutions are not sold to the boys and girls below the age of 18 years. Since, the use of whitener has become obsolete, the sale of the same is banned throughout the State of Uttarakhand.

subject: Health, Food Safety, Pesticides
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding increase of female foeticide in India, 08/11/2016
act_referred: Pre-conception and Pre-natal Diagnostic Techniques (Prohibition of Sex Selection) Act 1994, Pre-conception and Pre-natal Diagnostic Techniques (Prohibition of Sex Selection) Rules 1996
summary: Supreme Court in its Judgement directs the States and Union Territories to implement the Pre-conception and Pre-natal Diagnostic Techniques (Prohibition of Sex Selection) (Six Months Training) Rules, 2014 forthwith "considering that the training provided therein is imperative for realising the objects and purpose of this Act.

subject: Water Resources
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding sharing of Ravi-Beas river waters, 10/11/2016
summary: Supreme Court in its Order said the Agreement (dated 31st December, 1981 about sharing of waters of Ravi and Beas rivers) "could not have been unilaterally terminated by one of the parties and if any party or any State does so such unilateral action of a particular State has to be declared contrary to the Constitution of India as well as the provisions of the Inter State Water Disputes Act, 1956.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: Supreme Court order regarding right to shelter of homeless persons in urban areas, 11/11/2016
judge_name: T. S. Thakur, D. Y. Chandrachud, L. Nageswara Rao
summary: Supreme Court directs a Committee to be constituted which will be responsible for the physical verification of the available shelters for urban homeless in each State/UT and also verify whether the shelters are in compliance of the operational guidelines for the Scheme of Shelters for Urban Homeless under the National Urban Livelihoods Mission (NULM).
case_status_comments: Petitions to be listed after four months

subject: Health, Food Safety, Pesticides
title: Supreme Court order regarding stray dog menace in Kerala, 17/11/2016
respondent: People for Elimination of Stray Troubles & Others
summary: It was brought to the notice of the Apex Court the "enormous cruelties being meted out to stray dogs in the State of Kerala. In fact, there are instances where certain Committees, organizations and clubs have been formed to launch a crusade to kill the stray dogs and it is also averred that the children are being trained how to eliminate the stray dogs.

subject: Health, Food Safety, Pesticides
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding increase in the use of drugs and alcohol among children in India, 14/12/2016
judge_name: T. S. Thakur, A. M. Khanwilkar, D. Y. Chandrachud
summary: The Union Government has stated before the Supreme Court that a national policy on drug demand reduction is being finalized. The priority areas of intervention would include capacity building and training of service providers with a view to build up skilled manpower, education and awareness building at all levels and inter-sectoral collaboration.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding municipal solid waste management in India, 22/12/2016
respondent: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare & Others
summary: National Green Tribunal in its Judgement directed every state and Union Territory to enforce and implement the Solid Waste Management Rules, 2016 in all respects and without any further delay and also all State Governments and the local authorities to issue directives to all concerned, making it mandatory for the power generation and cement plants within its jurisdiction to buy and use RDF as fuel in their respective plants, wherever such plant is located within a 100 km radius of the facility.

subject: Health, Food Safety, Pesticides
title: Order of the Supreme Court of India in the matter of Democratic Youth Federation of India Vs Union of India & Others regarding endosulfan poisoning in Kerala, 10/01/2017
judge_name: Dipak Misra, N. V. Ramana, D. Y. Chandrachud
summary: Supreme Court of India directs the concerned state governments to release the entire undisbursed payment of compensation, quantified as Rs.5 lakhs each, to all the affected persons, within three months. The Apex Court also directed the Government of Kerala to take into consideration the feasibility of providing medical facilities/treatment for life-long health issues, arising out of the effects of endosulfan, keeping in mind, that there seems to be a large number of such affected persons.

subject: Health, Food Safety, Pesticides
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding use of microbeads in personal care products, 09/01/2017
act_referred: Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act 1974
summary: NGT in the Order said that as the Central Drugs Standard Control Organization which comes under Ministry of Health to ensure that no product, commercial or otherwise, imported or made domestically is allowed to be sold or made available to public which is dangerous for human use.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding generation and management of municipal solid wastes in India, 10/01/2017
act_referred:
Municipal Solid Wastes (Management & Handling) Rules 2000, Solid Waste Management Rules 2016, Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act 1974, Air
(Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act 1981, Environment (Protection) Act 1986
summary: NGT in its Order said that administrative blocks and huge markets and malls cannot also be equated with the normal house hold level generator of waste and sewage and its necessary to put these generators of mass Municipal Solid Waste and Sewage in a separate category in itself and ensure strict enforcement of the Municipal Solid Wastes (Management & Handling) Rules, 2000 proper management and treatment of sewage with complete measures for recycling of treated sewage.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding municipal solid waste management in Delhi, 13/01/2017
act_referred: Municipal Solid Wastes (Management & Handling) Rules 2000, Solid WasteManagement Rules 2016
summary: NGT asks the Central Pollution Control Board and Delhi Pollution Control Committee the steps they have taken in relation to dealing with municipal solid waste of Delhi and what directions have been issued to the authorities concerned; whether any action/prosecution have been taken against the Corporation and Delhi Government for violating the Municipal Solid Wastes (Management & Handling) Rules, 2000 and Solid Waste (Management & Handling) Rules, 2000 and Solid Waste Management Rules, 2016.

subject: Water Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding Ganga pollution, 13/01/2017
judge_name: Swatanter Kumar, Jawad Rahim, Raghuvendra S. Rathore
summary: UPPCB, UP Jal Nigam, UPSIDC, NMCG and the Central Pollution Control Board have filed a Joint Report. National Green Tribunal directs all the Respondents particularly, CPCB, UPPCB, UP Jal Nigam, NMCG, UPSIDC and the representative of the State Government to submit to the Tribunal details of all the industrial clusters filed in segment B of phase 1. They shall also submit trade/industrial effluent load in terms of quantity and quality both. The Counsel appearing for the State of Uttar Pradesh, UPSIDC and UPPCB shall also submit as to how many industries are there, besides 1200 industries, the list of which has already been provided and out of which nearly 700 to 800 industries are seriously polluting and comes in red or orange category.

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding rain water harvesting systems in Delhi, 16/01/2017
summary: DJB and CGWA will conduct Joint Inspection of any five major government schools and five private major schools in Delhi and report if the rain water harvesting systems are in existence and are operational appropriately.

subject: Wildlife and Biodiversity
title: Supreme Court order regarding eco-sensitive zones around the national park and wildlife sanctuaries of Goa, 16/01/2017
summary: Supreme Court has noted in the Order that notifications on eco-sensitive zones of Goa have been issued on 23.01.2015, 25.01.2015, 17.02.2015, 23.02.2015, 24.02.2015 and 25.02.2015 and the aforesaid notifications have to be given effect to, and the same be implemented.

subject: Air Pollution
title: Supreme Court order regarding high sulphur content in pet coke and furnace oil causing air pollution, Delhi NCR, 17/01/2017
judge_name: Madan B. Lokur, Prafulla C. Pant
summary: Solicitor General informed the Court that action has been taken in this regard and necessary discussions with the stakeholders will take place based on the response received from various institutions, such as CSIR, TERI, NPL, CPCB and Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas.

subject: Land, Agriculture, Animal Care and Fisheries
title: Supreme Court order regarding imposing uniform ban on fishing in the Indian Exclusive Economic Zone, 17/01/2017
summary: The afore-stated fishing ban is proposed for a period of 61 days. Court has been informed by the Additional Solicitor General, that all State Governments and Union Territories, other than the State of Kerala, have agreed to the afore-mentioned duration of uniform fishing ban within their territorial waters.

subject: Water Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding pollution of Santragachi Jheel, Howrah, West Bengal, 18/01/2017
summary: NGT finds the affidavit of Deptt. of Environment woefully short of the court's expectations and said that "expression of inability to declare the Santragachi Jheel area as ‘silence zone’ relying upon the notification issued by the MOEF, Govt. of India on the subject appears to be quite mechanical. It is within the authority of the State to supplement the notification of the MOEF being one having general application.

subject: Mining
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding coal block allocation cases, 23/01/2017
judge_name: Madan B. Lokur, Kurian Joseph, A. K. Sikra
summary: The Apex Court ordered a probe against former chief of the investigation agency Ranjit Sinha in connection with the coal block allocation case.

subject: Water Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding Ganga river pollution, 25/01/2017
summary: NGT observed that by different Orders passed by the Tribunal "we had directed all the stakeholders to put forward their submissions/suggestions in regard to the 30 drains which join river Ganga and which cause all major pollution in Segment-B of Phase-I, but we regretfully note that the assistance provided to the Tribunal in that behalf is far from what is desired.

subject: Land, Agriculture, Animal Care and Fisheries
title: Supreme Court order regarding farmer suicides in India, 27/01/2017
summary: Supreme Court directs that the Union of India, besides the Reserve Bank of India, and all the State Governments and Union Territories, need to be added as a party respondents, "so as to enable them to assist this Court, to arrive at an effective determination in the matter" as the case is not only sensitive but concerns public interest at large.

subject: Water Resources
title: Supreme Court order regarding wetland conservation in India, 31/01/2017
judge_name: Madan B. Lokur, Prafulla C. Pant
summary: Apex Court wants to whether the Draft Wetlands (Conservation and Management) Rules, 2016 which were said to have been circulated some time in March, 2016 have been finalized or not and, if not, reasons for the delay. Supreme Court also asks the Union of India to specify the steps taken to preserve the 26 wetlands covered by the Ramsar Convention, 1971.

subject: Forests
title: Supreme Court order regarding mining in private forest land without forest clearance in Goa, 03/02/2017
judge_name: Madan B. Lokur, Prafulla C. Pant
act_referred: Mines and Minerals (Development and Regulation) Act 1957, Mineral Concession Rules 1960, Forest (Conservation) Act 1980
summary: Supreme Court directs that mining leases having forest area may be renewed only after obtaining prior approval under the Forest (Conservation) Act, 1980 and Rule 24A of the Mineral Concession Rules, 1960 is subject to the compliance of the provisions of the Forest (Conservation) Act, 1980.

subject: Mining
title: Supreme Court order regarding mining leases in the state of Karnataka, 03/02/2017
judge_name: Madan B. Lokur, Prafulla C. Pant
act_referred: Mines and Minerals (Development and Regulation) Act 1957, Mineral Concession Rules 1960, Forest (Conservation) Act 1980
summary: Supreme Court directs that the state of Karnataka will not grant any mining lease except in accordance with the provisions of the Mines and Minerals (Development and Regulation) Act, 1957 and other statutory requirements.

subject: Air Pollution
title: Supreme Court order regarding rising air pollution in Delhi NCR, 06/02/2017
judge_name: Madan B. Lokur, Prafulla C. Pant
summary: It is stated before the Apex Court that the process for setting up Air Quality Monitoring Units in NCR is going on and as directed it will be completed by 31.05.2017. Supreme Court after going through the report submitted by Environment Pollution (Prevention & Control) Authority (EPCA) finds that the sulphur content in pet coke and furnance oil is extremely high and that is a major cause of pollution in Delhi and indeed in NCR. The EPCA report also states that the level of PM 2.5 had reached about 14 times the standard as on 05.11.2016 and there exists in the nature of a public health emergency so far as Delhi is concerned.

subject: Water Resources
title: Supreme Court order regarding wetland conservation in India, 08/02/2017
judge_name: Madan B. Lokur, Prafulla C. Pant
act_referred: Draft Wetlands (Conservation and Management) Rules 2016, Wetlands (Conservation and Management) Rules 2010, Hazardous Wastes (Management Handling and Transboundry Movement) Rules 2008
summary: Supreme Court orders that the Wetlands (Conservation and Management) Rules, 2016 should be notified on or before 30th June, 2017. Apex Court's attention was drawn to the affidavit filed by the Union of India which contains an Information Brochure “National Wetland Inventory & Assessment”. This Brochure indicates on page 11 thereof that 2,01,503 wetlands have been mapped at 1:50,000 scale. Court directs that the 'Brief Documents' with regard to these 2,01,503 wetlands should be obtained by the Union of India from the respective State Governments.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal

judge_name: Jagdish Singh Khehar, N. V. Ramana, D. Y. Chandrachud, Sanjay Kishan Kaul
summary: Supreme Court directs government of India to file a consolidated affidavit, in response to the issues raised, within four weeks thereafter.

In view of the Union of India accepting these conditions, permission to take necessary steps for construction of infrastructure on defence land in area adjacent to the Central Ridge Area, Delhi is granted.

subject: Water Pollution

Gupta, Chief Engineer, Drainage Project – I, Delhi Jal Board to submit a report on the Interceptor Sewer Project, postulated to collect waste water flowing in three major drains, namely, Najafgarh Drain, Supplementary Drain and Shahadra Drain. He is requested to furnish a report to this Court, within two weeks from today, indicating the entire nature of activity, and the present stage of construction of the Interceptor Sewer Project.

subject: Forests

judge_name: R. K. Agrawal, Abhay Manohar Sapre

The respondents assert their rights on the said land to the exclusion of the State on variety of grounds whereas the State equally disputes the respondents’ claim and assert their rights. Supreme Court requests the High Court to decide the writ appeal afresh on merits in accordance with law expeditiously.

subject: Forests
title: Supreme Court order regarding construction of transmission lines from Udupi to Hassan without obtaining forest clearance, 03/03/2017
summary: Supreme Court directs the Central Empowered Committee to give the Apex Court a report within six weeks of the possible environmental damage that may have been caused by the construction on the basis of the allegations made by the appellant.
case_status_comments: Matter to be listed after CEC report

subject: Water Resources
title: Supreme Court order regarding compensation and rehabilitation for the oustees of Sardar Sarovar Project on river Narmada, 03/03/2017
judge_name: Jagdish Singh Khehar, D. Y. Chandrachud, Sanjay Kishan Kaul
summary: Supreme Court allows the Chief Secretary of the State of Madhya Pradesh to approach the Registrar General of the High Court of Madhya Pradesh, for appointment of two Judicial Members to the two Additional Grievance Redressal Authorities.

subject: Water Resources
title: Supreme Court order regarding repair work on the reservoir situated in Chambal river, 06/03/2017
summary: Supreme Court directs the Applicant to make sure that no disturbance is caused to the wildlife and no building or construction material is left behind.
case_status_comments: Matter to be listed after five weeks

subject: Air Pollution
title: Supreme Court order regarding pet coke and furnace oil causing pollution in Delhi NCR, 06/03/2017
summary: Supreme Court points out that the Report prepared by EPCA in consultation with the representatives of the CPCB, Environment Department of the NCT of Delhi, Governments of Haryana, Rajasthan and Uttar Pradesh is still in a draft form and has been sent to the participants for their review. After receiving inputs from the participants, a meeting by EPCA will be convened in the end of March, 2017 to finalize the Report and plans with these Governments and the CPCB.

subject: Land, Agriculture, Animal Care and Fisheries
title: Supreme Court order regarding construction of a KVA sub-station on grazing land (4,900 square meters) in village Luna, Vadodara, Gujarat, 06/03/2017
judge_name: Jagdish Singh Khehar, D. Y. Chandrachud, Sanjay Kishan Kaul
summary: The matter deals with the construction of a KVA sub-station on grazing land (4,900 square meters) in village Luna, Vadodara, Gujarat. According to the counsel for the petitioners, the action at the behest of the authorities is arbitrary, because there is substantial barren land available in the village, where the sub-station can be raised. Supreme Court directs the petitioners, to furnish to the District Collector, Vadodara, Gujarat, particulars of barren land which is not low-lying, where a sub-station can be raised (to provide electricity to the residents of village Luna, and its surrounding areas).

subject: Mining
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding mining lessees to to pay 10% of the sale proceeds to the Special Purpose Vehicle, 21/03/2017
judge_name: Ranjan Gogoi, Prafulla C. Pant, A. M. Khanwilkar
act_referred: District Mineral Rules 2016, Mines and Minerals (Development and Regulation) Act 2015
summary: The Apex Court declined to modify its order for deposit of ore sale proceeds for SPV and further calls upon the State of Karnataka and the CEC to submit a detailed proposal with regard to implementation of the Scheme of construction of conveyor belt system in respect of existing leases and the details of the project relating to the construction of railway sidings and railway sub-lines which according to the Court constitutes the most significant steps towards controlling the environmental pollution that persists on account of open movement of iron ore by road.

subject: Water Resources
title: Supreme Court order regarding Cauvery water dispute, 21/03/2017
judge_name: Dipak Misra, Amitava Roy, A. M. Khanwilkar
summary: The basic prayer in these interlocutory applications is that the State of Kerala should not utilize the water more than that has been allocated to it by the award under challenge and also to stop certain constructions (check dams).

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding grant of permission to set up brick kiln industries in Assam, 24/03/2017
summary: Additional Advocate General for the State of Assam submits that the process of issuing the final notification publishing the state policy on the grant of permission to set up brick kiln industries, is at its final stage and is only awaiting consideration of the Finance Department, Govt. of Assam, which, as per him, would be completed within six weeks.

subject: Land, Agriculture, Animal Care and Fisheries
title: Supreme Court order regarding farmers suicides in India, 27/03/2017
judge_name: D. Y. Chandrachud, Sanjay Kishan Kaul
summary: Supreme Court grants Central Government four weeks time to place before the Court the line of action which the Central Government proposes for adoption by the State Governments, for dealing with the serious consequences of farmer suicides.

subject: Land, Agriculture, Animal Care and Fisheries
title: Judgement of the High Court of Delhi regarding Nuziveedu Seeds Limited continuing to sell GM cotton seeds in spite of termination of agreement with Mahyco Monsanto Biotech, 28/03/2017
summary: Delhi High Court dismissed the plea of Monsanto Technology and said that Nuziveedu Seeds Limited are entitled to all the rights under the 2015 Sub License Agreements except as to the rate of trait fee payable thereunder.

subject: Air Pollution
title: Supreme Court order regarding emission standards (BS-IV) of vehicles sold in India, 29/03/2017
summary: The Apex Court in its Order noted that the seminal issue in these applications is whether the sale and registration and therefore the commercial interests of manufacturers and dealers of such vehicles that do not meet the Bharat Stage-IV emission standards as on 1st April, 2017 takes primacy "over the health hazard due to increased air pollution of millions of our country men and women." The controversy relates to the sale and registration (on and after 1st April, 2017) of such vehicles lying in stock with the manufacturers and dealers that meet the Bharat Stage III emission standards but do not meet the BS-IV emission standards.

subject: Water Pollution

judge_name: Swatanter Kumar, Jawad Rahim, Raghuvendra S. Rathore
summary: After the meeting (11/04/2017) day-to-day hearing of the case would start from 17th April, 2017 till concluded.

subject: Environment

summary: Uttarakhand High Court on March 30, 2017 declared all the glaciers, including Gangotri and Yamunotri, rivers, streams, rivulets, lakes, air, meadows, dales, jungles, forests wetlands, grasslands, springs and waterfalls as living entities.

subject: Land, Agriculture, Animal Care and Fisheries
title: Order of the Allahabad High Court regarding closure of slaughter houses in Uttar Pradesh, 03/04/2017
act_referred: Municipal Corporations Act 1959 read with Uttar Pradesh Municipalities Act 1916
summary: Choice of food and trade in foodstuff were part of right to life said Allahabad high court and ordered UP government to draw up a plan in 10 days so that the crackdown on illegal abattoirs and meat shops didn’t deprive people of their livelihood or food.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding municipal solid waste handled by public buildings, Delhi, 10/04/2017
respondent: National Capital Territory of Delhi & Others
summary: NGT issues notice to the defaulters and directs Pollution Control Boards/Committee i.e. Delhi Pollution Control Committees, Uttar Pradesh Pollution Control Board and Haryana Pollution Control Board to ensure that the service is effected on all defaulter Hospitals, Hotels, Schools, Colleges, Malls, Railway Stations, Bus Terminals and Waste to Energy Plant, Ghazipur.

subject: Health, Food Safety, Pesticides
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding approval of Human Papilloma Virus (HPV) vaccine, 05/04/2017
petitioner: Kalpana Mehta, Nalini Bhanot, Dr. Rukmini Rao (President of the Gramya Resource Centre for Women in India) & Others
summary: Supreme Court  in the Judgement refers the issue to the Constitution Bench under Article 145(3) of the Constitution as it involves "substantial question of law relating to interpretation of the Constitution involved".

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation

summary: It has been submitted by the Counsel appearing for SDMC (South Delhi Municipal Corporation) that the alleged structure in the Municipal Park has been demolished and within a short span of time, remaining work regarding removal of debris would be done.

summary: An important part of the case is that a change in law in Indonesia took place in 2010 and 2011, which aligned the export price of coal from Indonesia to international market prices instead of the price that was prevalent for the last 40 years.

subject: Forests

summary: NGT directs the State of Jharkhand not to give effect to the Jharkhand Minor Mineral Concession Amendment Rules, 2017 until it reaches its finality.

subject: Sanitation
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding closure of slaughter house, Manglaur, Haridwar district, Uttarakhand, 11/04/2017
summary: Counsel appearing for Municipal Council of Manglaur submits that the slaughter house being run by the Council has already been shut. The Competent Authority has also granted approval for construction of new slaughter house outside the township.

subject: Mining
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding illegal mining at Kurghot and Shirdon, Sholapur, Maharashtra, 11/04/2017
summary: Additional Collector, Sholapur submitted before NGT that Shri Laxmi Enterprises and Yashwant Engineering have obtained Environmental Clearance from State Environment Impact Assessment Authority. However, they have not obtained consent of the Board for carrying on the mining activity. They also had no permission from the Collector for carrying on river mining activity by suction pump.

subject: Health, Food Safety, Pesticides

act_referred:
Pre-conception and Pre-natal Diagnostic Techniques (Prohibition of
Sex Selection) Act 1994
Sex Selection) Act, 1994
summary: It is accepted by the counsel for the respondents (Microsoft Corporation (I) Pvt. Ltd., Google India and Yahoo ! India) that they have never indulged in any kind of advertisement as contemplated under Section 22 of the Pre-conception and Pre-natal Diagnostic Techniques (Prohibition of Sex Selection) Act, 1994 and nor do they have any kind of intention to cause any violation of the said mandate. It is further accepted by them that they will not sponsor any advertisement as provided under Section 22 of the Act.

subject: Air Pollution
title: Judgement of the Supreme Court of India in the context of BS-IV compliant vehicles, 13/04/2017
act_referred: National Auto Fuel Policy 2003, Central Motor Vehicles Rules 1989
summary: Apex Court declares that the "automobile industry was quite sanguine that its desire for selling accumulated stock of BS-III compliant vehicles even after 1st April, 2017 would be acceded to". This is evident from the past practice when it had become necessary, in one sense, for the Government of India to virtually submit to the commercial interests of the automobile industry by permitting the registration of BS-III compliant vehicles in some cities while permitting the sale and registration of BS-I and BS-II compliant vehicles in other cities even after the cut-off date of 1st April, 2005 till the accumulated stock is exhausted. The intervention applications and submissions made therein by the automobile industry and the dealers association are rejected by the Supreme Court.

subject: Agriculture

petitioner: Tamil Nadu Centre for Public Interest Litigation
judge_name: Dipak Misra, A. M. Khanwilkar, Mohan M. Shantanagoudar
summary: Supreme Court directs the State of Tamil Nadu to take up ameliorative measures so that the agony of the farmers is addressed and further says that it will be appreciated if the respondents come with certain schemes/measures by the next date of hearing.

subject: Mining

Therefore the question of submission of report by the Board does not arise.

summary: NGT directs Uttar Pradesh Pollution Control Board to pay Environmental Compensation of Rs. 5 Lakhs and Mathura Cantonment Board shall pay Environmental Compensation of Rs. 10 Lakhs.

summary: NGT directs issuance of Notice to persons who have been found doing illegal mining and the State Government have imposed upon them a penalty of more than Rs. 50 lakh.

subject: Forests
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding felling of trees, Jaunapur and Dera Mandi, Delhi, 20/04/2017
respondent: State of NCT of Delhi & Others
summary: GT in the Order dated 11/12/2015 had directed NCT Delhi to take necessary measures to stop illegal activities of construction, laying of concrete RCC roads, both felling and cutting of trees, mining, digging of borewells, disposal of MSW and burning of plastic inside the forest area expeditiously which was not followed upon.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal

respondent: Ministry of Environment, Forests and Climate Change & Others
summary: NGT directs the Ghaziabad Nagar Nigam to explore the possibility of out-sourcing the MSW composting to avoid further continuous degradation of the atmosphere and adverse impact on the environment besides the life the local residents.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding solid waste management in the railway station of Howrah, West Bengal, 25/04/2017
summary: NGT directs the State PCB to inspect the Howrah Railway station and its yards and verify all the aspects raised by the applicant Subhas Datta and submit a report.

subject: Environment
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding Royal Calcutta Turf Club in Kolkata Maidan releasing effluents without treatment, Kolkata, West Bengal, 25/04/2017
summary: It is alleged by the applicant that considerable amount of effluents without treatment are being discharged and the veterinary hospital maintained by the club for treatment of the horses also releases biomedical wastes. Apart from this, issue of untreated disposal of wastes from the stable has also been raised by the applicant.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding unauthorized construction in Kasauli, Himachal Pradesh, 27/04/2017
petitioner: Society for Preservation of Kasauli and its Environs (SPOKE)
act_referred: Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act 1974, Air (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act 1981
summary: According to two officers (Praveen Gupta and Anil Kumar) of the Himachal Pradesh State Pollution Control Board "there is no prescribed procedure in the Board for submission, processing and passing of the consent under the Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act, 1974 and Air (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act, 1981 and any other matters falling in the jurisdiction of the Board.

subject: Air Pollution
title: Supreme Court order regarding functioning of PUC (Pollution Under Control) centres in Delhi NCR, 28/04/2017
summary: Some of the recommendations of the EPCA Report on the Assessment of Pollution under Control (PUC) Programme in Delhi and NCR submitted in the Supreme Court can be implemented by the Central Government in consultation with the Governments of Delhi, Rajasthan, Haryana and Uttar Pradesh according to the Solicitor General. Matter is adjourned to 26/07/2017 on which date the Solicitor General will inform the Court which are the recommendations that can be implemented without any difficulty.

subject: Industry

summary: NGT finds the inspection report of the unit incomplete as it does not fulfill the very purpose of the inspection which was to get direct material information on the extraction of ground water and quantity of water extracted.

subject: Forests
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding grant of forest clearance for the construction of Agra-Lucknow Expressway, 28/04/2017
summary: NGT directs the Project Proponent UPEIDA (UP Expressways Industrial Development Authority) and MoEF must file joint statement in a tabulated form, giving location of the alleged violation of the provisions of the Forest Act, number of trees felled, details of the cases registered, action taken, order if any, resulting in compounding of the offences and amount of fine imposed and recovered.

subject: Air Pollution
title: Supreme Court bans sale of BS-III vehicles from April 1, 2017
summary: The Supreme Court imposed a ban on sale of BS-III vehicles from April 1, 2017 when the Bharat Stage (BS)-IV emission norms for vehicles will come in force. The apex court also clarified that no new BS-III registration will be allowed April 1 onwards. However, BS-III vehicles sold prior to March 31 will be allowed to register and will need to have proof of sale date for those vehicles.

subject: Health, Food Safety, Pesticides

summary: Pollution Control Board has assured Supreme Court that inspections of factories will be carried out as desired by Prashant Bhushan, counsel appearing for Silicosis Peedit Sangh.

subject: Air Pollution
title: Supreme Court order regarding emission standards for (SO2, Nox and Sox) for industries, 02/05/2017
petitioner: M. C. Mehta, Sangal Papers Ltd.
summary: Supreme Court directs the Union of India as well as the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) to fix SO2, Nox and Sox standards for the industries after giving a hearing to a limited number of authorized representatives of these industries keeping in mind the provisions of the Environment Protection Act, 1986. The standards should be fixed on or before 30th June, 2017.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding exemption of construction projects from the process of environment impact assessment (EIA) and prior environmental clearance, 03/05/2017
petitioner: Society for Protection of Environment & Biodiversity & Others
summary: The Court is of the view that in case any proposal of the States are processed and approval is granted, it shall be communicated to the State concerned that it is subject to decision in the Court (Original Application 677/2016). Also in the event of any proposal that has been processed and draft approval is granted by the MoEF, even those States will also be conveyed about this fact that the proposals are subject to outcome of this Application.

subject: Agriculture
title: Supreme Court order regarding regarding awareness amongst the farmers about Minimum Support Price (MSP), Tamil Nadu, 03/05/2017
petitioner: Tamil Nadu Centre for Public Interest Litigation
judge_name: Dipak Misra, A. M. Khanwilkar, Mohan M. Shantanagoudar
summary: Apex Court asked the Government of Tamil Nadu whether there is any programme in Doordarshan to make aware the farmers about the MSP, establishment of mandies and procurement centres. P.S. Narsimha, Additional Solicitor General appearing for the State of Tamil Nadu, has asked for time to obtain instructions in this regard.

subject: Air Pollution
title: Supreme Court order regarding refusal of RTO to register tractors and construction equipment citing violation of SC Judgement of 09/05/2017
summary: The matter deals with the refusal of Motor Vehicle Registering Authority (RTO) to register agricultural tractors and construction equipments of the East Delhi Municipal Corporation on the ground that this has been prohibited by the Supreme Court. Apex Court states that the orders related to Rule 115-A of Central Motor Vehicle Rules, 1989 and did not touch upon any of the vehicles mentioned under Rule 115-A.

subject: Forests
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding confiscation of vehicles carrying teak wood by Forest Development Corporation, Dhuma District, Seoni, Madhya Pradesh, 08/05/2017
summary: Supreme Court sets aside the judgment of the High Court which had said that the confiscation under the law was not permissible unless the guilt of the accused is completely established.

subject: Natural Disasters
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding unprecedented flood and landslide disaster in Uttarakhand in 2013, 08/05/2017
summary: Supreme Court while disposing of the writ petitions observed that here has been sufficient compliance with the provisions of the Disaster Management Act, 2005 and it is not necessary for us to issue any particular directions. Apex Court further suggests it would be advisable for the NDMA to regularly publish its Annual Report (the last one on record is of 2013-14), to review and update all plans on the basis of experiences and to make its website ndma.gov.in multilingual so that all concerned may benefit.

subject: Health, Food Safety, Pesticides
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding leak of chemical gas from the tanker at Tughlakabad, Delhi, 08/05/2017
respondent: State of NCT of Delhi & Others
act_referred: Code of Civil Procedure 1908, National Green Tribunal Act 2010
summary: The matter deals with the leak of chemical gas from the tanker at Tughlakabad, Delhi, in which nearly 480 school going children had to be hospitalized. NGT rules that the chemical tanker violated the directions of the Court which had directed that the non-destined vehicles would not have entered Delhi including Containers. NGT directs notice to be issued to Container Corporation of India; NCT, Delhi; Delhi Development Authority; Delhi Pollution Control Committee; Railway Board and Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change. They are required to file response stating as to whether this vehicle was destined for Delhi or was for distant destined tanker, whose chemical - gas was being carried on by the tanker, who is owner of the tanker and what precautionary steps were taken to ensure this hazardous gas which primarily being used for pesticides and highly pollutant product manufacturing to avoid any adverse impact on environment and/or public health.

subject: Air Pollution
title: Supreme Court order regarding refusal of RTO to register tractors and construction equipment citing violation of SC Judgement of 29/03/2017
summary: Apex Court states that the orders related to Rule 115-A of Central Motor Vehicle Rules, 1989 and did not touch upon any of the vehicles mentioned under Rule 115-A.

subject: Industry
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding existence of 2 sugarcane factories within the radius of 15 km, village Yadrav, Raibagh Taluk, Belgaum District, Karnataka, 09/05/2017
summary: Apex Court disposes of the Application by allowing Shivashakti Sugars Limited to continue its operation subject to the condition that 14 villages which were originally assigned to Shree Renuka Sugar Limited would be re-allotted to it after taking these villages from Shivashakti Sugars Limited.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding industrial pollution caused by lack of functional CETP, Loni, Ghaziabad, Uttar Pradesh, 12/06/2017
summary: NGT in its Order Dated 29/05/2017 had directed UPSIDC (Uttar Pradesh State Industrial Development Corporation) to make the CETP functional positively and report compliance. But NGT notes with dismay the report submitted by Central Pollution Control Board which speaks of inaction on the part of UPSIDC because of which there is a severe pollution and adverse impact on the environment. NGT imposes a cost of Rs. Rs. 2 lakh per day to be paid by UPSIDC till the STP is made functional and the orders are complied with.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding waste management in Delhi, 15/05/2017
summary: NGT directs the Department of Urban Development, NCT Delhi to file their action plan as well as the Central Pollution Control Board, some of the States and Ministries of Urban Development who have not filed their Replies to the Status Report, in furtherance to the directions issued in the main case of Almitra H. Patel.

subject: Health, Food Safety, Pesticides
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding Tughlakabad Gas Leak, Delhi, 15/05/2017
respondent: State of NCT of Delhi & Others
act_referred: Code of Civil Procedure 1908,  National Green Tribunal Act 2010, Manufacturing Storage and Import of Hazardous Chemical Rules 1989
summary: NGT directs Dr. Y.K. Gupta, Head of Pharmacology Department, AIIMS to file a complete Report with regard to their visit on the site in question, as it has been reported that residents of that area are handling such chemicals on a regular basis. The Court also requested All India Institute of Medical Science to submit a supplementary Report on people who got effected from the leakage and whether they have suffered any serious health consequences. NGT also stresses upon the fact that this is not only a source of public health hazard but a substantial environmental issue as it generates large scale of dust which is a source of air pollution bringing down the ambient air quality in Delhi.

subject: Mining

act_referred: Mines and Mineral (Development & Regulations) Act 1957, Indian Forest Act 1927
summary: From the status reports and affidavits that have been filed NGT notes that it is evident that illegal mining of minor minerals has been carried on mechanically and also through suction pumps put into the water body quite near to the railway track. NGT directs a committee to be constituted which shall make a complete and comprehensive study and submit a report state the damage caused to the environment, ecology and bio-diversity in village Kalyanpur, Pargana Nawabganj, Tehsil Tarabganj District Gonda and the quantum of money requiring for restoration thereof. It will also state the loss of revenue to the State Government in terms of minerals as well as revenue.

subject: Air Pollution

summary: NGT permits the State Transport Corporation to buy the diesel buses provided they are BS-IV compliant.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding pollution caused by industries in RIICO Industries Area, Bhiwadi, Rajasthan, 22/05/2017

Further, they would provide Rain Water Harvesting System within the premises of the industry within the time provided for to carry out remediation.

subject: Air Pollution

subject: Water Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding open defecation and waste dumping on Yamuna floodplains, 23/05/2017
summary: NGT directs that the Central Pollution Control Board and the various State Boards in consultation with the Municipal Corporations and the Local Authorities to identify the villages near the industrial clusters or even otherwise, where in pursuit of corporate social responsibility, the industries paying environmental compensation are directed to construct toilets which are in villages nearby and locality specific. NGT also directs the South Delhi Municipal Corporation, East Delhi Municipal Corporation and North Delhi Municipal Corporation to submit list of the unauthorized colonies where there is shortage of toilets and people are indulging in open defecation. They will identify places particularly adjacent to railway tracks and flood plains of river Yamuna where such toilets can be provided to ensure that there is no open defecation in these areas.

subject: Mining
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding diversion of 79.56 hectares of forest land for iron ore mining East Bhanupratappur forest division, Kanker District Chhattisgarh, 23/05/2017
petitioner: Pallamari Pahadivali Banjari Devi Jan Seva Samiti
respondent: Ministry of Environment, Forest & Climate Change & Others
act_referred: Forest Conservation Act 1982, Forest Conservation Rules 2003, Forest Conservation Act 1980
summary: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal (Central Zonal Bench, Bhopal) in the matter of Pallamari Pahadivali Banjari Devi Jan Seva Samiti Vs Ministry of Environment, Forest & Climate Change & Others dated 23/05/2017 regarding order dated 04.01.2017 & 05.01.2017 passed by the Union of India and State of Chhattisgarh respectively for the diversions of 79.56 hectares of forest land for iron ore mining in East Bhanupratappur forest division in favour of M/s Monnet Ispat and Energy Ltd. in Kanker District Chhattisgarh. It is contended by the the Appellant (Pallamari Pahadivali Banjari Devi Jan Seva Samiti) that based upon the document that the SDO (Forest), Bhanupratapgarh, District Kanker, Chhattisgarh in his communication had clearly spelt out that the density of the forest was between 0.7 & 0.8. He has also drawn our attention to the guidelines issued by the State in which it has been provided that where the density of the forest is 0.6 or more no permission for diversion should be granted. NGT directs that the order dated 04.01.2017 deserves to be set aside for consideration and that the issue be decided at the earliest.

subject: Industry

summary: Counsel appearing for Nuclear Power Corporation of India Limited (NPCIL) submits that the Forest Department and the Government of Haryana should cooperate with them and identify the places near the proposed nuclear power plant (Gorakhpur Nuclear Power Plant) where water holes for animals should be provided without any undue delay.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding air and water pollution and consequent health hazards around the premises of Associate Cement Company Ltd., Bilaspur, Himachal Pradesh, 23/05/2017
summary: The Chief Medical Officer assures that he will take all possible steps to ensure treatment of the people who have suffered from the pulmonary, skin, ENT and other diseases.

summary: NGT directs NCT, Delhi and all the four Municipal Corporations and Delhi Cantonment Board to be present before the Tribunal on the next date of hearing and inform the court their proposal for dealing with the dumps of waste lying in various corners of Delhi particularly at Bhalswa, Ghaziapur and Okhla.

subject: Industry
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal a drug industry operating without consent to operate, RIICO Industries Area, Bhiwadi, Rajasthan, 23/05/2017
summary: Counsel appearing for the Applicant (M/s Shanti Drugs Pvt. Ltd.) submits that they would pay environmental compensation of Rs. 15 lakhs and would carry out all the recommendations and directions issued by the Joint Inspection Team in their Inspection note within a period of three months. NGT directs the industry to carry out all the directions issued by the Joint Inspection team within a period of three months and also obtain permission from the CGWA and also comply with all the other requirements of law in relation to operation of this industry. Otherwise the Joint Inspection Team shall shut down the unit which will not be permitted to operate thereafter.

subject: Health, Food Safety, Pesticides
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding use of lead in manufacturing of Polyvinyl Chloride (PVC) pipes and other products, 25/05/2017
respondent: Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change & Others
act_referred: Environment (Protection) Act 1986, Bureau of Indian Standards Act 1986, Bureau of Indian Standards Rules 1987, EPA Act 1986
summary: The Applicant Jan Sahyog Manch has also prayed for stringent directions for withdrawing the PVC pipes out of the market which are containing lead based heat stabilizer. MoEF&CC has been directed by NGT : 1. To Notify The Quality Standards Of Lead To Be Used For PVC Pipes Within Four Months, 2. To Lay Down The Standards For Presence Of Lead In PVC Pipes In Consultation With BIS and 3. To Draw Up A Programme For Phasing Out Of Lead As Stabilizer In PVC Pipes.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation

NGT expressed its displeasure at the report submitted by the Junior Engineer of the State Pollution Control Board and said that the report is primarily prepared for convenience of the hotel.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding laying of sewer pipeline for village Shobhapur, Meerut, Uttar Pradesh, 26/05/2017
act_referred: Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act 1974
summary: It is the case of the Applicant Ashutosh Kumar Sharma that the said drain is just above the drinking water pipeline of the applicant which possibly will result in contamination of the drinking water supply in the entire village consisting of about 20,000 residents. NGT directs Municipal Corporation, Meerut to construct a good quality Nala/drain, in such a way so that there is no possibility of leakage under the guidance of qualified engineers and also care should be taken to ensure that in future sewage pipeline or nala/drain should not be constructed in the alignment of drinking water. The Court also directs the Applicant stop exploitation of groundwater for personal use till he obtains necessary permissions from the Central Groundwater Authority/State Groundwater Authority.

subject: Environment
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding noise pollution caused by a club, Noida, Uttar Pradesh, 26/05/2017
respondent: Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change & Others
summary: The Applicant has also prayed for issuance of of appropriate directions for closure of the said Punjabi Club and similar nature clubs, situated within 100 mts. radius of any hospital in order to enforce the ‘silence zone’ as stipulated in the Noise Pollution (Regulation and Control) Rules, 2000 and the comprehensive guidelines framed by the UPPCB. NGT directs the club to strictly conform to the prescribed noise levels and that there should be no occasion for them to be a nuisance to the public residing nearby and that there should be a complete ban on the use of loudspeakers to curtail the noise pollution.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding encroachment alongside railway tracks, Chennai, Tamil Nadu, 26/05/2017
summary: Counsel appearing for the State of Tamil Nadu has submitted that the State Government is prepared to spend the amount for the purpose of rehabilitation of encroachers, so that the encroachers of the railway lands can be removed but wants sharing of financial burden in respect of the activities.

summary: The affidavit filed by the Project Proponent as well as the State of Punjab states that that there are certain deficiencies which are still persisting in the functioning of the plant. Secondly, they are not able to take 100% sewage generated, for treatment of it in accordance with law. The Project Proponent submits that within two weeks all deficiencies would be set right positively and plant would become 100% operate by that time. NGT makes it clear that in the event of default Rs. 10 Lakh as environment compensation would be imposed.

subject: Environment

summary: NGT issues show cause notice to all the Chairmen of the respective Boards who have not been appointed in consonance with the Judgment of the Tribunal. They shall show cause as to why they should not be asked to cease functioning as Chairman of the respective Boards.

subject: Mining
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding illegal sand mining in the middle river Bhima, District Sholapur, Maharashtra, 30/05/2017
summary: NGT disposes of the Application by stating that Sustainable Sand Mining Management Guidelines of 2016 clearly prohibits in-stream mining and that the mechanical riverbed mining is also impermissible except where the mining is carried on in consonance with the Rules and the Guidelines.

compensation: Compensation ranging from 5 Lakhs to 10 Lakhs

summary: Application dismissed by NGT as as the miner has valid mining lease area which does not fall with in the Aravali plantation. The court rejects the satellite images attached to the application saying that it merely shows that the area has been mined but it cannot be an evidence of the fact that beyond the leased area (khasra no. 211/3/2) mining activity was carried on by the miner.

subject: Wildlife and Biodiversity

summary: Court directs that any activity undertaken in Periyar Tiger Reserve shall be in accordance with law and as per the approval granted by NTCA (National Tiger Conservation Authority) for the territorial areas situated in Kerala as well as Tamil Nadu.

subject: Land, Agriculture, Animal Care and Fisheries
title: Order of the High Court of Rajasthan to declare cow as national animal of India, 31/05/2017
summary: Rajasthan High Court recommends for cow to be declared as the national animal of India. The Court pointed out that India is an agro-based country and that the majority of the population is dependent on agriculture and livestock and also taking into consideration section 48 and 51 A (G) of the Constitution of India Rajasthan High Court recommends that cows should have Legal Entity and they should be declared as the national animal for its protection. The Court further declares the Rajasthan governor and the Government of Rajasthan as Persons in Loco Parentis (in the place of a parent) to cows and directs them to take effective steps for their protection and upkeep.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation

summary: NGT directs Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change to conduct a meeting of all the Principal Secretaries of Environment of the Coastal States within two weeks and the entire course of action for finalization of hazardous line as well as notification of CZMP is to be adopted in that meeting.

summary: NGT directs the Respondents including Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change to file their responses before the next date of hearing (17/07/2017).

subject: Sanitation
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding functioning of the STP at Amritsar, 20/06/2017
summary: NGT notes that the bacterial culture and the chlorination processing plant which is said to be now at the slab stage, are yet to be completed apart from some others pointed out by the Punjab Water Supply and Sewerage Board. In view of the specific and categorical submissions made on behalf of the Project Proponent that the STP has the capacity to take in the complete load of 95 MLD, Court directs the Sewerage Board to release the entire contracted quantum which is 95 MLD. In the event of any adverse impact on the environment arising, if any, as a result thereof, the Project Proponent shall be held entirely responsible.
