In the meeting all the eight clusters (for processing the municipal waste generated in the entire State) shall be the subject matter of thorough discussion.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding pollution caused by Khatima Fibres Ltd., Uttarakhand, 11/07/2017
respondent: Uttarakhand Environment Protection and Pollution Control Board & Others
summary: NGT directs that Khatima Fibres Ltd. shall bring its TSS (Total Suspended Solid) value as close as possible to 30 mg/l and would also ensure that their effluent from the outlet of the ETP is recycled to the extent it is possible but in any case not more than 25% of the effluent shall be discharged into the drain.

subject: Water Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding thermal power plants located in the basin area of river Ganga discharging effluents into river Ganga, Uttar Pradesh, 12/07/2017
petitioner: Indian Council for Enviro- Legal Action (ICELA)
respondent: Ministry Of Environment And Forests (MOEF) & Others
summary: NGT directs MoEF and CPCB to conduct a joint inspection of the thermal power plant at Panki, Kanpur and submit a detailed report to the Tribunal.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding construction activities in the city of Shimla, Himachal Pradesh, 12/07/2017
summary: The Court expresses its displeasure at the delay of the Himachal Pradesh Government to file their response/objections to the report submitted before the Tribunal. NGT grants final opportunity to the State of Himachal Pradesh to submit its response/objections, if any, additional or otherwise.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding solid waste management of hotels and malls in Delhi, 12/07/2017
summary: The counsel appearing for the MoEF submits that he will seek instruction whether M/s. Lemon Tree Hotel has been inspected or not. No reply to the show cause notice has been filed. NGT grants last opportunity to file the reply.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding construction of a temple in a green area in Noida, Uttar Pradesh, 13/07/2017
summary: NGT dismisses the Application because the Applicant is not able to substantiate the allegations and also the nature of dispute is not within the scope of Section 14 of the National Green Tribunal Act, 2010.

subject: Water Pollution
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding Ganga river pollution, 13/07/2017
judge_name: Swatanter Kumar, Jawad Rahim, Raghuvendra S. Rathore
act_referred: Environmental Protection Rules 1986, Hazardous Waste Management Rules 2016
summary: NGT notes that GAP I and GAP II has failed to yield the required results and on the contrary there has been tremendous increase in the industrial and sewage pollution load in river Ganga and its tributaries. That at Haridwar, Uttarakhand the natural flow of river Ganga is 31,000 cusecs, after which gets is reduced to 4000 cusecs when it reaches Kanpur and from certain STPs/CETPs, even the effluents directly enter river Ganga and its tributaries either because of overflow or the bypass created by such plants due to of low capacity of the plant.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding the Environmental Clearance (EC) granted by the SEIAA for a housing project, Poisar Village, Mumbai, Maharashtra, 14/07/2017
respondent: Ministry of Environment, Forests and Climate Change & Others
act_referred: Environmental Impact Assessment Notification 2006, Environmental Clearance Regulations 2006, Wildlife Conservation Act
summary: The project is a redevelopment project of a colony situated at Poisar Village, Mumbai. The impugned environmental clearance is for proposed expansion of the redevelopment project which was originally granted environmental clearance on 28th December, 2011. NGT disposed of the Application as it found no merit in the contentions raised challenging the EC.

subject: Fisheries
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding fishing with purse-seine gear/net and its adverse impact of marine biodiversity, 14/07/2017
petitioner: Sindhudurg Jilha Shramajivi Rapan Machhimar Sangh & Others
act_referred: Maharashtra Marine Fisheries Regulation Act 1981, Environment (Protection) Act 1986, Biological Diversity Act 2002
summary: NGT finds that the case deals with a substantial question relating to marine environment and arising out of implementation of the provisions of Environment (Protection) Act, 1986 and the Acts specified in Schedule-I of the NGT Act, 2010 thus arises in the present case due to inaction of the Central Government to discharge its obligations and take necessary steps for restitution of environment.

subject: Mining
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding mining in and around Parikrama Kshetra in District Bharatpur in Nagar and Pahadi Tehsil, Rajasthan, 14/07/2017
summary: NGT directs the chairman of the committee constituted by the Government of Rajasthan to visit the area and submit its report and recommendations with observations on the issues being highlighted by the Sadhu Samaj Samiti and also look into the grievances of the mining leaseholders who have been granted valid leases and environmental clearances. NGT's Order clearly states that a balance between both sides may be observed keeping in view the interest of the Sadhu Samaj Samiti which is advocating the interest of the pilgrims and yatris and also the mining lease owners. More importantly the forest department shall bring to the notice of the committee the steps which have been taken with regard to the restoration of the environment and forest in the areas where the mining operations had been ordered to be closed.

subject: Sanitation
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding cleaning of drains in Delhi clogged with silt and municipal solid waste, Delhi, 17/07/2017
respondent: National Capital Territory of Delhi & Others
summary: NGT appoints counsels as Local Commissioners and directs them to visit the drains of North, South and East Delhi Municipal Corporations. Tribunal also directs that Trunk Drain No. 1 (passing through Seelampur) to be cleaned by the NCT Delhi, Department of Irrigation and Flood Control department within one week and ensure that there shall be no remnant of municipal solid waste and other waste and silt should be seen in the drain after the lapse of one week.

subject: Hazardous Waste
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding bio-medical waste management of hospitals in Kolkata, West Bengal, 17/07/2017
respondent: West Bengal Pollution Control Board & Others
summary: NGT grants the erring hospitals a final opportunity to comply with the pollution norms as recommended by the State PCB within three months. This shall include obtaining authorisations, consents to operate and completion of ETPS.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding damage to health caused by Associate Cement Company Ltd., Barmana, District Bilaspur, Himachal Pradesh, 18/07/2017
summary: Secretary, State of Himachal Pradesh submits that the Government has entered into a dialogue with the PGI, Public Health Department for conducting proper research to substantiate the damage caused by the cement plant.

subject: Water Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding dumping of garbage on the river bed of River Yamuna by Mathura Cantonment Board, Uttar Pradesh, 18/07/2017
summary: NGT directs that the sum of Rs. 10 lakhs that the Cantonment Board is directed to pay to Central Pollution Control Board shall be paid to CPCB, however, the Cantonment Board will submit its proposal along with its payment, the manner in which they wish to develop the dumping site maintained by it.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding running of a ferro alloy manufacturing unit in village Lakhi Happa, Papumpare District, Arunachal Pradesh, 18/07/2017
summary: NGT directs the State PCB and the SEIAA, Arunachal Pradesh to inspect the units in question and verify as to whether the allegations contained in the Original Application are correct or not and file a report.

subject: Forests
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding running of a children's club in a reserve Langol Reserve Forest area, Manipur, 18/07/2017
summary: NGT notes that it is a clear contravention of the Forest (Conservation) Act, 1980, making the concerned authorities of the Forest Department, Govt. of Manipur, liable for penalty as provided in Sec. 3 of the Forest (Conservation) Act, 1980. NGT directs the State Respondents to file the Report of the DFO (Divisional Forest Office) as well as other documents.

subject: Mining
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding stone crushers operating unauthorisedly and illegally in the state of Uttar Pradesh, 19/07/2017
respondent: Ministry of Environment, Forests and Climate Change & Others
summary: It is laid before the Tribunal that the 21 offending stone crushers have been shut down and sealed by the administration. NGTdisposes of this Application with the directions that none of these sealed stone crushers would be permitted to operate unless they obtain consent from the State Pollution Control Board; proper no objection certificate from the concerned authorities and have the environmental clearance from the competent authority.

subject: Environment
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding a proposed dam on river Parwan affecting 1835 hectares forest land, Jhalawar District, Rajasthan, 19/07/2017
summary: The Tribunal expressed its satisfaction with the Wildlife, Environmental and Forest Clearance granted by MoEF as well as the various other clearances by the Ministry of Water Resources which the Court found to be in accordance with law. NGT directs the State Water Resources or any other department charged with the responsibility of the maintaining dam and flow of water in the river to ensure that downstream of the dam e-flow is maintained in Parwan river at all times so that there is no adverse impact on the aquatic life and also on the wild animals that may be traditionally using this river for drinking purposes.

subject: River Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding disposal of industrial waste into river Ganga by the leather industries of Kanpur, Uttar Pradesh, 20/07/2017
summary: NGT disposes of the Applications with the direction that a Joint inspection team shall inspect all the units even if they are not operational and submit a report before the Tribunal, which should be complete and comprehensive. It must be noticed whether the leather industries Primary Effluent Treatment Plant have been upgraded and there is a due system for discharge of Chromium.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding noise and dust pollution resulting from laying down of railway line by DMRC, 20/07/2017
summary: Counsel appearing for D.M.R.C. states that the premises in question, has already been vacated and it is ensured that the site will be properly restored, with at least 500 trees planted on 1.19 acres of land.

subject: Environment
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding degradation of environment at Rohtang Pass, Himachal Pradesh, 21/07/2017
summary: National Green Tribunal directed the Himachal Pradesh government to file an affidavit stating the number of taxis operating in Kulu and Manali under the different associations as well as a status report on the ropeway project on the Manali-Rohtang road. It also directed sarpanch of the Palchan panchayat, which had opposed the 9 km long Palchan-Rohtang ropeway, to appear before it on the Next hearing on.

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding damage to Yamuna flood plains during the holding of the three day Art of Living event in Delhi, 21/07/2017
respondent: Art of Living International Center & Others
summary: NGT directs the Delhi Development Authority to nominate a very senior officer as a Member of the Committee which shall constitute of the Chief Engineer, Irrigation Department, NCT of Delhi and Chief Engineer, Irrigation Department, Uttar Pradesh. This Committee shall submit an Action Plan to the Tribunal with reference to the flood plains of river Yamuna where the event was held in March, 2016. This Committee shall prepare the action plan keeping in view the report of the Expert Committee appointed by the Tribunal within one week.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding pollution caused by an industry in Muzaffarnagar, Uttar Pradesh, 21/07/2017
summary: NGT takes notes of the two inspection reports of the joint inspection team which states that the industry has installed all the anti-pollution devices directed by the joint inspection team and as of present, if the devices operate properly, the industry is not likely to cause any pollution. Taking into consideration the Joint Inspection Report NGT allows the industry to carry on its manufacturing activity with immediate effect and the industry shall be liable to pay a sum of Rs. 15 lakhs as environmental compensation. NGT also directs that the industry shall within a period of three months install in an open area an RO Plant in discharge of its corporate social responsibility to ensure that the villagers around that area can get the water which is portable and can safely be consumed by the residents residing in that area.

subject: Environment
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding the proposed international airport at Mopa village in Goa, 21/07/2017
summary: Taking into consideration the Joint Inspection Report NGT allows the industry to carry on its manufacturing activity with immediate effect and the industry shall be liable to pay a sum of Rs. 15 lakhs as environmental compensation. NGT also directs that the industry shall within a period of three months install in an open area an RO Plant in discharge of its corporate social responsibility to ensure that the villagers around that area can get the water which is portable and can safely be consumed by the residents residing in that area.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding industrial units causing pollution, Ganesh Khariberia Village, Purba Khariberia, West Bengal, 21/07/2017
respondent: West Bengal Pollution Control Board & Others
summary: NGT directs the State PCB to inspect the industrial units to verify on the allegations contained in the OA (Original Application) and file a report before the next date.

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding the proposed construction of a centre of Aligarh Muslim University on the bank of river Mahananda in Kishanganj district, Bihar, 21/07/2017
act_referred: River Ganga (Rejuvenation, Protection and Management) Authorities Order 2016, Sustainable Sand Mining Management Guidelines 2016
summary: NGT directs notice to be issued to the Respondents.

subject: Environment
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding utilisation of the money deposited as penalty with the State Board, West Bengal, 21/07/2017
summary: The prayer is considered and allowed. However, the Court makes it clear that the exercise for working out action plan for the remaining districts shall also be prepared and filed before the court for similar direction.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding fly ash brick units operating without clearance Ganjam District, Odisha, 21/07/2017
summary: Counsel representing the fly ash brick units has sought permission to sell the existing stock of fly ash bricks produced by them prior to passing of the interim order dated 24.4.2017 undertaking that they shall not manufacture such bricks before obtaining NOC from the Central Ground Water Authority. NGT has agreed to the request.

subject: Mining
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding illegal mining and sinking of the area in and around Umaria, Madhya Pradesh, 21/07/2017
summary: NGT directs that the matter be taken up on an urgent basis so as to take necessary steps in accordance with the recommendations to prevent loss of any life and property. At the same time, the Court also directed that the Expert Appraisal Committee (EAC) to involve the State Government and / or District Administration along with South Eastern Coalfields (SECL) in this behalf.

subject: Mining
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding shutting down of mining operations in mines where coal fires are currently burning, 24/07/2017
summary: NGT disposes off the Application on the ground that the Supreme Court has issued several directions from time to time and is still monitoring the issues, thus it is desirable to await further orders of the Supreme Court.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding consent to operate for Nusrat Tannery, Kanpur, Uttar Pradesh, 25/07/2017
respondent: Uttar Pradesh Pollution Control Board Pvt. Ltd.
summary: NGT disposes of this Application with the permission to the Applicant that if he has complied with all the conditions that have been imposed, the industry should approach Uttar Pradesh Pollution Control Board for issuance of consent to operate which should be complete, comprehensive and definite in all respects. If such application is moved, the unit shall be subjected to an inspection by the joint inspection team, report of which shall be submitted before the Tribunal.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding Consent to Operate for M/s Paramount Tanning Industries, Kanpur, Uttar Pradesh, 25/07/2017
summary: The joint inspection team after inspection of the unit has submitted the report. In that report, it has been stated that the unit is compliant and non polluting and in fact, it has been recommended that the unit may be permitted to operate. In view of that report, the Court permits the industry to operate in accordance with law and subject to inspection on regular intervals.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding municipal solid waste management in public buildings and public spaces of Delhi, 25/07/2017
summary: All the Corporations, through their Commissioners, are directed to file affidavit stating as to how they propose to deal with the dumping sites under their jurisdiction and any proposed action for construction of waste to energy or any other plant to deal with the municipal solid waste in Delhi. All the Corporations are directed to give the exact quantum of waste being generated in Delhi.

subject: Water Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding discharge of toxic waste by the factories at the Pharma City, Dehradun into River Yamuna, 25/07/2017
summary: National Green Tribunal directs the Uttarakhand Pollution Control Board to submit affidavit stating the time period from which the industries have been operating without consent of the Board. The Uttarakhand Pollution Control Board and the representative of the Central Pollution Control Board shall conduct a joint inspection of all these industries (14) and submit a complete and comprehensive report before the Tribunal within four weeks.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding steel pickling units in Delhi, 25/07/2017
respondent: State of NCT of Delhi & Others
summary: National Green Tribunal directs Delhi Pollution Control Committee to file affidavit as to why they have not complied with the order of the Tribunal and issued directions under the relevant provision of Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act, 1974 and Air (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act, 1981 for closure of these industries and consequent to it disconnection of electricity.

subject: Air Pollution
title: Supreme Court order regarding air pollution caused by bursting of fire crackers, 26/07/2017
summary: The Court noted that no standards have been laid down by the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) with regard to air pollution caused by bursting of fire crackers and it is also not clear whether "Petroleum & Explosives Safety Organization (PESO) is capable of determining the extent of air pollution that could be caused by bursting of fire crackers". Counsel for the State of NCT of Delhi submitted before the Court that within three weeks a vigorous campaign will be started in the schools in Delhi to inform the children about the hazardous and ill-effects of the indiscriminate bursting of fire crackers.

subject: Pesticides & Toxins
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding insecticide manufacturers are circumventing the mandatory requirement of obtaining EC, 27/07/2017
summary: National Green Tribunal rules that the expression ‘pesticides’ squarely takes within its ambit and scope the expression ‘insecticides’ as well. Resultantly, all the manufacturers of insecticides and particularly the private respondents are liable to take prior EC in terms of the Notification of 2006. Court also direts MoEF&CC to issue a public notice and a general circular to all the Pollution Control Boards and other competent authorities informing them about this judgement of the Tribunal and providing a period of six weeks to the private respondents and all other manufacturers of insecticides to apply for obtaining the EC for manufacturing of such insecticides.

subject: Air Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding registration of BS-IV compliant diesel trucks, Delhi, 28/07/2017
judge_name: Swatanter Kumar, Jawad Rahim, Raghuvendra S. Rathore
summary: Application filed by the Delhi Cantonment Board is allowed by the Tribunal subject to the condition that the diesel trucks of Delhi Cantonment Board which are 10 years old will not be used any more and they will be auctioned for the purpose of dismantling and/or being plied in the area outside of Delhi which have been identified as the area where the ambient air quality is within the prescribed standards. The new trucks would be registered only after this and they shall be used by the Delhi Cantonment Board only for transportation of waste and will not be used for any private purpose.

subject: Air Pollution
title: Supreme Court order regarding air pollution by the bursting of firecrackers, 31/07/2017
summary: Supreme Court directs that no fire-crackers manufactured shall contain antimony, lithium, mercury, arsenic and lead in any form whatsoever and it is the responsibility of the Petroleum and Explosive Safety Organisation (PESO) to ensure compliance particularly in Sivakasi. Apex Court also makes it clear that for setting up of standards, collaborative efforts will be made between CPCB and PESO.

subject: Forests
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding large scale illegal felling of trees near Tara Devi Temple, Shimla, Himachal Pradesh, 01/08/2017
summary: NGT states that both the seller and the purchaser are the beneficiary of the illegal and unauthorized felling of trees which has caused immense adverse impact on the environment and ecology of the area, thus it is of the view that both the seller and the purchaser are responsible for payment of environmental compensation in terms of Section 15 and 17 of the NGT Act, 2010.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding change in the classification of the panchayat area from CRZ III to CRZ II, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, 01/08/2017
act_referred: CRZ Notification 2011, Coastal Zone Management Plan
summary: NGT in its Order said that the Kerala Coastal Zone Management Authority has to conduct public hearing on all districts before finalising the draft Coastal Zone Management Plan of Kerala and know the views of the Panchayat. In addition if it is a developed Panchayat then it has to be classified as CRZ-II developed area. At present all the Panchayat areas are classified as CRZ-III.

subject: Mining
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding illegal mining in Keonjhar, Sundargarh and other Districts of Odisha, 02/08/2017
act_referred:
Mines and Minerals (Development and Regulation)
 Act 1957, Forest (Conservation) Act 1980, Environment (Protection) Act 1986, Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act 1981, Mineral Concession Rules 1960, Minerals (other than Atomic and Hydrocarbons Energy Minerals) Concession Rules 2016, Mineral Concessions Rules 1960
summary: Supreme Court directs the Union of India to have a "fresh look at the National Mineral Policy, 2008 which is almost a decade old, particularly with regard to conservation and mineral development. The exercise should be completed by 31st December, 2017". The Judgement also mentions that some of the mining lease holders had deposited an amount of Rs.237.05 crores for utilization by the SPV (Special Purpose Vehicle) for carrying out welfare works and activities in the districts of Keonjhar, Sundergarh and Mayurbhanj in Odisha.

subject: Industry
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding the industrial unit of M/s Proctor and Gamble Home handling hazardous products without obtaining EC, Mandideep, Raisen District, Madhya Pradesh, 03/08/2017
summary: NGT in its Judgement states that the requirement of EC is not applicable in the case of M/s Proctor and Gamble Home unit in Mandideep. Court directs that precaution needs to be adopted by the unit in handling hazardous materials and it is duty bound that such labour which is engaged should be adequately explained the hazards if any that they may encounter while handling such material and further that the labour handling such material should watch out for and report any particular symptoms that would indicate any ill effects of handling of such materials.

subject: Air Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding registration of diesel vehicles which are BS-IV compliant, Delhi NCR, 03/08/2017
summary: NGT allows the Application subject to the condition that Indian Oil Corporation has not got any diesel truck/vehicle which are more than 10 years old and the they are not plying any such vehicle carrying on for petroleum and other products in NCR Delhi.

subject: Forests
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding forest fires across the State of Uttarakhand and Himachal Pradesh, 03/08/2017
summary: NGT directs that the MoEF & CC in consultation with the States formulate National policy/Guidelines for forest fire prevention and control, which should be updated periodically. It should also issue directions under Section 5 of the Environment Protection Act, 1986 to the States to prepare and implement forest fire management plan for effective prevention and control of forest fires in the respective States. NGT also makes it clear that the first lot of such policy should be issued within 3 months from the date of passing of this judgment.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding the municipal solid waste management plant of Bathinda, Punjab, 04/08/2017
summary: NGT in its Order said that as a result of non-functioning of the plant, it is the public health and environment at large, which is the victim. The plant at Bathinda was pilot project in the State of Punjab and on the basis of which remaining clusters; were to be constructed, but nothing has advanced, even this plant practically come to a halt causing serious public health and environmental degradation in the area of Bathinda.

subject: Air Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding air pollution resulting from crop residue burning, 04/08/2017
summary: Court takes a stern view of the fact that in spite of the orders and judgement of the NGT the states (Punjab, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh and Rajasthan) have failed to comply with the directions and take preventive precautionary and controlling measures for air pollution resulting from crop burning. NGT grants last and final opportunity for the states to file Action Plans with complete accountability and elements of performance, within one week.

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding conservation of lakes in Balaghat, Madhya Pradesh with special reference to Karamsara Talab, 04/08/2017
summary: The Court has taken a stern view of the fact that despite repeated orders for carrying out the work of Karamsara Talab the work has not even started. NGT directs that the Collector, Balaghat along with the Engineers of the Water Resources Department of district Balaghat who are required to carry out the work shall appear before the Tribunal on the next date of hearing 25/08/2017.

subject: Water Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding rejuvenation of river Ganga, 08/08/2017
summary: NGT directs the stakeholders to file their status reports and the action plan in relation to prevention, control and rejuvenation of river Ganga. If the report is not filed, each State would be liable to pay cost of Rs. 50,000/- each and also their Member Secretaries will be present before the Tribunal.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding grant of consent to operate for M/s Avanti Metals Industries, Uttarakhand, 08/08/2017
respondent: Uttarakhand Environment Protection & Pollution Control Board
summary: NGT permits participation of the CGWA in this proceedings as it appears the location of the factory in question is in Ganga basin.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding municipal solid waste management at Mandi, Himachal Pradesh, 09/08/2017
summary: The Deputy Commissioner, Mandi submits before the Tribunal that the matter in relation to municipal solid waste, landfill and plant at Mandi are being taken up by all concerned authorities with utmost seriousness and certain finances have also been received by him. NGT grants time by way of last opportunity.

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding environmental/ minimum flow of the rivers despite hydro projects, 09/08/2017
respondent: Ministry of Environment, Forests and Climate Change & Others
summary: Counsel appearing for Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change submits that the Ministry has already completed river basin study of 6 river basins i.e. Siang River Basin, Twang River Basin, Bichom River Basin, Subansiri River Basin, Dibang River Basin and Lohit River Basin and upon study the Ministry has recommended the minimum flow of the river to be 18% of the average of lean season flow of the river. However, in some of the cases, it has stated to be even 20%. NGT directs that all the rivers in the country shall maintain minimum 15 % to 20% of the average lean season flow of that river.

subject: Animal Care
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding use of mules in Vaishno Devi shrine, Jammu & Kashmir, 09/08/2017
summary: Counsel appearing for the Shrine Board submits that authorities are making all efforts to comply with the directions of the Tribunal for opening of newly constructed pedestrian way for Ardh-kuwari. The Court directs that the pedestrian path should be opened for public by September 2017 and the State Government shall deploy appropriate force so that no inconvenience is caused to the pilgrims wanting to go by that path.

subject: Wildlife and Biodiversity
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding wildlife casualties due to vehicular movement on the National Highway-37 passing through the Kaziranga National Park, 09/08/2017
summary: Additional Chief Secretary, Government of Assam submits that Wildlife Institute of India has made certain recommendations for improving the sensor barriers installed by the State of Assam. These will be followed and improvement thereto in consultation with the Wildlife Institute of India will be completed by 30th September, 2017 positively. Thereafter they would install more sensor barriers particularly in the areas which are known animal corridors. Court directs that the technological and operational aspects with regard to sensors should be brought to the notice of the Tribunal by filing affidavit and technical data.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding running of M/s.Vinayaka Hot Mix Plant at Karudayampalayam Village, Karur District, Tamil Nadu, 09/08/2017
respondent: Tamil Nadu State Pollution Control Board & Others
summary: NGT Southern Bench disposed of the Application as the unit is not being operated and even the machineries stand dismantled. The unit in fact informed the TNPCB that they will not establish the unit without obtaining prior consent from the Board.

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding environmental/ minimum flow of the rivers despite hydro projects, 09/08/2017
respondent: Ministry Of Environment And Forests (MOEF) & Others
summary:
NGT directs all the rivers in the Country to maintain minimum 15% to 20% of the average lean season flow of that river. However whichever State is unable to adhere to this average percentage, Court grants liberty to that State Government to move the Secretary, Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change who shall in consultation with the Ministry of Water Resources examine such a representation and if it is desirable to fix any lower percentage than the percentage aforestated,
then it will pass appropriate order.

subject: Natural Disasters
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding grant of environmental compensation for the flood of 16-17, June 2013, Uttarakhand, 09/08/2017
summary: The matter relates to grant of environmental compensation under the provision Section 15 of the NGT Act from L & T Uttaranchal Hydropower Ltd. on the plea that the incident of flood resulting in disaster on 16-17, June 2013 was consequent of Singoli-Bhatwari Hydro project in Uttarakhand.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding indiscriminate use and dumping of plastic waste, Delhi, 10/08/2017
summary: NGT Orders that there shall be complete prohibition on use of plastic carry bags, made of plastic less than 50 microns and are noncompostable in entire NCT Delhi, for any purpose whatsoever and the NCT Delhi, Delhi Pollution Control Committee and all public authorities/local bodies shall ensure that sale, storage and use of such plastic at the shops or otherwise is not permitted. Also if any person is found in possession or uses such plastic, shall be liable to pay Environmental compensation of Rs. 5000/- per default.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding high tide line demarcation in relation to coastal area for India, 10/08/2017
respondent: Ministry of Environment Forests and Climate Change & Others
summary: Counsel appearing for Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change states that the security clearance with regard to Western Coastal Areas would be received by the Ministry by 10th September, 2017. NGT directs that the security clearance must be submitted to Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change by 10th September, 2017 and the State Governments of Goa, Maharashtra, Gujarat, Karnataka and Kerala who have already been provided with the high tide line in relation to their coastal areas must prepare their Coastal Zone Management Plan (CZMP) without any delay now and submit the same to Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change for finalization.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding illegal constructions in Matheran an eco-sensitive zone in Maharashtra, 10/08/2017
respondent: Ministry Of Environment And Forests (MOEF) & Others
summary: Counsel for the State of Maharashtra submits that 428 illegal contractions/structures were detected and that demolition action against the illegal structures has been halted on account of Status-Quo order passed by the High Court in the Petitions filed by the holders of such structures.

subject: Water Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding illegal construction and dumping of waste on the banks of the river Mula - Mutha, Pune, 11/08/2017
summary: The Irrigation Department has submitted that demarcation of blue line of river Mutha is complete and it is for the Pune Municipal Corporation to act upon the booklet giving longitudes and latitudes with reference to blue line (no-development zone) and remove the encroachments.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding requirement of consent to operate for poultry farms, Madhya Pradesh, 11/08/2017
petitioner: CH Institute of Management and Commerce & Others
summary: As per the classification of CPCB poultry firms having less than 1 lakh birds do not require ‘Consent to Operate’ as per CPCB guidelines of 20.10.2015. Tribunal directs that the clarification of CPCB dated 19.07.2017 be filed before the Court.

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding the question of permissibility of setting up projects in the upstream of Subansari river, 11/08/2017
summary: Judgement is reserved.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding bio-medical waste treatment facilities of nursing homes and hospitals in Puducherry, 18/08/2017
summary: The Puducherry Pollution Control Committee shall take appropriate action in accordance with law if the directions are not complied and shall submit a report before the Tribunal on the details of the action taken.

subject: Water Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding thermal power plants polluting river Ganga and its tributaries, Uttar Pradesh, 18/08/2017
petitioner: Indian Council for Enviro- Legal Action (ICELA)
respondent: Ministry of Environment and Forest (MoEF) & Others
summary: NGT directs the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change and Central Pollution Control Board to file the report as well as instructions with regard to the four Thermal Plants in State of Uttar Pradesh which are stated to be functioning and/or lying shut down and particularly those which fall on the banks of river Ganga or its tributaries.

subject: Water Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding pollution of ponds and water bodies in Lucknow District, Uttar Pradesh, 18/08/2017
summary: NGT directs the State of Uttar Pradesh along with the concerned local authorities to identify all the water bodies in Lucknow and the same shall be put on the website of the said agencies as well as UPPCB. They shall be kept in public domain as well. The encroachments or any unauthorised construction raised in the area of these water bodies and ponds shall be removed by the local authorities and the State Governments shall provide all assistance to the local bodies.

subject: Wildlife and Biodiversity
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding declaration of protected areas as Eco-sensitive Zones, Sikkim, 21/08/2017
summary: NGT dismisses the Application by stating that adequate exercise was undertaken both by the state and the Union Government to follow the 2011 Guidelines (dated 9.2.2011 issued for identification of ESZs) to the extent possible.

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding illegal works of construction of embankment on the river bed of Mahananda, Kishanganj, Bihar, 21/08/2017
summary: NGT directs District Magistrate, Kishanganj to inspect the area in question and verify as to whether the allegations contained in the Original Application were correct or not and, if found to be true, the construction of embankment and boundary wall on the river bed and the flood plains as well as extraction of minor minerals shall be prohibited.

subject: Water Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding pollution caused to water bodies by industries in South 24 Parganas, West Bengal, 21/08/2017
respondent: West Bengal Pollution Control Board & Others
summary: NGT Eastern Bench directs the State Pollution Control Board to proceed against M/s Solux Galfab (P) Ltd. as the unit has been defying the process of law with impunity and institute coercive proceedings.

subject: Environment
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding the proposed LPG terminal at Puthuvyppe, Kochi, Kerala, 22/08/2017
summary: Counsel appearing for the State of Kerala has submitted before the Tribunal that an Expert Committee has been constituted for fact finding relating to the location of LPG Terminal.

subject: Forests
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding felling of trees by Delhi Cantonment Board, 22/08/2017
respondent: Government of NCT of Delhi & Others
summary: Amicus Curiae submits that more than 3500 saplings have been planted in the Cantonment area. The officers concerned of the Cantonment Board shall ensure that all these plants are looked after well, atleast for a period of 5 years and there are no tree casualties. The Cantonment Board shall not fell any trees except after obtaining permission from the concerned competent authority and thereafter, leave of the Tribunal

subject: Water Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding dumping of waste in Bellandur Lake, Karnataka, 22/08/2017
summary: NGT directs that all the officers shall personally inspect the sites before placing the facts and the proposed action plan before the Tribunal. All the officers would be present before the Tribunal on the next date of hearing (08/09/2017).

subject: Air Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding volatile organic compounds pollution in village Mahul, Chembur, Maharashtra, 23/08/2017
summary: NGT directs the Applicant to to place the inadequacies that he sees in the Comprehensive Action Plan prepared by MPCB on affidavit. Municipal Corporation of Greater Mumbai to place on record the facilities/ emergency measures available at public health centres for handling emergency situations like cardiac arrest, paralysis induced by pollution caused by VOCs.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding municipal solid waste management, Latur, Maharashtra, 23/08/2017
summary: Counsel appearing on behalf of the Latur Municipal Corporation submits that CCTV cameras have been installed at the MSW Plant and dumping site and steps are being taken to install Data Logger System coupled with meter for recording the supply of electricity at the plant and its utilisation. Urban Development Department, Govt. of Maharashtra submits before the Tribunal that the proposal of appointment of the Commissioner for Latur Municipal Corporation has been forwarded to the General Administration, Department of Government of Maharashtra and the decision will be taken by them. NGT asks for speeding up the process for the regular appointment of the Commissioner for the Latur Municipal Corporation.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding construction of a community hall violating coastal zone regulations, Kanyakumari District, Tamil Nadu, 23/08/2017
act_referred: Tamil Nadu Panchayat Act, Tamil Nadu Public Health Act
summary: NGT orders that if the Community hall is falling in the CRZ – III, 'No Development Zone' even after the revision of the CZMP, action may be taken to demolish the structure in accordance with law.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding sanitation and solid waste problems faced by residents of Kalinga Nagar-8, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, 24/08/2017
respondent: Ministry of Urban Development & Housing, Govt. of Odisha & Others
summary: NGT directs construction of STP within a period of one year and also instructs BMC to explore the possibility of installing solid waste-to-energy plant and composting plant for domestic bio-degradable waste.

subject: Governance & Institutions
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding privacy as a constitutionally protected value, 24/08/2017
judge_name: Jagdish Singh Khehar, J. Chelameswar, S. A. Bobde, R. K. Agrawal, Rohinton Fali Nariman, Abhay Manohar Sapre, D. Y. Chandrachud, Sanjay Kishan Kaul, S Abdul Nazeer
summary: Supreme Court rules that "the right to privacy is protected as an intrinsic part of the right to life and personal liberty under Article 21 and as a part of the freedoms guaranteed by Part III of the Constitution".

subject: Industry
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal on whether cellular service providers using generator sets along with towers come under "industrial plant", 24/08/2017
respondent: Madhya Pradesh State Pollution Control Board & Others
act_referred: Air (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act 1981, Hazardous Wastes (Management, Handling and Transboundary Movement) Rules 2008, Water Act 1974, Air (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Amendment Act 1987
summary: National Green Tribunal in its Judgement dated 24/08/2017 declined to quash the order dated 31st March, 2009 passed by the MPPCB and passed some directions which shall be read in consonance with the order dated 28th June, 2012.

subject: Water Pollution
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding pollution caused by tanneries in Jamau, Kanpur, Uttar Pradesh, 25/08/2017
summary: NGT directs that the the Pollution Control Board must ensure that before permitting the industry to start they have complied with all the recommendations and conditions of the consent and obtain permission for extraction of ground water.

subject: Water Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding pollution of water resources in district Gorakhpur and Balia, Uttar Pradesh due to discharge of sewage and industrial effluent, 25/08/2017
respondent: Uttar Pradesh Pollution Control Board & Others
summary: NGT directs the State Government of Uttar Pradesh to file complete and comprehensive affidavit and the Uttar Pradesh Pollution Control Board should also file its report in relation to the above within two weeks.

subject: Air Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding registration of new vehicles of IOC which are BS-IV compliant, 28/08/2017
summary: Tribunal allows the applications subject to the condition that Indian Oil Corporation shall file an affidavit before the registering authority as well before the Tribunal that IOC does not have any diesel truck/ vehicle which are more than 10 years old and that they are not plying any BS-I, BS-II and BS-III vehicle for carrying on petroleum and other products in NCR Delhi and also that these new vehicles are BS-IV compliant.

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding constructions on Yamuna floodplains, Agra, Uttar Pradesh, 29/08/2017
summary: NGT directs demolition of structures falling within 100 meters of the high flood line already demarcated and the projects which are stated to be outside the high flood line would be allowed to complete their constructions subject to compliance of directions.

subject: Water Pollution
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding discharge of effluents by Kerala Minerals and Metals Limited (KMML) into the waterbodies of Chavara, Kollam District, Kerala, 31/08/2017
summary: NGT said that KMML has ignored environmental concern and thus invoked the principle of "polluter pays" and directs KMML to deposit a sum of Rs.1,00,00,000/- (Rupees One Crore only) under “polluter pays” in favour of “Chairman, Kerala State Pollution Control Board” who shall keep the said amount in a separate account named as “Environment relief fund for remediation of Chavara Region due to pollution caused by KMML”.

subject: Air Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding supply of natural gas to Kolkata, West Bengal, 01/09/2017
summary: The Joint Secretary, Ministry of Petroleum & Natural Gas, has informed the Tribunal that the Ministry will also explore the possibility of meeting the demand of GAIL India Ltd. and the Greater Calcutta Gas Supply Corporation Ltd. for CBM (Coal Bed Methane) considering the public interest involved in the matter.

subject: Air Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding crop residue burning, 01/09/2017
summary: The states of Punjab, Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh and Haryana assured the Tribunal that within three weeks they would bring at least 10 cases of preferably marginal farmers to provide due incentive, help and means to them, so that they do not follow traditional methodology of crop residue burning in the field itself.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding destruction of trees as a result of demolition of government residential colonies, Delhi, 04/09/2017
summary: NGT directs the Project Proponent (National Buildings Construction (NBCC) Limited) not to fell any tree without obtaining consent from the concerned authority, in accordance with law. The consent, if granted, shall necessarily include the condition that if any tree is fell or permitted to cut, in place thereof at least 10 trees shall be planted in the same area and it shall also be examined, at the first instance, whether is it possible to transplant the exiting tree within the same area.

subject: Environment
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding construction of bridge over Tena Creek without CRZ clearance, Gujarat, 04/09/2017
summary: Committee constituted to look into the environmental damage done and steps for remediation.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding municipal solid waste management in Delhi, 04/09/2017
summary: NGT directs the Municipal Corporations of Delhi to file complete and comprehensive action plan and the steps to remedy and restore the site at Ghaziur as well as other sanitary landfill sites in NCT Delhi. Also the stage of construction of another waste to energy plant that was proposed by the North Delhi Municipal Corporation and when it is possible to commence this waste to energy plant.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding collection and disposal of municipal solid waste in Srinagar, 05/09/2017
summary: NGT makes it clear that any further delay in addressing the issue would be tolerated particularly as it is leading to the the indiscriminate dumping in Achan lake side. People are stated to have been suffering from different diseases because of this huge dumping and even the water body which is stated to be at a distance of 250 Mtrs. is getting polluted besides the ground water. National Green Tribunal directs that the segregation plant in Srinagar be completed in all respects and that a green belt around the entire area of the site be created and ensure that there is no leachate.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding massive pasting of posters, pamphlets for DUSU Elections 2017, 05/09/2017
summary: The Applicant (Nithin Chandran) informs the Tribunal that despite specific order passed by the Tribunal, the University of Delhi and other concerned authorities are not implementing the directions contained in that order in relation to prohibiting students on the use of posters and pamphlets and defacement of public property.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding greening of public spaces, India, 05/09/2017
petitioner: Society for Protection of Culture, Heritage, Environment, Traditions & Promotions of National Awareness (CHETNA)
respondent: National Highway Authority of India & Others
summary: The NCT Delhi, State of Haryana and State of Rajasthan are directed to ensure due plantation is done at the Government land which are adjacent/abutting National Highway and such other State highways. The State Government and all Local Authorities shall also issue directions to all the Group Housing Societies, Commercial Plots and land that is allotted by the State Government for any office, residential block, that they would plant trees along their boundaries and raise green belts around the buildings.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding illegal hot-mix plants in the State of Uttarakhand, 05/09/2017
summary: NGT directs the State Government of Uttarakhand to provide all assistance to the State Pollution Control Board for closure of illegal hot-mix plants especially the 35 hot-mix plants to whom orders have already been passed and a compliance report be submitted before the Tribunal.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding construction activity in 17 green belts of Shimla, Himachal Pradesh
summary: Counsel appearing for the state of Himachal Pradesh has informed the National Green Tribunal that they are planning to file the Integrated Development Plan of Shimla and the Applicant (Yogendra Mohan Sengupta) would file the report of CAG particularly with reference to the landslides.

subject: Mining
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding illegal mining of sand in Jhargram and West Midnapur districts of West Bengal, 05/09/2017
respondent: Director, Directorate of Mines Minerals & Others
summary: The Tribunal while disposing of this Application directs the authorities to continue maintaining vigil to ensure that no illegal mining and lifting of sand takes place in the area.

subject: Industry
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding violation of environmental norms by Sachin Infra Environment Limited (SIEL), Surat, Gujarat, 06/09/2017
respondent: Gujarat Pollution Control Board, Paryavaran Bhavan & Others
summary: NGT indicts SIEL-CETP for non-compliance of environmental norms for the last five years as it was found discharging outlet waste water containing pollutants beyond the permissible limits in the environment and thus contributing to the contamination of Unn Khadi environment and directs SIEL-CETP to pay an environmental compensation of Rs.20,00,000/- (Rs. Twenty lakhs). NGT also directs GPCB to take appropriate actions against four other industries found by the Court Commissioner of discharging their waste water to open storm water drain.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding waste to energy plant in Bathinda, Punjab, 06/09/2017
summary: NGT directs that the RDF produced by the Project Proponent be provided to the Central Pollution Control Board, Punjab State Pollution Control Board and Punjab Engineering College, Chandigarh for testing. Further the RDF will be analysed with reference to critical parameters like calorific value, moisture content, inert, etc. and report thereof, be submitted to the Tribunal. The Tribunal also directed the Project Proponent to seek instructions as to establishment of waste to energy plant, by using most modern technology, which would not result in unhealthy or environmentally hazardous emissions released in the surrounding areas.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding use of outdated technology by black smiths causing air and noise pollution, West Bengal, 06/09/2017
summary: Counsel for the State PCB states that such units should not be permitted in congested areas and also mentions that this matter does not fall within the Consent Management administration of the State PCB.

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding the demarcation of high flood lines of rivers, India, 07/09/2017
summary: Tribunal asked (Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change, State of Uttarakhand, Ministry of Water Resources and National Mission for Clean Ganga) whose duty it is to determine and demarcate the high flood line of rivers with reference to specific laws?

subject: Forests
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding cutting of 5000 trees without permission, Tehsil Sanganer, District Jaipur, Rajasthan, 11/09/2017
summary: NGT directs notice to be issued to the State of Rajasthan regarding cutting of trees without due permission. Also status-quo with regard to the remaining 8000 trees which are proposed to be cut as alleged shall be maintained in case no permission has been received.

subject: Mining
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding illegal mining in Bhilwara, Rajasthan, 11/09/2017
summary: Tribunal directs that such areas be identified for afforestation which would always remain as the green belt and not liable to be allotted for any such purposes where the trees are required to be cut. Tribunal also specified that variety of the trees to be planted would be such which can easily survive as the area is saline with scanty rain fall and advice of the Forest Department officials be taken to identify appropriate varieties of trees to be planted in the area.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding flooding of underpasses in Bhilwara, Rajasthan, 11/09/2017
summary: Tribunal is of the view that solution for the same should be worked out by constructing proper drains with pumping sets and also by preventing the storm water from entering the underpasses and / or minimising the storm water flow into the under passes.

subject: Mining
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding sand mining in Damodar river, West Bengal, 11/09/2017
summary: NGT directs the Irrigation & Waterways Deptt. Govt. of West Bengal to consider the Hydro Geological Study Report (prepared by Kalyani Laboratories Private Ltd. subject to its verification and if the Laboratory is a recognised one) containing recommendation that the area in question in the Damodar river sand bed is fit for sustainable sand mining.

subject: Environment
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding constitution of SEIAA, Bihar, 11/09/2017
summary: Tribunal directs the Central Government and the State Government of Bihar to file affidavits on whether the State Government has forwarded the names of the members and Chairman of SEIAA to the Central Government as required the EIA Notification 2006 and also whether the MOEF has issued any notification constituting the SEAC as per the said Notification.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding municipal solid waste management in Delhi, 11/09/2017
summary: NGT directs that the Municipal Corporation shall, at its own cost after taking all help from other stakeholders including NCT Delhi, start the work of segregation, compaction and bioremediation of the municipal solid waste and also deployment of JCB like machines and other mechanical process for the said purpose at Sanitary Landfill Site, Ghazipur. It should be ensured that the waste, stated to be nearly 45 Mtrs. in height must be provided with proper vents to ensure that methane gas does not get accumulated and causes further disaster. Tribunal also directed a joint inspection team to inspect all the three Waste to Energy plants operating in Delhi and submit their performance and analysis report to the Tribunal within three weeks.

subject: Mining
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding mechanical mining of rivers and flood plains, Karnataka, 11/09/2017
summary: Counsel for the State of Karnataka submitted before the Tribunal that they would permit regulated dredging for removal of clay and sand from the river for the purposes of maintaining its free flow only. There shall be no mining contract granted for in river and flood plain mining.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding the functioning of the waste to energy plant in Shimla, Himachal Pradesh, 11/09/2017
summary: Counsel appearing for the Project Proponent submits that their Waste to Energy Plant is not functional as the machinery of the energy plant has been sent back to Germany for appropriate mechanical and other corrections. He further states that they are ready to transport the RDF (Refuse Derived Fuel) generated by them to the Ambuja Cement Plant in terms of the Memorandum of Understanding executed by them. NGT directs that RDF be transported to the Cement Plant without any further delay and due record of the dispatch and receipt of the RDF be maintained.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding illegal constructions in Matheran an eco-sensitive zone in Maharashtra, 11/09/2017
respondent: Ministry Of Environment And Forests (MOEF) & Others
summary: The Applicant - Bombay Environment Action Group has submitted that the interim submitted before the Tribunal is silent on the actions that the State proposed to take and the timeline on violations under the Forest Conservation Act in the forest like area. NGT directs another affidavit to be filed within a week.

subject: Air Pollution
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding ban on sale of fireworks in Delhi NCR, 12/09/2017
summary: Supreme Court said that a graded regulation is necessary which would eventually result in a prohibition.

subject: Water Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding discharge of untreated waste water and sewage into the river Mandakini, 12/09/2017
summary: NGT directs that the Collector from Satna shall contact his counterpart in UP for ensuring the presence of the officials responsible for proper administration in the part of Chitrakoot town which falls in UP as also ensuring the presence of the authority of the PCB from the UP since the Pasuni nallah falls within the jurisdiction of the UP which ultimately joins the river Mandakini.

subject: Industry
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal industrial pollution caused by M/s. Devisree Metals, Nagercoil Kanyakumari District, Tamil Nadu, 12/09/2017
summary: Tribunal directs the SPCB to constantly supervise the functioning of the M/s. Devisree Metals regarding dust and noise pollution.

subject: Forests
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding encroachment of 7.5 acres of Central Ridge area, Delhi, 12/09/2017
summary: The Deputy Conservator of Forest, South Forest Division has confirmed to the Tribunal that unauthorised construction have all been removed and the 7.5 acres of Ridge land has completely been secured with a boundary wall. NGT directs Ministry of Urban Development and Govt. of NCT of Delhi to ensure that no one re-encroaches upon the said area which has been got cleared after a lot of difficulties. The construction debris which is likely to be left behind after the demolition, needs to be removed fully to restore the ridge to its earlier position.

subject: Water Resources
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding encroachment of river Hoogly due to Ganga River Bank Development, West Bengal, 13/09/2017
summary: NGT Kolkata Bench directs KoPT (Kolkata Port Trust) to take up the rehabilitation work near Millennium Park covering around 1 Km, both upstream & downstream combined to prevent further erosion and complete it within one year. The Tribunal further directs that any proposal on construction, beautification or other activities in the area under the jurisdiction of KoPT, which do not fall under the ambit of Environmental Impact Assessment Notification, 2006, shall not be permitted by KoPT unless it fulfills certain conditions.

subject: Mining
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding illegal sand mining in the river Narmada, Madhya Pradesh, 13/09/2017
summary: NGT directs that the senior most officer of mining department be present before the Tribunal on the next date of hearing and answer whether the private respondent had carried out any mining activity after the year of 1995, either legally or illegally, in the area which is the subject matter of the present application. What action was taken by the State Government to ensure that there was no mining in the area, legally or illegally, against the private respondent.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding units generating hazardous waste, India, 13/09/2017
summary: Counsels appearing for the State of Uttar Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh State Pollution Control Board and other State Pollution Control Boards pray for time to seek instructions to give the exact number of units generating hazardous waste, which is being generated by any activity whatsoever i.e. industrial plants, by running of health sector, by electronic waste and any other similar activity resulting in such hazardous waste.

subject: Air Pollution
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding banning of 10 year old diesel vehicles in Delhi NCR, 14/09/2017
summary: NGT while dismissing the case said that what this Tribunal has addressed through its order dated 7th April, 2015 is the issue relating to deterioration of ambient air quality consequent to which innocent life have been lost. It is now well settled that threat to environment is threat to life. NGT was also critical of the role of the Central Government as the government had failed to substantiate before passing of the order dated 7th April, 2015 that use of vehicles of more than 10 years using diesel as fuel will not be detrimental to the health of people and further failed to negate statistical information that the PM level in vehicular emissions consequent to diesel as fuel was scientifically proved to be carcinogenic leading to fatality and undetectable set back in health shortening the life span and render the living being particularly the human being and infant physically infirm and victim of poor health.

subject: Environment
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding transit fee levied by states on forest products and minerals among others, 15/09/2017
act_referred: Indian Forest Act 1927, Uttar Pradesh Transit of Timber & other Forest Produce Rules 1978, Madhya Pradesh Transit (Forest Produce) Rules 2000
summary: The writ petitioners from whom the transit fee was realised with effect from 01.05.2016 in accordance with the Fifth Amendment to 1978 Rules shall be entitled to claim for refund along with interest @ 9% which shall be considered by the State or any officer authorised by the State.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding pollution at the industrial complex at Bhiwadi, Alwar, Rajasthan, 15/09/2017
summary: Counsel appearing for the State of Rajasthan submits that there is a pipeline that has been laid which carries the effluents. NGT directs production of DPR (Detailed Project Report) that was prepared and the data that was collected for the purposes of determining what should be the gradient size of the pipeline; the kind of effluents was it required to carry and to which end.

subject: Environment
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding the Chardham highway project in Uttarakhand, 15/09/2017
respondent: Ministry Of Environment And Forests (MOEF) & Others
summary: Counsels appearing for the State of Uttarakhand and Border Roads Organisation submit that they would carry out the project and during the implementation of the project, they would ensure that no muck is thrown either into the river, water bodies and/or in the forest or green area down the hill or otherwise.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding pollution caused by industries in Pali, Rajasthan, 18/09/2017
summary: NGT makes it clear that those industries that are not linked to the CETP through the pipe line will be liable to be closed down as the transportation of the pollutants to the CETP through tankers is not proving to be viable alternative.

subject: Water Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding cleaning of nallahs of solid waste, Kota, Rajasthan, 18/09/2017
summary: NGT directs that the river front development project along Chambal river be submitted before the Tribunal on the next date of hearing.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding land conversion for industrial purposes, Rajasthan, 18/09/2017
summary: NGT directs that in future the revenue authorities including the district collectors while passing orders of land conversion for industrial areas shall examine the issue with regard to the environmental factors and the impact of such conversion and setting up of non agricultural activities as a result of such land conversion.

subject: Environment
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding degradation of environment and receding of the glaciers at Rohtang Pass, 19/09/2017
summary: The Counsel appearing for the Applicant prays for time to file the Scheme for Rehabilitation (after the NGT ban on commercial activities and restrictions on the number of vehicles plying for tourists) in relation to house owners, taxis, particularly, diesel taxis, partial rehabilitation and incentive program for the people involved in tourism activities in these areas.

subject: Mining
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding location of Ambuja Cement's mine in the eco sensitive zone of Gir National Park, Gujarat, 20/09/2017
summary: Counsel appearing on behalf of MoEF concedes to the fact that the condition permitting the blasting in the mining area was incorporated in EC in question due to oversight. The Applicant has also further alleged that the public hearing was faulty and inappropriate in as much as the cognizance of the grievances made in the public hearing was not taken. Tribunal directs GPCB to produce the CD of the public hearing within a week with a copy to the contending parties.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding EC granted to LPG Import Terminal at Puthuvypeen SEZ, Kochi, Kerala, 21/09/2017
summary: NGT while dismissing the Application quoted cases where it was necessary to protect the project proponent from the delayed litigation when certain investments have been made by the project proponent and substantial development might have been done. NGT also condoned the delay in filing the Application as it was beyond the condonable limit of 60 days which is not within the jurisdiction of this Tribunal.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding consent to operate for a rice mill in Maruthi Nagar, Guntur District, Andhra Pradesh, 22/09/2017
respondent: Andhra Pradesh State Pollution Control Board & Others
summary: Tribunal directs Andhra Pradesh Pollution Control Board (APPCB) to inspect the rice mill and if all the deficiencies have been taken care of, then the rice mill shall be permitted to operate.

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding demarcation and fixation of high flood line of rivers, 22/09/2017
summary: NGT stated that National Mission for Clean Ganga has no role whatsoever in identification, demarcation and fixation of High Flood Line in the river. It is primary responsibility of the Ministry of Water Resources and the State Government.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding consent to operate granted to Linet Nunes Curlies Restaurant, Panaji, Goa, 22/09/2017
respondent: Goa State Pollution Control Board & Others
summary: Tribunal directs Linnet Nunes to submit to the Pollution Control Board the NOC/approval from the concerned Panchayat. If such NOC/Approval is granted, the Goa Pollution Control Board shall pass appropriate order taking it to be reconsideration of the impugned order passed by the Board as this was the only ground for revoking the consent order having submission of NOC/Approval.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding destruction of trees as a result of demolition of government residential colonies, Delhi, 22/09/2017
summary: NGT directs the Project Proponent to plant the tall trees at the site in question and if the space falls short, then the plantation shall be done at the site allocated for that purpose by the Delhi Development Authority. The plants shall be planted as a condition precedent to the cutting of the trees.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding waste dumping at the Ghazipur landfill site in Delhi, 22/09/2017
summary: Tribunal directs NCT Delhi, East Delhi Municipal Corporation to place before the Tribunal, a Report and Action Plan in regard to the manner and methodology that would be done by them for the purpose of dealing with segregation, compaction and disposal of the deposited waste of the Ghazipur land fill site as well as the fresh waste of nearly 800 MT that is being brought to this site everyday. NGT wants to know how they will convert this landfill site into green area in accordance with the provision of the Solid Waste Management Rules, 2016.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding blockage of storm water drains in Vasundhra, Ghaziabad, Uttar Pradesh, 22/09/2017
respondent: Uttar Pradesh Pollution Control Board & Others
summary: The Applicant has produced photographs to show that the drain is still blocked and demolishing of illegal structures has not been completed. Tribunal grants one weeks time to Ghaziabad Nagar Nigam to clean all the drains in the Vasundhara township.

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding restoration of water bodies in Delhi, 22/09/2017
petitioner: Society for Protection of Culture, Heritage, Environment, Traditions and Promotion of National Awareness (CHETNA)
respondent: National Capital Territory of Delhi & Others
summary: With regard to use of EPDM (ethylene propylene diene monomer (M-class) rubber) as base material for the water bodies there is difference of opinion as the Applicant NGO CHETNA has submitted that use of EPDM as a material will not be environmental friendly and it will cause stagnation of water.

subject: Mining
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding sand mining in the name of desilting of canals, Haryana, 22/09/2017
summary: The Tribunal states that if it is found that the activity of mining on the river bed and the use of screening plants at the mining site is impremissible and not in accordance with law, then the project proponent’s indemnity bond shall be encashed. NGT also permits lifting of the already excavated sand material, subject to an interim environmental cost of Rs. 1 lakh that the project proponent shall deposit within a period of 30 days towards the Haryana Pollution Control Board.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding grant of licence for setting up fire cracker manufacturing units in the State of West Bengal, 21/09/2017
summary: Tribunal directs the Addl. Chief Secretary, in-charge of Industry, Commerce and Enterprises Department to file an action taken report on the next date of hearing.

subject: Health, Food Safety, Pesticides
title: PIL filed in the High Court of Hyderabad regarding the inadequate number of Community Health Centres (CHCs) and Primary Health Centres (PHCs) in the state of Telangana, October 2017
summary: The issue deals with the inadequate number of Community Health Centres (CHCs) and Primary Health Centres (PHCs) and lack of qualified medical professionals at various levels of health care system in the state of Telangana.

subject: Environment
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding noise pollution and resultant health hazards, 03/10/2017
summary: In the affidavit/action taken report filed on behalf of the State PCB, it is stated that all together 273 sound limiters and noise meters respectively have been distributed to the various police authorities, viz., Kolkata Police, Birbhum Police, North 24 Parganas District Police, Sundarban Police District, Diamond Harbour District Police, Nadia District Police, Howrah Police Commissionerate and Bidhannagar Police Commissionerate. Tribunal directs the Municipal Corporation, the Municipality, Municipal Boards, different panchayats to ensure that one of the terms of the licences granted for letting out the audio systems shall include an additional condition that no audio system shall be let out without being fitted with sound limiter. Apart from this, as maintenance of the limit of sound is a mandatory requirement under the law, no shop dealing with the sale of public audio systems anywhere in the state of West Bengal shall be permitted to sell such instruments without sound limiters as a compulsory accessory and, this condition shall be strictly enforced by the licensing authorities with the assistance of the police. We make it clear that the condition for use of sound limiter shall be applicable also for all the government and political functions. The above direction shall also be applicable to all the other states in the region.

subject: Environment
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding noise pollution because of vehicles affecting the health of residents of Panchshila Park Area, Delhi, 04/10/2017
respondent: State of NCT of Delhi & Others
summary: NGT directs that the portion of the Outer Ring Road passing through Panchsheel Park be made of smooth asphalt which will basically be a low noise causing material. Planting of trees and shrubs along both sides of the road should be done more vigorously to prevent noise pollution. The existing ban on pressure horns and prevention of overloading of goods carriers shall be strictly implemented by the Delhi Police. The Court also asked for the installation of speed cameras by December 2017.

subject: Environment
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding laying of pipeline beneath the seabed near seashore in inter tidal area, Kuranga, Taluka Dwarka, District Jamnagar, Gujarat, 04/10/2017
summary: The Court finds no reason for grant of interim injunction and finds no irreparable injury to the coastal environment including the marine environment due to the work in question. However, as a precautionary measure, NGT Western Zone Bench directs National Institute of Oceanography, Mumbai to depute a Senior Scientist to visit the site, carry out local investigation and report to us its findings regarding adverse impact, if any, on marine/coastal environment due to the work of laying of the underground pipeline in intertidal and subtidal area at the project site at Kuranga, Taluka Dwarka, District Devbhumi Dwarka undertaken by RSPL Limited.

The matter is listed for 05/10/2017.

subject: Air Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding emissions of locomotive engines, 04/10/2017
summary: The Counsel appearing for Central Pollution Control Board submits that they have already prepared the guidelines including interim standards for locomotive engines to operate. NGT directs that a copy of that be circulated to all the concerned and put up on the website of Central Pollution Control Board. The Counsel appearing for the Ministry of Environment, Forest & Climate Change submits that they accept the Central Pollution Control Board guidelines.

subject: Water Resources

summary: NGT rejects the appeal seeking an order to restrain the construction of Yettinahole drinking water project.
