subject: Environment
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding use of loudspeakers and public address system on Jantar Mantar road, Delhi, 05/10/2017
summary: The matter relates to use of loudspeakers and public address system on Jantar Mantar road causing adverse health effect on the residents and children. The applicants (permanent residents of Jantar Mantar road) have also requested that barricades at a sufficient distance be installed so as to prevent vehicular movement. NGT directs the Government of Delhi, New Delhi Municipal Corporation and Police Commissioner, Delhi to immediately stop all the activities of dharna, protest, agitations, assembling of people, public speeches, using of loud speakers, etc.at Jantar Mantar road.

subject: Water Pollution
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal pollution of river Hooghly after immersion of idols during various Puja festivals, West Bengal, 06/10/2017
summary: NGT in its Judgement stated that the CPCB guidelines are exhaustive in so far as regulation for immersion of idol is concerned, and all that is required is for the State Governments, the local bodies and the State Pollution Control Boards to implement those effectively. There shall be a complete ban on the use of POP in idol making till it is established that POP has no negative effect on the water quality and aquatic biodiversity according to the Eastern Zone Bench of NGT as well as a complete ban on the use of synthetic colour for painting of idols that would require immersion as part of final ritual of the festival. NGT also limited the height of idol to 20 ft.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding release of dioxin and furans by waste to energy plant at Okhla, Delhi, 09/10/2017
petitioner: Sukhdev Vihar Residents Welfare Association & Others
respondent: State of NCT of Delhi & Others
summary: It is submitted in the Court that the Central Pollution Control Board does not have in-house mechanism in their laboratories to analyse Dioxin and Furans. The Central Pollution Control Board has been permitted by the Court to collect and analyse the samples of ambient air quality once in four months instead on a monthly basis. Also CPCB has been directed to conduct at lease two surprise inspections and analysis in a year.

subject: Mining
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding illegal mining in Madhya Pradesh, 09/10/2017
summary: NGT expresses dissatisfaction with the Status Report placed before the Tribunal by the State Government of Madya Pradesh. Court grants two weeks to the State to file complete and comprehensive report covering the compliance to the orders of the Tribunal as well as with regard to illegal mining.

subject: Air Pollution
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding use of firecrackers during Diwali, 09/10/2017
summary: The Applicant has pointed out that onset of winter itself deteriorates air quality in Delhi NCR and it gets aggravated because of festival/marriage season that occurs during these very months. Taking note of the aforesaid factors, particularly impact of fireworks on the ambient air and unhealthy effects thereof which had created unprecedented situation in Delhi, with air pollution going up at alarming levels and making it the most polluted city in the world. Supreme Court bans sale of firecrackers in Delhi and NCR. Further orders in this behalf would be passed after assessing the situation that would emerge afer the 2017 Diwali season.

subject: Air Pollution
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding use of firecrackers during Diwali, 09/10/2017
summary: Supreme Court bans sale of firecrackers in Delhi and NCR. Further orders in this behalf would be passed after assessing the situation that would emerge afer the 2017 Diwali season.

subject: Air Pollution
title: Supreme Court proceedings on the action plan to control air pollution prepared by the Environment Pollution Control Authority, Oct 11, 2017
summary: Senior advocate and amicus curiae Harish Salve told the Supreme Court that the union government is contradicting its own reports and stand on various air pollution issues. While reading out the affidavit filed by the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change (MOEF&CC) in response to Comprehensive Action Plan prepared by the Environment Pollution Control Authority (EPCA).

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding dumping of fly ash from thermal power plant, Faridabad, 11/10/2017
summary: It is stated by the Counsel appearing for the Project Proponent, National Highways Authority of India that they are lifting the fly ash from the dumping site and are utilizing it for different purposes. It is further stated that the site shortly would be cleared in its entirety and would be filled in accordance with the prescribed rules.

While reading out the affidavit filed by the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change (MOEF&CC) in response to Comprehensive Action Plan prepared by the Environment Pollution Control Authority (EPCA).

subject: Forests

summary: The Affidavit filed by Additional Principal Chief Conservator of Forest, MoEF and CC provides informs the Court that the Government of Odisha has been asked to initiate necessary action to evict the encroachments and MoEF & CC has asked the State to treat this as violation of Indian Forest Act, 1927 and the Orissa Forest Act, 1972.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding hotels in Burdwan town of West Bengal not complying with pollution norms, 12/10/2017
respondent: West Bengal Pollution Control Board & Others
summary: NGT has asked for a list of non-compliant hotels along with the names of owners and their addresses to be submitted before the next date of hearing and also directed the State PCB to inspect all the hotels in Burdwan town and submit a report on the compliance of the pollution norms without fail before the next date.

subject: Wildlife and Biodiversity
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding elephant corridors in the state of Odisha, 12/10/2017
summary: Deepak Kumar Pani, Additional Standing counsel submits that Asian Nature Conservation Foundation (ANCF) has completed its task pertaining to the elephant corridor and the report preparation will take some time, particularly on the ecologically feasible corridor.

subject: Mining
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding establishment of the District Mineral Foundation, 13/10/2017
petitioner: Federation of Indian Mineral Industries & Others
summary: Supreme Court passes the following directions: 1. Contributions to the DMF are required to be made by the holder of a mining lease or a prospecting licence-cum-mining lease in the case of minerals other than coal, lignite and sand for stowing with effect from 17th September, 2015 when the rates were prescribed by the Central Government and in the case of coal, lignite and sand with effect from 20th October, 2015. 2. Notification dated 31st August, 2016 issued by the Central Government is invalid. 3. Court grants time till 31st December, 2017 to those holders of a mining lease or a prospecting licence-cum-mining lease who have not made the full contribution to the District Mineral Funds to pay the contribution, failing which they will be liable to make the contribution with interest at 15% per annum from the due date.

subject: Water Resources
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding execution of Pune Metro Rail on prohibited zone inside Blue Line in the river bed of Mula Mutha, Pune, Maharashtra, 13/10/2017
summary: The Applicants have stated that the construction of Metro Rail proposed in the Draft Development Plan of City of Pune falls within the Blue Line along the banks of River Mutha and even in the river bed i.e. No Development Zone and is bound to cause tremendous environmental and ecological damage in terms of adverse effect on free flow of river Mutha and unprecedented flooding. NGT directs a Committee of Experts to be constituted to visit the site of Pune Metro Rail to assess the impact of the Pune Metrol Rail construction on the environment namely ground water recharge, bio-diversity in the river bed, free flow of the water, risk of flooding, debris disposal, water pollution and air pollution. The work of scientific investigation shall be completed within a month.

subject: Mining
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding illegal stone crushing units in Rajasthan, 13/10/2017
summary: The Counsel appearing for the State submits that they would direct the concerned Department including the Rajasthan Pollution Control Board to conduct a detailed survey with regard to existence of stone crushers, stone cutting units and material grinding units including the dumping of waste/remnant materials.

subject: Water Resources
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding construction activity on river bed of rivers Mahanadi and Kathjodi, Cuttack, Odisha, 16/10/2017
summary: NGT directs the District Administration of Cuttack to ensure that no construction debris/waste, municipal wastes etc. are illegally dumped on the river beds and all illegal encroachments of the river banks/beds of Mahanadi and Kathjodi at Cuttack shall be evicted by the District Administration and all illegal constructions on the river bank/bed shall be removed. NGT allows holding of Baliyatra festival to be held in the Balijatra field between Barabati Stadium & Gadagadia temple as well as in the silted-up alluvium space on north side of river embankment on the condition that the the distance of the river flow from the boarder of the extended site shall be a minimum of 50 m and the festival site shall be declared as Plastic Free Zone by the authorities as well.

subject: Water Resources
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding the proposed Subansiri Lower Hydro Electric Project (SLHEP) threatening the ecology of lower Subansiri river, 16/10/2017
summary: NGT has directed the Ministry of Environment and Forest & Climate Change to constitute an Expert Committee which involve the entire gamut of the issues pertaining to the seismological, dam design and downstream impact. The respondents in their reply filed before the Court has stated that additional safety measures have been proposed to be put in place on the basis of the recommendations of the expert committees appointed by the Planning Commission, State of Assam and State of Arunachal Pradesh in collaboration with the NHPC, Ministry of Power, Ministry of Electricity and the Brahmaputra Board. In view of the above the Application is disposed of.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding municipal solid waste management from railway platforms of Delhi, 23/10/2017
summary: NGT while comining down heavily on the Railway authority said that the primary responsibility to comply with the Rules of 2016 and to ensure that the platforms and railway lines remain free of municipal solid wastes and other wastes rests on them. NGT direct each of the railway station (Vivek Vihar Railway Station, Anand Vihar Railway Station, Delhi Shahdara Railway Station, Shakur Basti Railway Station) to pay environmental compensation of Rs. 1 lakh each within four weeks.

subject: Industry
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding pollution caused by the industrial units in Patancheru and Bollaram, Medak District, Telangana, 24/10/2017
summary: NGT directs the Government of Telangana to constitute an Expert Committee to make a thorough study in all the villages forming part of Manjira River basin in and around Nakkavagu and other water bodies and also Musi River Basin to investigate the health hazards of the people living in the area due to the industrial pollution and also whether the activities of the pharmaceutical industries have led to Antimicrobial Resistance to drugs.

subject: Industry
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding payment of consent fees by Narmathaa Textiles to the Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board, 24/10/2017
respondent: Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board & Others
summary: NGT directs that consent fee should not include the period during the textile unit was not functioning.

subject: Water Resources
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding forest clearance granted by MoEF & CC for Demwe Lower Hydroelectric Project, Lohit District, Arunachal Pradesh, 24/10/2017
summary: NGT Southern Bench stays Forest Clearance Stage I dated 1.3.2012 and Stage II dated 3.5.2013 issued by the MoEF and the consequential order of the Government of Arunachal Pradesh dated 267.2013 relating to diversion of 1415.92 ha of Forest Land for construction of Demwe Lower Hydro Electric Project (1750 MW) in Lohit District of Arunachal Pradesh till the Standing Committee of NBWL shall reconsider the issue relating to Demwe Lower Hydro Electric Project and pass appropriate orders within a period of six months.

subject: Water Resources
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding forest clearance granted by MoEF & CC for Demwe Lower Hydroelectric Project, Lohit District, Arunachal Pradesh, 24/10/2017
summary: The issue relates to Stage I Forest Clearance and Stage II Forest Clearance granted by the MoEF & CC for Demwe Lower Hydroelectric Project (1750 MW) in Lohit District of Arunachal Pradesh which would lead to diversion of 1415.92 ha (1408.30 ha surface land + 7.62 ha underground land) of forest land. NGT Southern Bench stays Forest Clearance Stage I dated 1.3.2012 and Stage II dated 3.5.2013 issued by the MoEF and the consequential order of the Government of Arunachal Pradesh dated 267.2013 relating to diversion of 1415.92 ha of Forest Land for construction of Demwe Lower Hydro Electric Project (1750 MW) in Lohit District of Arunachal Pradesh till the Standing Committee of NBWL shall reconsider the issue relating to Demwe Lower Hydro Electric Project and pass appropriate orders within a period of six months.

subject: Wildlife and Biodiversity
title: Order of the Madras High Court regarding use of drug Diclofenac for human use, 24/10/2017
summary: Madras High Court dismisses the plea of the drug industry about the importance of multi dose packs of diclofenac for treatment of human beings and clearly stated that vultures are universally accepted as Natural Sanitary Workers, absolutely essential for environmental and ecological balance. Therefore, preservation of vulture population is non-negotiable and decline of vulture population needs to be arrested. The court also observed that the use of Diclofenac Sodium (administered to livestock/cattle) led to large scale vulture deaths from 1992 in India.

subject: Air Pollution
title: Order of the Supreme Court of India on the use of furnace oil and pet-coke and pollution standards for industries, 24/10/2017
summary: Mains Points of the Order are the following: 1. Supreme Court places a ban on use of Furnace Oil and Pet-Coke in the States of U.P., Haryana and Rajasthan. The ban will take effect from 1st November, 2017. 2. Another issue for consideration was fixing standards for 34 industries with regard to the SO2, NOX and SOX emissions. The affidavit filed by the Solicitor General on behalf of the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change on 20th July, 2017 states that insofar as 9 industries are concerned, SO2, NOX and SOX standards had already been fixed. It is also brought to Court's notice that emission standards for SO2, NOX and SOX are not required to be fixed in respect of two industries, viz., electroplating industries and stone crushing units since there is no emission of SO2, NOX and SOX. CPCB informs the Court that draft standards were fixed by the CPCB in respect of 16 industries and these were communicated to the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change on 27.06.2017. 3. Supreme Court expresses dismay with the attitude of the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change that had been sitting over 16 recommendations (pollution standards for industries) at least since 27.06.2017, that is, "almost about three months without apparently showing any concern whatsoever for the pollution in Delhi and in NCR". Apex Court imposes a fine of Rs. 2,00,000 /- (Rupees two lakhs only) on the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change.

subject: Industry
title: Judgement of the Supreme Court on the issue of Gujarat Electricity Regulatory Commission extending the control period of the Solar Semiconductor Power Company, 25/10/2017
summary: Supreme Court rules that Solar Semiconductor Power is bound by the terms and conditions of PPA entered into between the Solar Semiconductor Power and Gujarat Urja Vikas Nigam by mutual consent and that the Gujarat Electricity Regulatory Commission was not right in exercising its inherent jurisdiction by extending the first control period beyond its due date and thereby substituting its view in the PPA (power purchase agreement), which is essentially a matter of contract between the parties.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal

summary: Counsel appearing for State of Himachal Pradesh submits that policy decision have been taken by the State Government to establish a plant and Himachal Pradesh Pollution Control Board has been asked to conduct study and submit DPR through the concerned department.

subject: Water Resources

summary: NGT passes direction that DDA/MCD shall ensure that DJB shall supply treated sewage water for gardening at the fixed rate which will be the primary responsibility of the public authority. The residents, DDA/MCD and DJB are prohibited to use fresh water for gardening purpose.

subject: Mining
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding illegal mining in Nagore District, Rajasthan, 26/10/2017
summary: Photographs placed before the court shows that illegal mining has practically reduced the greenery to half also the project where mining is carried has no environmental clearance obtained by any person whatsoever. NGT directs departmental proceedings against all the erring officers and officials and environmental compensation to be imposed on each of the employees to the extent of Rs. 50,000/-. The Mining Department and the Rajasthan State Pollution Control Board is also directed to recover a sum of Rs. 1 Lakh from each of the persons who were found to be responsible for carrying on illegal and unauthorized mining in this area.

subject: Health, Food Safety, Pesticides

subject: Waste Management, Disposal

subject: Industry
title: Supreme Court order regarding state of construction workers in India, 30/10/2017
petitioner: National Campaign Committee for Central Legislation on Construction Labour (NCCCL)
summary: Affidavit filed on behalf of the Comptroller and Auditor General of India reveals the state of affairs with regard to the utilization of cess collected under the Building and Other Construction Workers (Regulation of Employment and Conditions of Service) Act, 1996. The Court observed that it is quite obvious that the amounts are just being frittered away and if not defalcated by the concerned Welfare Boards. Huge amounts have been collected in the region of Rs.29,000 crores and not even 10% has been spent for the benefit of construction workers. Supreme Court directs the presence of the Secretary in the Ministry of Labour "to understand how the Act is being implemented and why it is being misused if not abused to the detriment of the construction workers.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding illegal dumping and burning of garbage in Sirumugai, Coimbatore by Sirumugai Town Panchayat, Tamil Nadu, 30/10/2017
respondent: Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board & Others
summary: NGT Southern Bench directs that the Sirumugai Panchayat shall obtain necessary “authorisation” from the appropriate authorities within three months and shall remove all the Solid Waste dumped in the S.F.No.148/2 and 189/2 and shall not dump the solid waste in open space or burn solid waste.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation

subject: Waste Management, Disposal

summary: Supreme Court directs the Union of India through the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change to file an affidavit within four weeks with regard to the implementation of the Solid Waste Management Rules, 2016. subject: Mining
title: Supreme Court order regarding illegal mining in Rohtas region of Bihar, 01/11/2017
summary: The Applicant (Dr. Ghanshyam Narain Singh) has been informed that a a site visit by the CEC (Central Empowered Committee) will take place on 8th and 9th November, 2017. He may pass on whatever information he has to the CEC and to Mr. A.D.N. Rao (amicus curiae) and he can accompany the CEC during the site. The report of the CEC will be filed within two weeks.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal

petitioner: Chief Executive Officer Zilla Parishad, Ahmednagar
summary: Counsel appearing on behalf of AMC (Ahmednagar Municipal Council) submits that DPR has been prepared for 57 MLD STP for the entire city of Ahmednagar excluding Mukund Nagar and 2.5 STP MLD for Mukund Nagar area is envisaged. subject: Mining

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding compliance of conditions of the Environmental Clearance by SSM Builders and Promoters, Chennai, 02/11/2017

The Court ordered that out of 1966503 Sqm of area of the plot, the green belt is proposed to be raised over 52138 Sqm, which is 26.5 % of the total area. Also treated sewage should be sold, after proper treatment, either to the industries located nearby or to farmers to be used for irrigation purposes, rather than being transported over long distance.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal

summary: The Puri Municipality, the Deptt. of PHE, Govt. of Odisha and the Odisha Water Supply and Sewerage Board, are directed to expedite the process of establishing efficient solid waste treatment plant and to complete laying of the water supply pipelines in the city. NGT also directed the State Chief Secretary to file a report on the issue of establishing desalination plants at permissible distances from the sea beach as a source of water supply to the city of Puri.

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding eviction of encroachers from Santragachhi Jheel, Howrah, West Bengal, 02/11/2017
summary: The part of the water body that has been encroached belongs to the South Eastern Railway. The Court has been informed that the illegal occupants in the area in question have not been provided with opportunities of individual hearing. Although it is stated on behalf of the Railway Authorities that orders of eviction had been issued on the basis of a common representation submitted by them, NGT is of the view that each of the illegal occupants ought to be heard separately and separate orders passed against each of them as cause of action would arise in the case of each individual.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding discharge of effluent from Brahmaputra Cracker and Polymer Limited (BCPL), Lepetkata, Dibrugarh, Assam into the Brahmaputra, 02/11/2017
summary: The Court after going through the analysis report of the sample waste water collected from ETP on two dates i.e. on 07.08.2017 and 05.09.2017 found that the level of discharge of at least five components were in excess of the permissible standards. NGT directs Brahmaputra Cracker and Polymer Limited (BCPL) to remain closed.

subject: Water Pollution
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding pollution in the river Narmada, 06/11/2017
summary: NGT directs MPPCB to regularly monitor the quality of water in the places from where water samples were collected ealier and water analysis report be submitted before the Tribunal after every six months and in case there is abrupt deteriorations in quality of water it may be brought to the notice of the Tribunal immediately.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding construction of Signature City Project in Kanpur, Uttar Pradesh, 06/11/2017
summary: The Application filed by journalist Ashwini Yadav said that the Kanpur Development Authority has not obtained the no objection certificate. NGT directs the Ministry of Environment, Forest & Climate Change/ SEIAA to consider the Application for obtaining Environmental Clearance of the project proponent but "definitely take into consideration the illegalities committed in the constructions already raised and how they propose to protect the environment concerned". The Environmental Clearance, if granted, would be subject to approval by Tribunal.

subject: Water Resources
title: Supreme Court order regarding encroachments on the Yamuna flood plains, 06/11/2017
summary: Apex Court directs for final disposal of these matters on 15th January, 2018 as it involved a large number of encroachments on the flood plains of Yamuna.

subject: Governance & Institutions
title: Order of the High Court of Madras regarding quoting of Aadhaar number while filing for income tax returns, 06/11/2017
summary: Court while dismissing the Application quoted the Supreme Court Order of June 09, 2017 which stated “…however, those assessees who are not Aadhaar card holders and do not comply with the provision of Section 139(2), their PAN cards be not treated as invalid for the time being. It is only to facilitate other transactions which are mentioned in Rule 114B of the Rules….”

subject: Water Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding Pali river pollution, Rajasthan, 06/11/2017
summary: The Counsel representing the State of Rajasthan & Others has been directed by the Court to place a status report in respect of linking all the member industries to CETP through pipeline which was to be completed by 02.10.2017. It is also made clear, at that time, that those industries which were not linked with CETP are liable to be closed down.

subject: Industry
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding rate of Net Present Value to be paid by Mangalam Cement, Kota, Rajasthan, 07/11/2017
summary: Mangalam Cement contention is that the forest land in question is degraded having density of less than of 0.01, the NPV should have been charged at the minimum rate of Rs. 5.80 lakhs per hectare and not at the rate of Rs. 9.0 hectares. National Green Tribunal dismisses the Application citing that the case has no merit against the order issued by the Divisional Forest Officer and Order dated 30/05/2011 by the Principal Secretary (Forest), State of Rajasthan.

subject: Mining
title: Supreme Court order regarding illegal stone crushing units in Mathura and Bharatpur, 07/11/2017
summary: The Apex Court mentions the report of the Central Empowered Committee submitted in the Supreme Court on 16/03/2010 which had asked for submission of a report by a Committee headed by the Additional Principal Chief Conservator of Forests of the Regional Office of the Ministry of Environment and Forests at Lucknow. The Committee was entrusted to verify the legality of the raw material received by the identified 15 stone crushing units during the last five years. Supreme Court asks for the report to be placed within a period of four weeks.

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding restoration of Gauri Kund spring near Kedarnath, Uttarakhand, 07/11/2017
summary: NGT directs the State of Uttarakhand and CGWA to make every effort to restore the hot spring which had been destroyed in 2013 during a natural calamity.

subject: Water Resources
title: Judgement of the Telangana and Andhra Pradesh High Court regarding Kaleshwaram Lift Irrigation Scheme, Telangana, 08/11/2017
summary: The Court while transfering the case back to the Principal Bench of NGT ordered that till final forest clearance is obtained from the Government of India, the petitioner shall henceforth neither encroach upon any part of the reserve forest in connection with the project, nor shall even a single tree therein be felled for the purposes of the project, or for any ancillary activity connected therewith. Works if any undertaken by, and on behalf of, the State of Telangana shall be confined strictly to the drinking water component of the project.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: Supreme Court order regarding the state of urban homeless in the state of Haryana, Uttar Pradesh and West Bengal, 08/11/2017
summary: The Apex Court finds no concrete implementation of the National Urban Livelihood Mission (NULM). The Court suggests that the Union of India may have to look into the matter on how to implement the Mission effectively so that crores of rupees that are sanctioned are not frittered away on issues that have no concern directly or indirectly with the NULM.

subject: Mining
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding mining in villages Aterna and Hansapur, District Sonipat, Haryana, 08/11/2017
respondent: Mines and Geology Department -  Government of Haryana & Others
summary: NGT calls for stopping of any mining activity in these areas.

subject: Air Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding the deteriorating ambient air quality index in Delhi NCR, 08/11/2017
summary: National Green Tribunal directs Central Pollution Control Board, Delhi Pollution Control Committee, Haryana Pollution Control Board, Rajasthan State Pollution Control Board, Punjab State Pollution Control Board and Uttar Pradesh Pollution Control Board to put in public domain the ambient air quality index (AQI) which will include PM2.5, PM10, SO2, NO2, PM2.5, PM10, CO, Ozone, Ammonia and Lead. This should be done in the various parts of NCR by all source of pollution and report be submitted before the Tribunal.

subject: Air Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding the deteriorating air quality of Delhi NCR, 09/11/2017
summary: National Green Tribunal in the Order said that the Judgement of the NGT dated 10th November, 2016 had "clearly postulated the steps that were required to be taken on long term and short term basis keeping in view the precautionary principle to ensure that the ill-effects and adverse impact of polluted ambient air quality in the previous year is not repeated in the year 2017. However, this remains un-executed and non-complied." The Court finds no Authority who is able to show the effective compliance of the directions contained in the judgment.

subject: Water Resources
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding water water shortage in Jaipur city and the drying up of Ramgarh Lake, 09/11/2017
petitioner: National Institute of Medical Science University Rajasthan & Others
summary: The case deals with the massive encroachments in the catchment areas of Ramgarh Dam especially by the National Institute of Medical Sciences University or NIMS. Supreme Court expressed dismay that despite orders passed by the Rajasthan High Court and plan of action having been prepared by the State Government, nothing substantive appears to have been achieved on the ground over the past 15 years. The Court dismisses the petition but with costs of Rs. 10 lakhs per petition for the encroachment by NIMS. Court also directs the demolition of the unauthorized construction by or on behalf of NIMS on Khasra No. 526. The demolition should be carried out by the Jaipur Development Authority with the assistance of the State Government and the Collector of Jaipur District on or before 30th November, 2017. The cost of demolition and removal of rubble etc. will be at the expense of NIMS.

subject: Industry
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding pollution caused by a poultry farm, village Suregaon, District Ahmednagar, Maharashtra, 09/11/2017
summary: NGT refuses the Appeal for the closure of poultry farm but directs the poultry farm to to keep account of disposal of the birds/biological solid waste at the common facility engaged by them and accounts so maintained shall be submitted to MPCB every month for their scrutiny.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding waste management in hotels used for marriage functions, Madhya Pradesh, 09/11/2017
summary: NGT, Central Zona Bench expressed satisfaction with the action taken by the hotels and ordered that "in case these sites are used by the respondents in a manner which requires any compliance under law and the same is not done, then the petitioner (Sheikh Sajid) would be free to raise the grievance accordingly".

subject: Industry
title: Supreme Court order regarding welfare of construction workers, 10/11/2017
petitioner: National Campaign Committee for Central Legislation on Construction Labour
summary: Secretary in the Ministry of Labour informed the Apex Court that certain schemes have already been prepared for the benefit of construction workers and a national portal is under construction which can be used by NGOs.

subject: Air Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding deteriorating air quality in NCT Delhi, 11/11/2017
summary: Principal Bench of the National Green Tribunal in its Order clearly stated that "as and when the PM10 and PM2.5 crosses values of 500 µg/m3 and 300 µg/m3 respectively, it shall be mandatory for NCT Delhi and all its Government Departments to implement odd and even without default and it shall not be optional for any officer of the Government or institutions to avoid these directions and noncompliance of notification". There shall be no exemption to any person, officer and individual and the two wheelers from the ambit and scope of odd and even scheme. Also a Committee will be constituted which will collect the data of ambient air quality which shall be tested at least for 8 parameters including PM10, PM2.5, Carbon Monoxide, Ozone, Ammonia, SO2, NO2 and Lead. A due compilation of at least two samples a day during the peak hours shall be maintained by this Committee continuously for a period of 10 days. All these samples shall be analyzed at the laboratory of the Central Pollution Control Board and IIT Delhi.

subject: Environment
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding infrastructure and other matters relating to route from Katra to Bhawan and environment protection, Jammu & Kashmir, 13/11/2017
summary: NGT directed that the new path/road that has been constructed at the cost of Rs. 40 crores should be opened to the public by 24th November, 2017. No horses/mules would be permitted to ply on this road either for carrying passengers/ pilgrims or any construction or other material. The number of pilgrims at the Bhawan should be restricted to 50,000 per day and excess thereof should be halted either at Katra or at Ardhkuari. Court further directed the State of Jammu and Kashmir to identify and construct an appropriate landfill site for solid waste management in accordance with Solid Waste Management Rules, 2016.

subject: Industry
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding illegal and unauthorized use of forest land in Jharsuguda by Vedanta Limited, 13/11/2017
summary: The Applicant states that Vedanta Ltd. formerly known as Vedanta Alumina Ltd. used 246.74 acres of forest land in Khata No. 108 illegally for its ash pond in Burrkhamunda village in Jharsuguda district without approval from the Central Govt. under Forest (Conservation) Act, 1980 (in short, FC Act). They further contended that Environmental Clearance (in short, EC) was obtained for expansion of their existing Aluminium Smelter and Captive Power Plant on 11th June, 2008, suppressing the fact on forest land and mentioning that no forest land is involved. NGT dismissed the Application saying "that the Application is barred by limitation" and it was filed much beyond the prescribed time limit under the ambit of National Green Tribunal Act 2010.

subject: Water Resources
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding the decision of the Central Government and the Government of Assam to establish AIIMS at the Jalah Beel in North Guwahati, Assam, 13/11/2017
summary: NGT while dismissing the Application said that as per the records "the area does not appear to be a water body in the sense that water remains stored there but only part of it is marshy that become water logged during the rainy season. In fact, the entire area had been recorded as VGR land which had been de-reserved after due consideration of all factors in order to establish AIIMS in the larger interest of the general public". Also sections of the Act (Guwahati Metropolitan Development Authority Master Plan 20-25) enable the GMDA (Guwahati Metropolitan Authority) and the State to make modifications to the Master Plan and Zoning Regulations and justifies the submission of the Advocate General for the State and the Counsel for the GMDA that the Master Plan is not a static document but is subject to changes from time to time as per the needs of the area.

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding River Fishery Mahals, Tinsukia, Assam, 13/11/2016
petitioner: Dibru Part-I Meen Samabay Samiti & Rangagorah Fishermen Co-operative Society Ltd.  & Others
summary: A Committee is constituted to define and re-define River Fishery Mahals.

subject: Air Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding air pollution in NCT Delhi, 14/11/2017
summary: Court directs that the express highway project of Eastern Peripheral Expressway would continue subject to Senior most officer of the NHAI filing an undertaking that they shall fully ensure that there are no dust emission and no pollution is caused by their activity. NGT also directs Ministry of Environment, Forest & Climate Change, Ministry of Transport, NCT Delhi, PCBs and all the concerned State Governments in NCR Delhi to fully coordinate and cooperate to control the pollutant in the ambient air quality of NCR Delhi and take all effective steps in accordance with the orders of the Tribunal.

subject: Water Pollution
title: Supreme Court order regarding sewage treatment and for bringing Ulhas and Walduni rivers to their natural state, 14/11/2017
summary: It has also been brought to our notice that there are more than 500 jeans washing units that are discharging effluents into the rivers. It is stated that show cause notices have been issued to all of them. Court directs an affidavit to be filed in this regard. The Chief Secretary has assured that he will monitor the entire programme for cleaning up these two rivers and will be bound by the affidavit that he has filed in this regard with regard to the short-term and long-term solutions.

subject: Water Resources
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding grant of Environmental Clearance to Teesta-IV Hydro-Electric Project, Sikkim, 15/11/2017
respondent: Ministry of Environment and Forests & Others
summary: NGT while refusing to quash the EC laid down certain conditions for the Project Proponent (NHPC) which are: (a) 3 regime e-flow in consultation with the experts of CIFRI to the MoEF&CC to the satisfaction of the EAC. (b) Prepare a mitigation plan to prevent reservoir induced seismicity due to Teesta IV Project for consideration and approval by MoEF & CC.

subject: Water Resources
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding Rabindra Sarobar Lake conservation, Kolkata, West Bengal, 15/11/2017
summary: NGT Eastern Bench directs KMDA (Kolkata Metropolitan Development Authority) to prepare a DPR (Detailed Project Report) for implementation of the recommendations under “Flora and Fauna, water quality of the Sarovar (Lake) and Lake sediments & sub surface soil “in consultation with experts from Botanical Survey of India, Zoological Survey of India, the State Biodiversity Board and Water Resource Department, Govt. of West Bengal. Night time matches/tournaments shall be strictly prohibited in the Rabindra Sarobar Stadium, day time activities will be permitted but without bursting of fire crackers and with regulated sound intensity and regulated traffic.

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding installation of rainwater harvesting systems in all the schools and colleges in NCT Delhi, 16/11/2017
summary: NGT directs all the schools and colleges to install rainwater harvesting systems, if not already installed, within a period of two months from today at their own cost. Any institution which does not comply with these directions shall be liable to pay a environmental compensation of Rs. 5 Lakh after expiry of the period of two months granted in this judgment.

subject: Air Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding air pollution due to burning of agricultural residues, 16/11/2017
summary: NGT directs NTPC to file complete details of its total demand of coal and how much agricultural residue either in the form of pellet or otherwise it can use, if not purely at least mixed with coal, in all the coal based Thermal Power Houses in the States of Punjab, Haryana, Himachal Pradesh and Uttar Pradesh.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding approval for construction of the capital city of Amaravati, Andhra Pradesh, 17/11/2017
summary: NGT while refusing to set aside the environmental clearance dated 9th October 2015, granted to the Amaravati project included certain conditions as part of the environment clearance which includes: 1. No alteration of the river or natural storm water morphology, flow pattern and location by way of straightening shall be permitted 2. State should prepare a comprehensive City specific action Plan to mitigate impact of climate change with a view to achieve carbon neutrality 3. The 251 acres of forest land should be preserved as green lungs of the City and not to be diverted for nonforestry uses 4. All the hills and hillocks in the catchment area of Kondaveeti Vagu, its tributaries and other storm water drains/channels should be treated with intensive soil and water conservation measures.

subject: Air Pollution
title: Supreme Court order regarding rising air pollution in Delhi NCR, 17/11/2017
summary: Apex Court notes that pollution caused by pet coke and furnace oil is not a problem confined only to the NCR region but appears to be a problem faced by almost all the States and Union Territories in the country. Supreme Court requests all the State Governments and Union Territories to consider taking similar measures as have been taken by the Government of India and the Chairman of the Central Pollution Control Board under Section 5 of the Environment (Protection) Act, 1986.

subject: Environment
title: Supreme Court order regarding felling of trees in the area of Taj Trapezium Zone, Agra, Uttar Pradesh, 20/11/2017
summary: Notice to be issued to the Taj Trapezium Zone Authority, Agra if there is any comprehensive action plan for protection of Taj Mahal not only from environment point of view but also in regard to other aspects and also to produce the vision document, if any. The Court also asked the Taj Trapezium Zone Authority to explain why it is not meeting every two months as it is expected to do.

subject: Industry
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding requisite environmental clearance for a project/ construction at Katraj Road, Wadala, Mumbai, 21/11/2017
summary: NGT Western Zone Bench rejects the Application on the ground that the decision to withdraw the proposed directions under Section 5 of the Environment (Protection) Act, 1986 merged into the EC dated 13th October, 2015.

subject: Wildlife and Biodiversity
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding commercial establishments located in Buxa Tiger Reserve Forest Area, West Bengal, 22/11/2017
summary: NGT directs that that steps should be taken for ensuring that the Buxa Tiger Reserve Forest is made free from all encroachments. Further measures be taken to prevent settlement of any person and to prohibit any commercial activity to be undertaken within the protected area. Subhas Datta, the Applicant, has stated that there are several Govt. establishments also existing within the reserve forest area. NGT directs this claim to be examined by the West Bengal Government and appropriate affidavit be filed dealing with this aspect in their report.

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding encroachments on Deepor Beel, Guwahati, Assam, 23/11/2017
summary: NGT Eastern Zone Bench directs the GMDA (Guwahati Metropolitan Development Authority) to inspect and survey and ascertain as to whether any encroachments have been made on any of the protected water bodies near Deepor Beel.

subject: Air Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding regarding registration of heavy commercial diesel vehicles, Delhi, 24/11/2017
summary: NGT allows the Application on the condition that the new vehicles should be BS-IV compliant and the vehicles should be used only for exclusive purpose of transporting of aviation turbine fuel and no other use.

subject: Forests
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding felling of trees across the state of Punjab, 24/11/2017
petitioner: Peacock Environment & Wild Life Protection Society
summary: Divisional Forest Officer's from three Divisions submit before the Tribunal that they need time to verify whether more than 1 Lacs trees actually been planted, what is present status of the trees and when they were planted, what is their height and mortality rate. NGT gives time till 30th November, 2017 the next date of hearing. The Court also made it clear that only after verification of the afforestation that the Court would be passing orders on the project of NHAI and other Project Proponent including that of PWD.

subject: Environment
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding the issue of noise pollution caused by aircrafts in run way 11/29 of the IGI Airport, New Delhi, 24/11/2017
petitioner: Society for Protection of Culture Heritage, Environment, Traditions and Promotions of National Awareness (CHETNA)
summary: NGT refuses to impose night curfew on landing or taking off of aircrafts at the IGI airport and more particularly on run way no. 11/29. The Court also directs all the official respondents to take all mitigating measures for reducing noise pollution and act in furtherance to the report of IIT in relation to construction of sound barriers.

subject: Industry
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding Environment Clearance (EC) granted by the Goa State Environment Impact Assessment authority to a construction project, village Candola, Taluka Ponda, Goa, 27/11/2017
respondent: M/S Gera Developments Pvt Ltd. & Others
summary: NGT disposes of the Application as it is "beyond the time prescribed by law".

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding establishment of STPs in the town of Jowai, Meghalaya
summary: Dr. Todi, Advocate General appearing for the State of Meghalaya, submits that action for establishment of STPs in the Jowai Municipal area has been initiated and it has been decided that considering the topography of Jowai town several STPs have been planned. NGT makes it clear that establishment of the STPs cannot be avoided in the larger public interest of the area and the common STPs should be planned keeping in view the future growth of the Jowai town and the resultant increase in load.

subject: Air Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding air pollution in Muradabad City, Uttar Pradesh, 27/11/2017
summary: Counsel appearing for the State of Uttar Pradesh and Uttar Pradesh Pollution Control Board submit that they will do every possible preventive and precautionary measures to ensure that the ambient air quality in Muradabad City meets the prescribed standards or atleast is not of seriously polluting or hazardous.

subject: Water Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding cleaning up of Bellandur lake in Bengaluru, 27/11/2017
summary: Court directs the State of Karnataka to issue notice to all the builders who had constructed flats near Bellandur Lake without constructing sewage treatment plants (STP).

subject: Industry
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding the closure directions issued by the closure directions issued by Chhattisgarh Environment Conservation Board against a chemical industry, Raipur, Chhattisgarh 28/11/2017
summary: NGT sets aside the closure order issued by Chhattisgarh Environment Conservation Board under the Water Act of 1974 which was based upon the assumption that the acidity in the water is as a result of the operation of the unit. against the chemical industry of Prasoon Kumar under Section 33 (A) of Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act, 1974. NGT sets aside the closure order issued by Chhattisgarh Environment Conservation Board under the Water Act of 1974 which was based upon the assumption that the acidity in the water is as a result of the operation of the unit.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding demolition of structures within 200 mtrs of HTL (No Development Zone) along the Anjuna beach, Bardez, Goa, 29/11/2017
summary: NGT while disposing of the Application ordered that GCZMA after giving hearing to the Applicant (Goa Paryavaran Savarakshan Sangharsha Samitee) and Respondent (Liliput Bar & Restaurant) shall pass such order or directions in accordance with Law.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding consent to operate granted to the sugar industry - Sahakar Maharshi Shivajirao Narayanrao Nagawade, Sahakari Sakhar Karkhana Ltd., District Ahmednagar, Maharashtra, 29/11/2017
summary: The Court notes that the Appeal has been preferred after the period prescribed for filing the same under Section 16 of National Green Tribunal Act, 2010 i.e. of 30 days lapsed. Delay incurred in filing the Appeal needs to be explained appropriately so as to furnish sufficient cause for condoning the delay.

subject: Mining
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding illegal and unauthorized mining in the state of Uttar Pradesh, 29/11/2017
respondent: Ministry of Environment, Forests & Climate Change & Others
summary: Counsel appearing for the State of Uttar Pradesh submits that the State has identified as many as 112 persons who had carried on illegal mining activity. Action has been taken against them, they have been blacklisted and also penalty under the mines and mineral act and the rules framed thereunder has been imposed upon them, however, recoveries are awaited. The Counsel for the State of U.P. further informed the Court that the guidelines submitted by the High Powered Committee are acceptable to the State and in fact their mining plan submitted by the State of U.P. is on those lines and has also been concurred by the MoEF.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding hotels in Mahipalpur, Delhi operating without requisite permission, 29/11/2017
summary: NGT directs NCT of Delhi and Delhi Pollution Control Committee to submit a report of the hotels that are operating in Mahipalpur.

subject: Mining
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding sand mining in Uttar Pradesh, 29/11/2017
summary: Counsel appearing for the State of Uttar Pradesh submits that the Notification dated 2nd November, 2017 is for a very limited purpose by which land owners of agriculture land would be permitted to remove the sand deposits as a result of flood and it does not permit any mining activity as such.

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding state of groundwater in Delhi, 30/11/2017
petitioner: Legal Aid, National Green Tribunal Bar Association
summary: The CEO, Delhi Jal Board, Managing Director, DSIIDC and the concerned Secretary of NCT Delhi shall hold a meeting and inform the Tribunal as to clear stand of these authorities collectively with regard to extraction of groundwater in highly exploited areas with reference to Notification dated 10th July, 2010 and regulations thereof and the alternatives that have to be provided.

subject: Air Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding air pollution in cities of Kerala, 04/12/2017
summary: The Court observed that by order dated 05.08.2016, the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) was directed to file a report on the Ambient Air Quality (AAQ) of cities of Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Kochi, Thrissur, Calicut and Kannur within one month and that report is yet to be filed. NGT directs the report to be filed by 16.01.2018.

subject: Mining
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding illegal mining of minor minerals in Saharanpur, Uttar Pradesh, 04/12/2017
summary: Counsel appearing for the State of Uttar Pradesh upon instructions from Pankaj Kumar Singh, Mining Officer, District Saharanpur submits that the restoration and restitution work directed by the High Powered Committee will be carried on and areas where degradation or environmental damage has been noticed by the High Powered Committee constituted by the Tribunal, the State of Uttar Pradesh would exclude such pockets while granting mining permission for the current year.

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding extraction of groundwater by constructions projects in Noida, Uttar Pradesh, 04/12/2017
summary: CGWA in the report submitted before the Tribunal states that the information about the quantity of water extraction by those who have extracted from the borewell period wise is difficult.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding discharge of untreated effluents from industries, Muzaffarnagar, Uttar Pradesh, 04/12/2017
summary: NGT was critical of the three reports submitted by the Joint Inspection Team saying it lacked "evidencery value and denies scientific reasoning" and cited that in two reports BOD at intlet is more than 5000 mg/l while in one report it is shown as 439 mg/l. Court directs the Member Secretary of the Pollution Control Boards and Uttar Pradesh Pollution Control Board submit a scientific report commenting upon the three reports that has been placed before the Tribunal.

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding ground water extraction/ packaging of drinking water, Sriperumbudur Taluk, Kanchipuram, Tamil Nadu, 06/12/2017
respondent: Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board & Others
summary: The matter relates to ground water extraction, processing or packaging of drinking water being undertaken in Survey No.177/2, Sivan Koil Street, Tharapakkam, Sriperumbudur Taluk, Kanchipuram, Tamil Nadu. NGT disposes of this Application as the unit run by Sharvantika Minerals, Kancheepuram District, Tamil Nadu is closed and nothing survives in the Application.

subject: Water Resources
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding forest clearance to the Thoubal Multipurpose Project, Manipur, 06/12/2017
summary: NGT allows the Review Application subject to : 1. The State of Manipur and the Irrigation and Flood Control Department, Government of Manipur shall ensure that the FRA, 2006 is duly complied with 2. The State respondents shall ensure that the Gram Sabha of the area or its equivalent is consulted as required under the Act. 3. All efforts shall be made to bring the actions taken thus far while carrying out the project by the project proponent, in accord with the provisions of FRA 2006.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding pollution caused by Srivalli Sago Factory, Vazhapadi Taluk, Selam District, Tamil Nadu, 07/12/2017
respondent: Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board & Others
summary: The reply filed by the Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board states that when the unit was inspected on 12.09.2017, it was found that the unit was not in operation but the unit has established the ETP in the premises. NGT disposes of the Application with the direction that the unit will not operate the unit without the required consent.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding construction of hotels which are running unauthorisedly in Kasauli, Himachal Pradesh, 07/12/2017
petitioner: Society for Preservation of Kasauli and its Environs (SPOKE)
summary: National Green Tribunal passes the following directions: 1. Hotel Barog Heights shall demolish the structure which is unauthorised and in exercise to the provisions of Himachal Pradesh Town & Country Planning Act, 1977. 2. Hotel shall pay environmental compensation of Rs. 10,00,000/- (Rupees Ten lakhs). 3. As a part of the Solid Waste Management, the Noticee (M/s Barog Heights) should segregate and process all the kitchen and food waste from the hotel and restaurant within the hotel premises for production of biogas.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding unauthorized construction of hotels in Manali, Himachal Pradesh, 08/12/2017
summary: Counsel appearing for the hotel submits that they are prepared to take all corrective, restorative and all other actions and measures to protect and restore environment, ecology in that area and in pursuance of that the hotel would give possession of 877 Sq.mt. of Government land back to the Government and would demolish the double storey structure beyond the Hotel which had been constructed and put to commercial use so far.

subject: Governance & Institutions
title: Supreme Court order regarding inhuman conditions in 1382 prisons of India,12/12/2017
summary: Supreme Court directs the Ministry of Home Affairs to have a meeting with the Directors General and Inspectors General of Prison of all the State Governments and Union Territories to see the feasibility of establishing open prisons. The Ministry of Home Affairs will send a communication to the concerned authorities in the State Governments and Union Territories asking for their response to the idea of open prisons – whether they are willing to set up open prisons and the manner in which the open prisons could be operated.

subject: Environment
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding noise pollution by Delhi Metro, 12/12/2017
summary: NGT disposes of this application with the direction that DMRC shall maintain and adhere to the prescribed norms of noise pollution while carrying on its activity. The Court also directs the Delhi Pollution Control Committee to keep a complete supervision in that behalf.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: Supreme Court order regarding state of solid waste management in India, 12/12/2017
petitioner: In Re: Outrage as parents end life after child's dengue death & Others
summary: Additional Solicitor General has informed the Apex Court that Rule 23 of the Solid Waste Management Rules, 2016 requires the setting up of a State Level Advisory Body (SLAB) and that in the first meeting of the Central Monitoring Committee on implementation of the Rules held on 27th January, 2017, the CPCB was asked to review the status of constitution of the State Level Advisory Body and issue directions under the Environment (Protection) Act, 1986 to the defaulting States and Union Territories for constitution of SLAB. Only 15 States and Union Territories have responded. Supreme Court directs the the MOEF to issue a communication to all the State Governments within two weeks requiring information from the State Governments about the setting up of the SLAB and other details. Supreme Court asks for a definite plan of action to be prepared as also a strategy for solid waste management in Delhi so that it can be replicated in other parts of the country.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding Royal Calcutta Turf Club in Kolkata Maidan releasing effluents without treatment, Kolkata, West Bengal, 12/12/2017
summary: Counsel for the Royal Calcutta Turf Club, submits that the club has taken a large number of measures for taking care of the discharge of waste water and for dealing with solid waste. He further submits that they are in the process of preparing a detailed project for it. He prays that time be granted to place such report before the Tribunal.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order on the matter to declare the process of manufacturing of LABSA as a white category industry, Kolkata, West Bengal, 13/12/2017
summary: NGT directs a committee to be constituted to inspect the industry concerned and take appropriate steps to examine the self-assessment report submitted by the Applicant industry Sai Sulphonates Pvt. Ltd.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding pollution caused by Mejia Thermal Power Station, Bankura, West Bengal, 13/12/2017
summary: The Enquiry Report substantiates environmental degradation both in terms of air and water pollution and therefore the Court directs the power plant to show cause before the next date (31/01/2018) as to why the plant shall not be ordered to be shut down for not having followed the pollution norms.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding solid waste management in the state of Meghalaya, 13/12/2017
petitioner: Environment Pollution & Health Hazards in the State
summary: NGT Eastern Bench directs the State of Meghalaya, MUDA (Meghalaya Urban Development Authority) and Municipal Bodies to file a report regarding solid waste treatment plant. The Court noted that in hilly areas a land fill site is difficult. In order to get over these impediments, the State of Goa has come up with an unique scheme which involves utilisation of the same land fill site for establishment of comprehensive solid waste treatment i.e., composting of biodegradable waste, recycling of plastic and other solid wastes, waste to energy plant including the initial segregation. The Court observed that Meghalaya should consider adopting this method.

subject: Environment
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding preservation of Amarnath Cave in Himalayas, 13/12/2017
summary: NGT directs that no pilgrim/devotee/person would be permitted to carry any article from the last stairs leading to the holy cave and from the end point of stairs and area of the holy cave only shall be treated as silence zone.

subject: Wildlife and Biodiversity
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding illegal encroachment and destruction of mangroves in Sundarbans, South 24 Parganas, West Bengal, 14/12/2017
summary: NGT Eastern Bench directs the concerned state departments to examine and take appropriate action for replenishment of mangroves and a report to be filed on the next date of hearing (24/01/2018).

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding pollution caused by Kolaghat Thermal Power Station, 14/12/2017
summary: In order to resolve this discrepancy NGT directs a joint committee consisting of members of both the CPCB and State PCB to be constituted which would once again ascertain the emission level and ascertain as to whether it complies with the prescribed level of emission at 100 mg/Nm3 as required under the guidelines prescribed by the MOEF as this was expected to be achieved by 7.12.2017.

subject: Environment
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding preservation of Amarnath Shrine, 14/12/2017
summary: NGT makes it clear that its order dated 13th December, 2017 has neither intended nor actually declared the entire area falling under the Amarnath Shrine Board as a Silence Zone. The only restriction the Tribunal had placed is that the devotee/pilgrim or anybody while standing in front of the Amarnath Shivling – a natural formation in the cave shall maintain silence at that place. This restriction shall not apply to the daily Aarti that is performed.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding illegal and unauthorized construction by hotels in Kullu, Manali, Himachal Pradesh, 18/12/2017
summary: NGT imposes environmental compensation of Rs. 20 lacs (Rupees Twenty Lakhs only) on hotel Citrus Manali Resort. Also the hotel is directed to demolish the unauthorised structures right from 2006 till date to the extent of 2776.11 sq. meters. NGT asks the Chief Secretary of State of Himachal Pradesh to take appropriate disciplinary action in regard to dereliction of duty and for not maintaining the records and taking action in accordance with law against all the employees, officers and officials who have dealt with this file whether they are in service or have retired and providing undue advantage to the hotels.

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding illegal constructions on Ganga floodplains, Uttarakhand, 18/12/2017
respondent: Darrameks Hotels and Developers Pvt. Ltd. & Others
summary: Counsel appearing for the State of Uttarakhand submits that they have already taken effective steps in furtherance to the Judgment of 01st September, 2016 and issued a GO/Notification on 29th September, 2017 and that steps have been taken to demarcate the River Ganga.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding construction of hotels which are running unauthorisedly in Kasauli, Himachal Pradesh, 18/12/2017
petitioner: Society for Preservation of Kasauli and its Environs (SPOKE)
summary: NGT reduces the environmental compensation payable by the Barog Heights Hotel from Rs. 10 lacs to Rs. 5 Lacs as the Hotel has given an undertaking that it will carry out works in the interest of environment and ecology and make the improvements in discharge of its corporate social responsibility.

subject: Forests
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding demarcation of the Ridge forest land, Delhi, 20/12/2017
respondent: State of NCT of Delhi & Others
summary: NGT clearly states that the process of demarcation as given in the ‘Schedule of Demarcation’ pertinently envisages the comprehensive demarcation with TSM (Total Satellite Machine) by providing exact boundary description and maps of the ridge area/ forest land in relation to the forest land in three villages i.e. Ranpuri, Rajokari and Ghitorni in Vasant Vihar Sub division, Delhi. The regime thus prescribed for process needs to be strictly followed otherwise it will open flood gates of claims and counter claims by all concerned parties particularly the parties having lands adjoining ridge area/forest lands in the said three villages.

subject: Water Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding blood of slaughtered animals flowing directly into the river Yamuna, 20/12/2017
summary: Court directs that no blood of slaughtered animals shall be allowed to flow directly into the river Yamuna as it clearly violates the provisions of Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act, 1974.

subject: Mining
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding illegal mining in Village Patti Kalan, District Rampur, Uttar Pradesh, 21/12/2017
respondent: Ministry of Environment, Forests and Climate Change & Others
summary: NGT directs the Central Pollution Control Board and Ministry of Environment, Forest & Climate Change to appoint Senior Scientist one each to visit the site and give report regarding the environmental damage caused due to such mining. Concerned authorities of district Rampur shall provide all logistic support as well as the necessary help in identifying the said place in river bed of river Kosi.

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding regarding concretization in river Yamuna, Uttar Pradesh, 21/12/2017
summary: The Applicant Akash Vashishtha contends that the Respondents are doing construction of 4 to 5 feet of concrete wall in the middle of the river taking disadvantage of the permission to carry out the sheet pile work vide order dated 31st May, 2017 and this work will damage the aquatic life of the river. The State of Uttar Pradesh contends that the concretization work for strengthening the base of sheet piling is being carried out at the left side of the river Yamuna and no work is being carried out in the middle of the river.

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding of revival of pond in Janakpuri Najafgarh Tehsil, Delhi, 21/12/2017
respondent: State of NCT of Delhi & Others
summary: NGT directs Secretary State of NCT of Delhi and Chief Engineer, Public Works Department to pass appropriate orders for revival of the pond.

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding Yamuna floodplain constructions, Agra, Uttar Pradesh, 21/12/2017
summary: The Resident Welfare Association of Rajshree Garden Colony situated in Dayal Bagh Area at Agra has moved this Application for modification of the order dated 29th August, 2017 requiring demolition of the structures falling within the high flood line. Counsel appearing on behalf of the Association submits that the report dated 25th July, 2016 of the Irrigation Department of the State of Uttar Pradesh and the report of the Local Commissioner reveal that the construction/structures of the Association falls out of the flood plain line. He submits that only the boundary wall of the colony is abutting the pillar earmarking the flood plain and the boundary wall has been demolished. NGT directs the State of Uttar Pradesh and Uttar Pradesh Pollution Control Board to confirm whether the wall has been demolished.

subject: Environment
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding environmental pollution caused by a fire engineering institute, Dwarka, Delhi, 21/12/2017
respondent: Delhi Institute of Fire Engineering & Others
summary: The issue relate to the institute of fire engineering located at Dwarka, Delhi posing threat of environmental pollution on account of their fire fighting activities and storage of hazardous substances. Delhi Pollution Control Committee shall look into the matter within a month and take action in accordance with law.

subject: Wildlife and Biodiversity
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding notification defining ecologically sensitive area in western Ghat Region, 21/12/2017
summary: The issue is regarding the notification defining ecologically sensitive area (ESA) in western Ghat Region within the State of Kerala. Court refuses to intervene in the process of issuance of final of notification.

subject: Environment
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding pollution caused by Health View Holidays Resorts, Mahabaleshwar, Maharashtra, 22.12.2017
petitioner: M/s Health View Holidays Resorts Ltd
summary: The issue relates to closure of the Health View Holiday Resorts, Mahabaleshwar on the ground that it has committed breach of Consent Terms and Conditions granted on 18th March, 2017 and has been the source of pollution, generating more than 100 MLD of sewage without treatment, operating 86 rooms against 59 rooms for which consent was granted. NGT directs MPCB to inspect the hotel to see whether all the deficiencies have been removed.

subject: Industry
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding the LPG Terminal of the India Oil Corporation Ltd at Puthuvypeen, Cochin, Kerala, 22/12/2017
respondent: Ministry of Environment and Forests & Others
summary: NGT while refusing to cancel the environmental clearance granted to the Puthuvypeen project or demolition of the structure as sought for by the fisherfolks asks Elankunnappuzha Grama Panchayat to carry out the recommendation of the Department of Ocean Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology to arrest the large scale coastal erosion and during the construction, the shore line configuration shall be closely monitored by the authorities including State Coastal Zone Management Authority of Kerala.

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding extraction of grounwater by hotels in Delhi, 22/12/2017
respondent: Hotel Jaypee Vasant New Delhi & Others
summary: It is stated on behalf of the hotels that all the hotels hold permissions for extraction of ground water granted by the concerned competent authorities as per the extant guidelines and reports of the joint inspections are also on record. NGT directs for issuance of revised guidelines.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding violation of environment clearance (EC) conditions by J.M. Housing Ltd., Uttar Pradesh, 22/12/2017
summary: Court issues notice to MoEF, UPPCB and lists the matter on 13/02/2018.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding unregulated dumping of municipal solid waste at Bakarganj dumping ground, Bareilly, Uttar Pradesh, 02/01/2018
respondent: Uttar Pradesh Pollution Control Board & Others
summary: NGT directs Bareilly Municipal Corporation to place before the Court the complete time bound Action Plan for handing of municipal solid waste as per the Solid Waste Management Rules, 2016 within the limits of the Corporation and for handling and disposal of legacy waste lying at Bakarganj dumping sites.

subject: Mining
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding illegal mining in Beri Ganga Forest Block, Mandore Tehsil and District Jodhpur, Rajasthan, 02/01/2018
summary: This fact is disputed by the State of Rajasthan. However the Court has on record the rejoinder dated 14th November, 2017 which speaks about illegal mining done in the forest block with the help of electricity connections vide report of the Deputy Conservator of Forest, Jodhpur. NGT sssues witness summons to the Executive Engineer, C-Zone, Jodhpur Vidyut Vitran Nigam Ltd. to produce before the Court the records regarding electricity connections given at the said Khasra Numbers before the next date (8th February 2018).

subject: Mining
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding unregulated coal mining, Mehghalaya, 02/01/2018
petitioner: All Dimasa Students Union Dima Hasao Dist. Committee
summary: Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change submits that the Environment and Ecology Restoration Plan particularly the protection of water body's from the threat of unregulated coal mining has been prepared and filed before the Court. NGT directs the plan to be furnished to all the contending parties within a week and it will soon decide on the Action Plan for controlling the Rat Hole Mining which is before the Court.

subject: Air Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding formulation of policy for registration of private vehicles in Delhi/ NCR in accordance with the norms: ‘one family, one car’, 03/01/2018
summary: NGT while dismissing the Application stated the court finds the plea to be pre-mature as the Applicant has not shown anywhere in his Application that he had approached the concerned Governments with the idea he propounds in the present Application.

subject: Air Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding regarding utilization of ash generated by the thermal power plants, 03/01/2018
summary: NGT directs the States and Union Territory to submit their action plan for utilization of ash produced and generated by the power plants in terms of the notifications dated 14-09-1999, 27- 08-2003 and 03-11-2009.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding rehabilitation of 800 slum dwellers in proper accommodation, Santacruz (East), Mumbai, Maharashtra, 04/01/2018
respondent: Chief Executive Officer Slum Rehabilitation Authority & Others
summary: Supreme Court directs the Slum Redevelopment Authority (SRA) invite letters of interest from renowned builders/developers, who have the capacity and experience to take up such a large project by issuing advertisements in not less than three newspapers having wide circulation in Mumbai. The the concerned authorities should ensure that the plans are approved and sanctions granted latest within two months of the submission of the original plans. The successful developer should undertake to complete the rehabilitation of part of the project to rehabilitate all eligible occupiers/slum dwellers within a period of two years from the date of sanction of the plan. dwellers within a period of two years from the date of sanction of the plan.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding illegal dumping of solid waste generated within the limits of Palwal Municipal Council, Haryana, 05/01/2018
summary: It is not in dispute that there is no authorization under Solid Waste Rules for carrying on dumping of the solid waste at the said site. Counsel appearing on behalf of Palwal Municipal Council submits that it is a part of the cluster approach taken for disposal of the solid waste in Almitra H. Patel Case and the waste generated within the limits of the Council is to be disposed of by composting within the cluster of Punhana vide Action Plan of Palwal Municipal Council. As the Action Plan fails to give clear cut timelines for achieving the goal stepwise, NGT directs State of Haryana and Palwal Municipal Council to place before the Court a time bound action plan regarding collection, segregation, processing and disposal of the solid waste generated within the limits of Palwal Municipal Council in accordance with Solid Waste Management Rules, 2016.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding use of an abandoned quarry as a solid waste dumping site by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike, 05/01/2018
summary: The Court finds that the quarry which has been shown as a landfill site, has been utilized by the BBMP for dumping of waste without there being any waste processing site at the same landfill site or at a ny other place within the limit of BBMP. The Court further says that if the present site have been utilized for dumping of the waste, it is necessary that all the waste dumped so far is handled in the manner specified in the Schedule - I of the Solid Waste Management Rules, 2016. Counsel for BBMP seeks time to provide solution to the present problem.

subject: Air Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding switch over to cleaner fuel CNG, Gujarat, 05/01/2018
summary: As there is no one on behalf of the State of Gujarat to place before the Court the manner in which there will be gradual transition to switch over to CNG the matter has been listed on 22nd February, 2018.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order on the issue of pickling, plating and polishing without the use of cyanide, Uttar Pradesh, 05/01/2018
respondent: Uttar Pradesh Pollution Control Board & Others
summary: This Application has been moved for direction to Uttar Pradesh Pollution Control Board to explain the process of pickling, plating and polishing without the use of cyanide. Time sought to file reply.

subject: Mining
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding illegal mining of sand at the bank of river Narangi, Kondagaon, Chhattisgarh, 05/01/2018
summary: Fact of illegal mining is not disputed. The Court said the equipment used for sand mining in the present case is a JCB which when used h as a capacity to do environmental deg radation to the highest extent. NGT directs the noticee (Pradeep Sinha) to pay environmental compensation of Rs. 1.5 lacs to the Chhattisgarh State Pollution Control Board.

subject: Health, Food Safety, Pesticides
title: Supreme Court order regarding amendment to the Cigarettes and other Tobacco Products (Packaging and Labelling Rules) 2008, as amended by the amending Rules of 2014, 08/01/2018
summary: Supreme Court directs stay of operation of the judgment and order passed by the High Court of Karnataka which had set aside the 2014 rules and paved the way for 85 percent space for pictorial warnings on both sides of packets of cigarettes and other products.
