Supreme Court stated that health of a citizen has primacy and he or she should be aware of that which can affect or deteriorate the condition of health.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding demolition of structures constructed at Pimpri Waghere, Taluka Haveli, District Pune
respondent: Principal Secretary, Environment, Government of Maharashtra & Others
summary: The matter relates to demolition of structures constructed at Pimpri Waghere, Taluka Haveli, District Pune, falling within limits of Pune Chinchwand Municipal Corporation (PCMC) and restoration of the said area having regard to environmental damage caused by the said development. M/s Goel Ganga Construction has raised exceptions to maintainability of the Main Application on the grounds of limitation, jurisdiction and plurality of reliefs which has been rejected by NGT and matter is listed for hearing on 12/02/2018.

subject: Mining
title: Order of the National Green Tribunal operation of coal mines in Lodna area of Joyrampur Colliery near Dhanbad without environment clearance, Jharkhand, 08/01/2018
summary: NGT finds that substantial question relating to environment is involved in the present case that requires determination.

subject: Forests
title: Supreme Court order regarding encroachment of Pachmarhi cantonment land, Madhya Pradesh, 12/01/2018
summary: It has come to the notice of the Supreme Court that the meetings being held by the Ministry of Defence on the issue of cantonment land in Panchmarhi are not being attended by the State of Madhya Pradesh. Supreme Court directs that the he Chief Secretary of the State of Madhya Pradesh to ensure that the State is represented in these meetings.
case_status_comments: Next hearing on after eight weeks

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding closure of a printing press in Kalinga Nagar, Bhubaneswar, Odisha by State PCB, 09/01/2018
summary: The matter relates to closure of a printing press “M/s Pioneer Press” situated at Plot No. 23/128/154 in Khata No. 61/468, Mouza, Subhudhipur, Kalinga Nagar, Bhubaneswar by Odisha State PCB as the printing press had not obtained consent to establish and consent to operate required both under the Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act, 1974 and under the Air (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act, 1981. NGT Eastern Bench directs the State PCB to consider and dispose of the application for consent to establish and consent to operate filed by the Appellant printing press within a period of 30 days from hence.

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding dumping of fly ash and filling up parts of Dankuni Wetland at Mollarber Mouza, Hooghly District, West Bengal, 09/01/2018
petitioner: People United for Better Living in Calcutta (Public) & Others
summary: NGT directs the District Magistrate and the Superintendent of Police, Hooghly district, to take immediate steps to ensure that such illegal activities are stopped forthwith, the culprits identified and appropriate action taken against them inaccordance with law. The dumpers/trucks and machineries being used for dumping fly ash shall be seized and kept in the custody of Dankuni PS until further orders.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding construction of a multi-storey residential complex on the eastern bank of Chilavannurkayal (backwaters) in Kerala, 10/01/2018
summary: Supreme Court directs that in future, wherever permissions are required to come and are to be obtained before commencement of construction, it would be no answer that activity can be carried on without obtaining the permissions. Simultaneously, the permissions itself are envisaged in a time bound schedule and not through improvement of cases by authorities running into years. Thus, from the inception itself, there should be clarity on what is permissible and what is not. Apex Court sustains the fine of Rs.1 crore on DLF Universal Limited with the direction for strict adherence to the norms in future and avoidance of contradictions by the authorities. This amount is to be deposited before the District Collector, Ernakulam to be kept in a separate account for being used exclusively for building up the environment, maintaining ecological balance in the area situated on the eastern side of the Chilavannur river, with a further direction to the District Collector to submit periodic reports before the Court as to the utilisation of the amount for the activities undertaken, in every six months.

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding Chambal river conservation, 10/01/2018
summary: Counsel for the State of Rajasthan submits that the work at Sajidera has already been completed and at Ram Dham it is 80% completed and he would be filing the time bound Action Plan for construction of STP. He further submitted that as already ordered the water to the extent of 5000 cusec (once in a week) is being released to the river Chambal during the lean season by reducing the supply of water to the industries. NGT Central Zonal Bench, Bhopal directs DFO, Kota to file status of the Chambal Gharial Sanctuary regarding the extent of water and animals like Gharial.

subject: Wildlife and Biodiversity
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding Gwalior- Shivpuri section of NH-3 passing through Madhav National Park, Shivpuri District, Madhya Pradesh, 10/01/2018
summary: Counsel appearing for the National Highway Authority of India (NHAI) filed a joint inspection report wherein it has been stated that according to the Assistant Director Madhav National Park, V.S. Yadav between Km. 25 and Km. 28 two openings of 3 x 3 meters size are required for passage for the wild animals. The NHAI may file their response as to how and when these openings will be provided before the next date of hearing (07/02/2018).

subject: Water Resources
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding de-commissioning of Mullaperiyar Dam, 11/01/2018
judge_name: Dipak Misra, A.M. Khanwilkar, D.Y. Chandrachud
summary: The petition has stated that the Chief Engineer of the dam project, Mr. John Pennycuick envisaged the lifetime of the dam for a period of 50 years. As 121 years have expired from the date of the construction of the dam, the decommissioning of the said dam has become essential and there is need for assessment of the lifespan of the dam regard being had to the safety of the citizens especially the persons residing downstream of the river.

subject: Forests
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding dead and fallen trees posing danger to human life and property, Punjab, 11/01/2018
summary: NGT permits the State Forest Department, Government of Punjab to cut and or fell the dead, dry and fallen trees.

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding construction on the Mahanoy river, Munger, Bihar, 11/01/2018
summary: The Court directed the State to look into the matter as neither the river nor its banks can be used for any activity leave alone construction of permanent structures. The District Magistrate, Munger, is directed to make enquiry by visiting the spot.

subject: Mining
title: Supreme Court order regarding pollution caused by stone crushing units in Bharatpur, Rajasthan, 15/01/2018
summary: By a letter dated 06.11.2012, the Rajasthan State Pollution Control Board, directed the appellant (Aman Sethi) to close down his stone crushing plant at Bharatpur. The High Court of Rajasthan allowed the appellant to withdraw his Writ Petition so that it could approach the National Green Tribunal which dismissed the case on the ground of delay. Supreme Court accepts that in the interest of justice, the Writ Petition now needs to be set down for hearing on merits.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding generation of hazardous waste and its disposal, India, 15/01/2018
summary: The Court had asked for filing of an independent application in relation to management of bio-medical hazardous waste in the States of Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan, Haryana, Uttarakhand and NCT of Delhi. Notice issued to State of Uttarakhand and NCT of Delhi why they have not given the answers to the queries made to them vide order dated 29-08- 2017.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding ground water pollution caused by M/s. Century Pulp & Paper Mill, Ghanshyamdham, Lalkua, Uttarakhand, 15/01/2018
summary: The remedial action plan submitted by the Joint Inspection Team comprising of senior scientists from University of Jammu, Central Pollution Control Board and IIT-Roorkee, Saharanpur has suggested that Century Paper Mill should install Mark II hand pumps in Bindukhatta, Shantipuri Villages/village alongside Paha drain and de-sludge the “ Paha nallah” at least upto 5 kms down and also carry out regular inspection of drain line. Further Century Paper Mill should explore the feasibility of use of treated effluent for irrigation purpose in a scientific and controlled manner.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding groundwater withdrawal by M/s. Rathi Steel, Uttar Pradesh, 15/01/2018
summary: A report filed by the Joint Inspection Team reveals that the industry has been abstracting water through three borewells with submersible pumps of 20 HP capacity and stored in a tank (capacity 35300CFT)for further industrial and domestic uses without their being authorization to do so. The report also mentions that level of PM 10 in the ambient air has exceeded standards. NGT directs M/s. Rathi Steel & Power Limited to show cause as to why appropriate action including imposition of compensation for its contribution to the ambient air of PM 10 with resultant rise in parameter of PM10 in ambient air.

subject: Environment
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding availability of water for animals near a proposed nuclear power plant in the Fatehabad district of Haryana, 15/01/2018
petitioner: Akhil Bhartiya Jeev Raksha Bishnoi Sabha (Regd.) & Others
summary: It has been placed before the Court that the order dated 23rd May, 2017 requiring the Forest Department of Government of Haryana and Nuclear Power Corporation of India Limited (NPCIL) to provide water holes for animals in the area in question has been complied with. NGT was hearing a plea filed by Akhil Bhartiya Jeev Raksha Bishnoi Sabha challenging the environment clearance granted to NPCIL.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding pollution caused by a poultry farm situated near a school, Shaamli, Uttar Pradesh, 15/01/2018
summary: The Court refused to change its order regarding closure of the poultry farm that a six year old had objected to saying the smell was causing breathing problems among children. Court directs the birds to be removed from the poultry farm and disposed of in accordance with law.

subject: Mining
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding pollution caused by movement of stone crushing materials in open vehicles, Himachal Pradesh, 15/01/2018
summary: The Applicant has alleged that there is gross violation of the direction that stated that no multi-axle vehicles shall ply on the village roads and all vehicles shall always carry stone crush material in covered condition. Court directs the Applicant to place on record every relevant material including the photographs supporting his contentions.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding pollution caused by Himadri Chemicals, Singur, West Bengal, 16/01/2018
summary: The Applicant Shivaji Chatterjee prays for an interim direction for inspection of the unit by a Committee which had conducted similar inspection earlier in terms of the order of the State PCB dated 23.03.2010 in view of the unabated pollution resulting due to the operation of the unit and the deleterious effect on the villagers caused by such pollution.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding biomedical waste management by the Institute of Human Behavior and Allied Sciences, Delhi, 18/01/2018
summary: NGT directs the Institute of Human Behavior and Allied Sciences, Delhi to communicate to the Central Pollution Control Board all particulars of the microwave waste treatment unit to be installed within a week and seek its advice of the said treatment unit and install and commission the unit within next one month.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding relocation of the Bandhwari Solid Waste Plant and landfill site away from Aravali Hill area, Gurugram, Haryana, 18/01/2018
summary: The Court's attention has been drawn to the deteriorating situation at the landfill site as per the inspection report of the carried out by the Central Pollution Control Board of the dump site.

subject: Mining
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding 6,44,169 metric tonnes of the declared coal lying unassessed, South Garo Hills-Bagmara, Meghalaya, 18/01/2018
petitioner: All Dimasa Students Union Dima Hasao Dist. Committee
summary: The Counsel appearing on behalf of the State of Meghalaya submits that the authorities will carry out the assessment of the un-assessed coal lying at Semingkri and its proximity within three weeks. NGT directs the authorities to carry out the assessment of the coal lying in Semingkri and its proximity within three weeks.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding solid waste management in the city of Raipur
summary: It has been observed that the solid waste management rules have not been complied with by the Municipal Corporation Raipur. Also in some areas like EWS and BSUP colonies the garbage had not been collected since the year 2012 and there are huge heaps of garbage dumped in the colonies which has now become a health hazard for the residents who are residing there. The Municipal Corporation is directed to remove this garbage immediately and a compliance of the same be filed before the next date of hearing (7th February, 2018).

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding establishment of STPs in the town of Jowai, Meghalaya, 19/01/2018
summary: The affidavit filed by the Chief Secretary, Govt. of Meghalaya states that Jowai Municipal Board has set up common ETPs and STPs and the letter calling for expression of interest has been floated for engagement of a suitable and qualified consultant for preparation of the DPR. The Municipal Board has issued notices to all households within its jurisdiction to set up septic tanks and soak pits. The Court noted that septic tanks and soak pits are now obsolete techniques and expensive for the common households and the most suitable method would be to establish common sewerage network led to a common STP. NGT asks the Jowai Municipal Board and the Urban Development Deptt, Govt. of Meghalaya to consider adopting this method taking into consideration the topography of the region. This would also be applicable to the city of Shillong and other Municipal areas.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding waste management of hospitals in Kolkata, West Bengal, 22/01/2018
respondent: West Bengal Pollution Control Board & Others
summary: NGT makes it clear that establishment of ETPs in the hospitals is unavoidable which has been delayed inordinately because of the reluctant response of the concerned Departments.

subject: Forests
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding illegal structures within the protected forest areas in Dumka District, Jharkhand, 23/01/2018
summary: It has been admitted before the Court that various government establishments and structures were either in existence from before or had been raised in the forest area without clearance being sought for under the Forest (Conservation) Act, 1980.

subject: Water Resources
title: Supreme Court order regarding water dispute in respect of waters of the Mahanadi Basin, 23/01/2018
summary: This suit was filed by the State of Odisha asking for an injunction restraining State of Chhattisgarh from continuing with the construction and operation of the six ongoing industrial barrages namely Samoda, Seorinarayan, Basantpur, Mirouni, Saradiha and Kalma. Supreme Court directs the Central Government to issue appropriate notification in the Official Gazette and constitute a Water Disputes Tribunal for adjudication of the water dispute between the parties herein within a period of one month from today.

subject: Health, Food Safety, Pesticides
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding phasing out of PVC pipes containing lead, 24/01/2018
summary: MoEF is directed to issue general directions to the industries to publish a caveat with each product of PVC pipes containing lead, which are going to be phased out, that it contains lead which is harmful to the health.

subject: Air Pollution
title: Supreme Court order regarding air pollution caused by stubble burning in Punjab, Haryana and western Uttar Pradesh, 24/01/2018
summary: Apex Court has been informed that the report of the Sub-Committee of the High Level Task Force on prevention of stubble burning in Punjab, Haryana and Western Uttar Pradesh was submitted on 18th December, 2017. Supreme Court asks EPCA to look into the Report of the Sub Committee and inform us of any suggestions or recommendations.

subject: Mining
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding illegal sand and boulders mining within the Dehing Patkai Wildlife Sanctuary, Digboi Division, Assam, 25/01/2018
summary: The mining in Dehing Patkai Wildlife Sanctuary is alleged to be taking place in the river bed of the Dirak river on the Assam-Arunachal Pradesh border by various mechanical means adversely affecting the dynamics of the river flow and change in the river course as well affecting the river Namtok resulting in the increase in erosion of the bank and adverse impact on the riverine ecosystem. NGT directs the Assam State Pollution Control Board and the District Mining Officers and District Magistrates Tinsukia and Tinsukia Districts of Assam, and Tirap district in Arunachal Pradesh to inspect the area in question and verify on the correctness of the allegations contained in the OA. If there are illegal mining and illegal operation of the coal mines and coke oven units in the area as alleged, appropriate action be instituted.

subject: Air Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding air pollution in the cities of Kolkata and Howrah, West Bengal, 25/01/2018
summary: NGT directs that a comprehensive study of the ambient air quality should be undertaken by a Committee which shall be headed by the Regional Officer of the CPCB, who shall monitor the work of the Committee and submit a regular report. The study shall be undertaken to cover whole of the two cities.

subject: Environment
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding illegal brick field in Jalaberia, South 24 Parganas, West Bengal, 25/01/2018
summary: The brick field is not complying with the pollution norms including want of certificate from the State PCB. NGT directs the State PCB to inspect the unit in question and submit report.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding primary metallurgical industries requiring Environmental Clearance (EC), Arunachal Pradesh, 25/01/2018
summary: NGT took a stern view of the "recalcitrant and truant" attitude of the State of Arunachal Pradesh. The Court noted that the primary responsibility to furnish information on the various allegations pertaining to the incorporation and the category of the industries lies with the Directorate of Commerce & Industries, Govt. of Arunachal Pradesh. Unfortunately, the Director of Industries has not been impleaded as a respondent but notwithstanding that, the State of Arunachal Pradesh has been impleaded and therefore, ought to have responded to the notice issued upon them promptly.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding bio-medical waste management in states of Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Punjab and Haryana, 25/01/2018
summary: The Applicant has stated that Sheela Hospital & Trauma Centre, Kailash Hospital and Heart Institute, Shri Ganga Charan Hospital (P) Ltd., Katiyar Nursing Home in Hardoi, Uttar Pradesh and Uttar Pradesh Pollution Control Boar has violated the directions with regard to treating bio-medical waste. NGT directs the hospitals and Uttar Pradesh Pollution Control Board to reply within two weeks.

subject: Air Pollution
title: Order of the Supreme Court regarding action plan for air pollution control in Delhi and NCR, 25/01/2018
summary: Supreme Court in the order dated 13.12.2017 had observed that it might be appropriate if the Ministry of Environment, Forests and Climate Change looks into the matter of air pollution on a nation wide basis since it is not a problem confined only to the NCR but is a problem concerning the entire country. Additional Solicitor General of India says that steps are being taken in this regard and final decision will be taken very soon.

subject: Land, Agriculture, Animal Care and Fisheries
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding acquisition of 520 acres of land in Haryana for Express Highway, 25/01/2018
summary: Supreme Court said that it is difficult to determine the fair market rate of the acquired land for want of sufficient evidence. The cases have been transferred to the Reference Court and the Reference Court will accordingly decide the rate of land as prevalent on the date of acquisition.

subject: Health, Food Safety, Pesticides
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding arsenic contamination of groundwater, Sambhal, Uttar Pradesh, 29/01/2018
summary: Counsel appearing on behalf of respondent UP Jal Nigam submits that no water samples from borewells within the limits of Sambhal Nagar Palika were collected, and such water samples will be collected and analyzed in due course. NGT directs Zila Panchayat Raj Adhikari to make arrangements for supply of drinking water to the affected parties at the places where contaminated borewells are situated. Such borewells contaminated with Arsenic shall be sealed by the District Magistrate, Sambhal on the arrangements being made for supply of drinking water.

subject: Air Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding registration of BS-IV compliant vehicles, Delhi, 31/01/2018
summary: The issue deals with registration of BS-IV compliant vehicles. The application have been moved by the purchasers of BS-IV compliant new diesel vehicles to be used as Ambulance/Medical Emergency Van for registration of the said vehicles. NGT allows these applications directing the Transport Commissioner, Transport Department, Government of NCT Delhi to register the BS-IV compliant vehicles subject to certain conditions.

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding concretization in River Yamuna in Vrindavan, Uttar Pradesh, 31/01/2018
respondent: Ministry of Environment and Forests & Climate Change & Others
summary: The main application has been filed for declaring the activity of construction work of River Front Development and laying of pipeline in river bed and flood plain of River Yamuna as illegal and for restoring of the river bed and flood plain of River Yamuna. NGT directs that the work carried out and undertaken by State of Uttar Pradesh and Uttar Pradesh Irrigation Department shall be subject to the review done by the National Mission for Clean Ganga.

subject: Wildlife and Biodiversity
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding animal deaths in Kaziranga National Park due to accidents on the highway, 01/02/2018
summary: The State of Assam has placed before the Court an alternative proposal to installation of Automated Animal Sensor Barriers. The Court observed that except revealing the budgetary constraints there is no explanation or revelation of the special circumstance or reason to go for the alternative proposal. There is no material to suggest greater efficacy of the alternative in comparison with Automated Animal Sensor Barriers.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: Supreme Court order regarding regarding environmental clearance to a housing project at Vadgaon Budruk, Pune, Maharashtra, 05/02/2018
petitioner: M/S Goeal Ganga Developers India Pvt Ltd.
summary: Apex Court directs the Additional Solicitor General to explain the provision of law under which an ex post facto environmental clearance can be given in a case such as the present, where the environmental clearance was given in 2008 for 12 multi-storeyed buildings but today 18 multi-storeyed buildings have been constructed. Court also directs the Municipal Commissioner, Pune to file his/her personal affidavit explaining how the construction could come up without any action being taken by the Pune Municipal Corporation.
case_status_comments: Next hearing on after three weeks

subject: Wildlife and Biodiversity
title: Judgement of the High Court of Kerala regarding destruction of agriculture by the attack of wild animals, Kerala, 05/02/2018
respondent: Principal Chief Conservator of Forests, Thiruvananthapuram
summary: The petitions have been filed by the agriculturalists who own or occupy lands in the close proximity of reserve forests, Kerala. The petitions have been filed in the year 2010 seeking a direction to the State to take urgent and effective steps to provide solar energy fencing separating the agricultural lands and forest lands, and thereby to protect the farmers and the agricultural lands of the petitioners from attack of wild animals. High Court of Kerala makes it clear that it is the duty of the State to take remedial action to prevent straying of wild animals and also to suitably compensate the farmers when damage is caused.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: Supreme Court order regarding implementation of Solid Waste Management Rules 2016, 06/02/2018
petitioner: Re: Outrage as Parents End Life After Child's Dengue Death
summary: Supreme Court refuses to accept the 845 page affidavit to be filed on behalf of the Union of India and Delhi Government and asks the Counsel appearing for them to prepare a chart indicating the States and Union Territories that have set up the State Level Advisory Board (SLAB) in terms of Rule 23 of the Solid Waste Management Rules, 2016. The chart will indicate the date on which the SLAB was set up and the name of the Chairperson and members of the SLAB. It will also indicate the number of meetings held by the SLAB and the dates on which the meeting were held.

subject: Air Pollution
title: Supreme Court order regarding action plan for removal of traffic congestion, Delhi, 06/02/2018
summary: The recommendations of the Task Force relating to the action plan for removal of traffic congestion is being implemented according to the Counsel appearing for the Delhi Government and the Delhi Police. But the Apex Court refused to accept such a "bald statement" and asked for specific details along with the Reports on the Comprehensive Action Plan.

subject: Mining
title: Judgement of the High Court of Kerala regarding prohibition on the working of a quarry in Ernakulam District, Kerala for violating Kerala Irrigation and Water Conservation Act 2003, 06/02/2018
act_referred: Kerala Irrigation and Water Conservation Act 2003
summary: The order was issued mainly for non-compliance of Section 40 of the Kerala Irrigation and Water Conservation Act, 2003. Court disposes of the appeal.

subject: Forests
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding maintenance of green cover along highways, 06/02/2018
respondent: Secretary, MORTH (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) & Others
summary: The States have been asked to file affidavits mentioning the following: 1. Stretch of roads in different areas in the State where trees have been felled and the areas identified for compensatory afforestation. 2. The number of trees proposed to be felled. National Highway Authority of India has been directed to file the guidelines prescribing maintenance of flanks and avenue plantation along the highways and indicate the authority which is responsible for its implementation.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding large scale operation of illegal brick kilns in states of Uttar Pradesh, Haryana, Delhi and Rajasthan, 07/02/2018
summary: It is further stated that these brick kilns have been operating without complying with the pollution norms causing immense air and water pollution and also without obtaining necessary clearances from the concerned statutory authorities. NGT directs the State Pollution Control Board of each of the States of Uttar Pradesh, Haryana, NCT Delhi and Rajasthan to examine the allegations contained in Original Application and inspect all brick fields within the Districts.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: Supreme Court order regarding sealing drive in Delhi against illegal constructions, 09/02/2018
summary: It has been brought to the notice of the Supreme Court that the Delhi Development Authority is proposing to amend the Master Plan of Delhi and steps have already been initiated in this regard. Learned Amicus submits before the Apex Court that it would be appropriate if the Delhi Development Authority, the Municipal Corporations in Delhi and the Delhi Government file an affidavit within a week informing whether they have conducted any : (i) Environment Impact Assessment before making any modification as proposed (ii) Whether any study has been conducted and whether any facts and figures are available with regard to congestion in the city of Delhi.

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding supply of treated sewage water for gardening purposes in Vasant Kunj, Delhi, 09/02/2018
summary: NGT in the Order dated 26/10/2017 had directed DDA/MCD/DJB to ensure the supply of treated sewage water for gardening.

subject: Governance & Institutions
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding tardy implementation of laws beneficial to children, 09/02/2018
act_referred: Jnvenile Justice Act 2000, Juvenile Justice Act 2015
summary: Supreme Court asks National Legal Services Authority (NALSA) to prepare a report to assist policy making and decision making authorities to plan out their affairs relating to Juvenile Justice Act 2015. The Apex Court also requests the Chief Justice of each High Court to seriously consider establishing child friendly courts and vulnerable witness courts in each district.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding hosting of Sun-Burn Festival, Village Anjuna, Bardez, District North Goa, Goa, 13/02/2018
summary: NGT (Western Bench) directs that: 1. Whenever any such events/festivals are organized, the organizers shall ensure that permission so granted to that effect is widely published and posted on the website at least 15 days in advance. 2. The organizers shall maintain all norms observance to w.r.t Noise pollution (Regulation Control) Rules 2000 and Solid Waste Management Rule 2016. 3. In case permission is granted for hosting of event or festival in the said area the licensee holding such permission shall strictly abide by all terms and conditions stipulated for grant of such permission and restore the area used back to its original position. Any default in this regard shall make the organizer of such event liable to pay environmental compensation.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding illegal construction by M/s SSM Builders & Promoters, Chennai, Tamil Nadu, 13/02/2018
summary: M/s SSM Builders and Promoters has moved this Application for direction to refund the amount of Rs. 36 crores deposited by it with TNPCB along with the interest accrued thereupon. Considering the default and conduct of the project proponent in commencing the construction without obtaining prior Environmental Clearance and the latent damage caused by such default/conduct NGT imposes an environmental compensation of Rs. 24 crores (i.e. 2/3rd amount of the 5 per cent of the project value i.e. 36 crores) on M/s SSM Builders & Promoters and permit refund of Rs. 12 crores.

subject: Water Pollution
title: Supreme Court order regarding pollution of Ulhas river as well as Walduni river, Ulhasnagar, Thane District, Maharashtra, 13/02/2018
summary: It is submitted by the counsel for Vanashakti Public Trust that NEERI has given a proposal in February, 2017 with regard to certain short term measures for reducing pollution levels in the area. Supreme Court directs Additional Solicitor General to inform the Court on the status of the proposal given by NEERI.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding illegal construction by M/s SSM Builders & Promoters, Chennai, Tamil Nadu, 13/02/2018
summary: M/s SSM Builders and Promoters has moved this Application for direction to refund the amount of Rs. 36 crores deposited by it with TNPCB along with the interest accrued thereupon.

subject: Environment
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding hosting of Sun-Burn Festival, Village Anjuna, Bardez, District North Goa, Goa, 13/02/2018
summary: NGT (Western Bench) passes the following directions: 1. Whenever any such events/festivals are organized, the organizers shall ensure that permission so granted to that effect is widely published and posted on the website at least 15 days in advance. 2. The organizers shall maintain all norms observance to w.r.t Noise pollution (Regulation Control) Rules 2000 and Solid Waste Management Rule 2016. 3. Goa Pollution Control Board, Goa Coastal Zone Management Authority, Department of Tourism and Local body/Municipalities shall maintain regular vigil and undertake/perform functions as prescribed under their area of jurisdiction as per Law. 4. In case permission is granted for hosting of event or festival in the said area the licensee holding such permission shall strictly abide by all terms and conditions stipulated for grant of such permission and restore the area used back to its original position. Any default in this regard shall make the organizer of such event liable to pay environmental compensation.

subject: Water Resources
title: Supreme Court order regarding construction of the Polavaram project on the river Godavari, 15/02/2018
summary: It is submitted by the counsel appearing on behalf of the State of Odisha that he does not press for a blanket injunction but submits that the construction should be in accordance with the Godavari Water Disputes Tribunal Award 1980 and the necessary clearances should be in conformity with the relevant laws including Forest Conservation Act, 1980 and the Environment (Protection) Act, 1986. The application is, of course, opposed by other defendants who say that the construction is going on in accordance with Godavari Water Disputes Tribunal Award 1980 as well as the statutes.

subject: Industry
title: Judgement of the Kerala High Court regarding pollution caused by a metal industry, Thrissur, Kerala, 15/02/2018
summary: Kerala High Court directs the Pollution Control Board to depute an Engineer to the premises of the petitioner's units, so as to ascertain whether the activities in the unit would comply with the parameters stipulated by the Pollution Control Board in the consent already granted to the petitioner. The inspection shall essentially be with a view to ascertain whether, the effluents generated by the petitioner's unit, on a day when the unit is working, comply with the standards laid down by the Pollution Control Board for the effluents.

subject: Forests
title: Order of the High Court of Kerala regarding a wood based industrial unit seeking exemption from Kerala Forest Rules 2012, 15/02/2018
summary: Appeal is dismissed as the Court says that the reading of the Rule would show that any industrial unit which processes wood as its raw material and includes sawmills, furniture units, veneer units and such other units, are wood-based industrial units.

subject: Water Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding dangerous level of ammonia and pollution of drinking water source to Wazirabad reservoir, 16/02/2018
judge_name: Jawad Rahim, S.P. Wangdi, Nagin Nanda
summary: The Application have been moved by Delhi Jal Board seeking direction of this Tribunal to the Government of Haryana to urgently take steps to check and reduce alleged dangerous level of Ammonia and consequent pollution effective on the drinking water source from upstream into river Yamuna and supply water to Wazirabad reservoir. It is now suggested that Chief Secretaries of State of Haryana and NCT of Delhi be directed to hold a meeting to resolve the issue relating to the pollution of the Yamuna water due the industrial and other pollutants resulting in the Ammonia level rise which has reached the alarming situation and making the water un-potable.

subject: Water Resources
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding allocation and sharing of water of river Cauvery, 16/02/2018
summary: Supreme Court directs an additional 14.75 TMC of water to be awarded to the State of Karnataka. In view of the allocation of additional 14.75 TMC of water to Karnataka, the State of Karnataka would now be required to release 177.25 TMC of water at the inter-state border with Tamil Nadu, i.e., at Billigundulu. Supreme Court refused to interfere with regard to the allocation of water for domestic and industrial purposes in the State of Tamil Nadu. The Judgement of the Supreme Court also made it very clear that "Drinking water requirement of the overall population of all the States has to be placed on a higher pedestal as we treat it as a hierarchically fundamental principle of equitable distribution".

subject: Forests
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding notification of National Policy on forest fires, 19/02/2018
summary: The Counsel appearing for Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change submits that Ministry has taken steps to comply with the order of the Tribunal and in fact World Bank is involved and several steps have been taken. According to the Counsel National Policy Draft has been prepared seeking suggestions of the State Governments who are stakeholders, but the State Governments have not yet responded, consequently the National Policy on Forest Fire could not be finalized. NGT directs the State Governments to cooperate with the Ministry and send response at the earliest. NGT issues directions to the Chief Secretaries of the States to take immediate step in the matter in relation approval the drafting and making suggestion to the draft National Policy.

subject: Forests
title: Supreme Court order regarding misuse of forest rest houses which are being used for tourism and other purposes, 19/02/2018
summary: This is contrary to Forest (Conservation) Act, 1980. Supreme Court directs the petitioner to prepare draft guidelines in consultation with CEC and handed over to the Ministry of Forests and Environment for consideration.

subject: Water Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding management of hazardous waste that is lying on the bank of river Ram Ganga, Uttar Pradesh, 21/02/2018
judge_name: Jawad Rahim, S.P. Wangdi, Nagin Nanda
summary: Counsel appearing for State Pollution Control Board submits that the hazardous waste can be beneficially utilized for filling requirement of overbridges on the Kachha Area. The feasibility can be ascertained from National Highways Authority of India and Central Pollution Control Board. Counsel appearing for Central Pollution Control Board submits that they have not received any proposal, if such proposal is received, they will examine and place it before the Tribunal.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding PESO licenses for the industries producing absolute alcohol (Ethanol), Uttar Pradesh, 22/02/2018
judge_name: Jawad Rahim, S.P. Wangdi, Nagin Nanda
summary: The distillery industry wants modification of the NGT Order (30th August 2017) where the Court directs PESO as well as State of Uttar Pradesh and all concerned States to take appropriate action in accordance with law i.e. hazardous waste, chemical waste rules and the PESO as it is the competent authority to issue licenses.

subject: Air Pollution
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding switch over to cleaner fuel CNG, Gujarat, 22/02/2018
judge_name: Jawad Rahim, S.P. Wangdi, Nagin Nanda
summary: NGT directs the concerned Secretary of the concerned department in the State of Gujarat to make a statement as to the steps taken in the relating to switch over from fossil fuel to CNG within 10 days.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding management of plastic waste, 22/02/2018
respondent: Govt. of NCT of Delhi & Others
judge_name: Jawad Rahim, S.P. Wangdi, Nagin Nanda
summary: Report has been submitted before NGT by the Central Pollution Control Board prepared by Central Institute of Plastics Engineering and Technology on the degradation of the plastics. NGT directs report to be submitted periodically once in two month showing degradation which should pass on every month or 30 days.

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding high level of ammonia in the water which is reaching the water reservoir of Delhi Jal Board, 22/02/2018
judge_name: Jawad Rahim, S.P. Wangdi, Nagin Nanda
summary: NGT directs the State of Haryana and NCT of Delhi to ensure that they identify the source of pollution and address it appropriately. The Central Pollution Control Board and Delhi Pollution Control Committee shall be involved to ensure the erring industry or local bodies and other parties who are causing pollution are dealt with appropriately and check the pollution level. The Court also directs that  the report submitted earlier by the Central Pollution Control Board to the Tribunal needs to be rechecked both with regard to pollution levels of Ammonia downstream at Khojkipur Drain No. 2 and Khojkipur drain as a figures appearing in the report appear to be incorrect.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding the expansion of the port limits of Adani's Hazira port, Gujarat, 22/02/2018
summary: Essar Bulk Terminal Limited have argued before the Court that they have spent huge amounts of money on lands reclaimed by them. Apex Court dismisses the Appeal of the Essar Bulk Terminal saying that Essar have no ‘right’ to private property in view of the fact that the ownership of the captive jetty that has been constructed and the ownership of reclaimed land is with the State Government. For this reason also, the notification is intra vires as the alteration in the limits of Hazira Port does not affect any ‘right’ of the Appellants to private property.

subject: Natural Disasters
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding environmental compensation for the flood resulting in disaster on 16-17, June 2013, Uttarakhand, 22/02/2018
summary: The matter relates to environmental compensation for the flood resulting in disaster on 16-17, June 2013 from L & T Uttaranchal Hydropower Ltd. while it was establishing Singoli-Bhatwari Hydro project in Uttarakhand. Report of DM Rudraprayag under whose jurisdiction both Basukedar and Ukhimath Sub- Division falls have been filed. Report has been filed in respect of all 115 affected people after their verification classifying the same in terms of the order dated 09.01.2018. NGT directs the Registry to ensure that the list of affected people be tallied with the list of petitioner (Mandakini Badh Prabhavit Samiti).

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding construction on the riverbed and floodplain of Yamuna in Mathura, Uttar Pradesh, 23/02/2018
judge_name: Jawad Rahim, S.P. Wangdi, Nagin Nanda
summary: It has been reported before the Tribunal that the Member of Parliament Hema Malini who intended to hold the Event on the bank of Yamuna has written letter to the District Magistrate, Mathura who granted approval for one day Holi Sasotsav Cultural Programme on Yamuna Bank in front of Vishramghat, Mathura City on 23rd March, 2018, that the Event has been cancelled in view of the shifting of venue of the Event. Counsel for the Applicant submits that debris are lying on the spot as a result of step taken for setting/preparation of the event. NGT directs that debris or any construction which has taken place on the bank of river Yamun, the same shall be removed and damage if any shall be set right by under the supervision of Uttar Pradesh Pollution Control Board and the District Magistrate concerned.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding grant of permission to operate to Sidhi Vinayak Engineers, Uttar Pradesh, 23/02/2018
respondent: Uttar Pradesh Pollution Control Board & Others
judge_name: Jawad Rahim, S.P. Wangdi, Nagin Nanda
summary: It is pointed out by the NOIDA Development Authority that M/s. Sidhi Vinayak Engineers shift the industrial unit and upon such information being furnished it had to be verified by the NOIDA Development Authority prior to grant of permission. He submits that is has not been done. The Counsel for the applicant submits that the applicant would soon furnish details of the place where they intend shifting.

subject: Water Resources
title: Supreme Court order regarding water dispute in respect of waters of the Mahanadi Basin, 23/01/2018
summary: This suit was filed by the State of Odisha asking for an injunction restraining State of Chhattisgarh from continuing with the construction and operation of the six ongoing industrial barrages namely Samoda, Seorinarayan, Basantpur, Mirouni, Saradiha and Kalma. Supreme Court directs the Central Government to issue appropriate notification in the Official Gazette and constitute a Water Disputes Tribunal for adjudication of the water dispute between the parties herein within a period of one month from today.

subject: Air Pollution
title: Supreme Court order regarding pollution from passenger buses from Bikaner House, New Delhi, 05/03/2018
summary: Court directs state of Rajasthan to file a counter affidavit within three weeks and all buses originating from or terminating at Bikaner House, near India Gate, New Delhi are restrained from operating with effect from 1 st April, 2018.

subject: Water Resources
title: Supreme Court order regarding construction of a multi storied building on wetland area, Ernakulam District, Kerala, 05/03/2018
summary: Supreme Court sets aside the Order passed by the Kerala High Court which allowed the builder to continue construction and remanded the matter for a fresh decision after taking into account the detailed report submitted by the Sub-Collector, Fortkochi, Ernakulam District, Kerala.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: Supreme Court order regarding hotels in Manali flouting environmental laws, Himachal Pradesh, 05/03/2018
summary: Manali Hoteliers Association had objected to the NGT Order which had asked for closure of hotels flouting environmental laws and said that Section 39 of the Town and Country Planning Act, 1977 prescribes the procedure for non-compliance which has to pass a statutory provision. Apex Court disposes of the Appeal saying that "aforesaid provision is statutorily ingrained in the Town and Country Planning Act, 1977 the competent authority/Committee shall adhere to the said procedure".

subject: Forests
title: Supreme Court order regarding diversion of forest land in Tamil Nadu which will also lead to felling of 110 Red Sanders trees by the National Highways Authority of India, 06/03/2018
petitioner: In Re: T. N. Godavarman Thirumulpad
summary: Supreme Court allows diversion of forest land subject to permission granted by the authorities under the Forest (Conservation) Act, 1980, fulfillment of the conditions laid therein as well as the payment of Net Present Value and compensatory afforestation in the area identified for this purpose.

subject: Mining
title: Supreme Court order regarding illegal mining in Rohtas region of Bihar, 06/03/2018
petitioner: In Re: T. N. Godavarman Thirumulpad
summary: The Apex Court took note of the report submitted by the Central Empowered Committee (CEC) and that the State of Bihar is acting on it. Supreme Court directs that this should be stated on affidavit and a status report be filed by the State of Bihar with regard to the implementation of the recommendations made by the CEC in its report.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding pollution caused by tanneries in Kanpur, Uttar Pradesh, 06/03/2018
judge_name: Jawad Rahim, Raghuvendra S. Rathore, Satyawan Singh Garbyal, Nagin Nanda
summary: Counsel for CPCB submits that the joint inspection of industries has been conducted. NGT directs joint inspection of industries to be conducted which were found closed.

subject: Industry
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding closure of industries flouting environmental laws, Haryana, 06/03/2018
judge_name: Jawad Rahim, Raghuvendra S. Rathore, Satyawan Singh Garbyal, Nagin Nanda
summary: Counsel for Haryana State Pollution Control Board has filed a Status Report which shows that the SPCB has found during inspection some erring industries amongst the industries. The industries listed in the report have deposited amount of environmental compensation while other units in the second list of the report are found remained closed. NGT taked the report on record but direct the Board to ensure that the erring industries, which is still said to be functioning and in default of Court's directions, shall be closed down.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: Supreme Court order regarding sealing drive in Delhi against illegal constructions, 06/03/2018
summary: The Apex Court Observes that in spite of the Court's Order dated 09.02.2018 which required the Delhi Development Authority, the Municipal Corporations in Delhi and the Delhi Government to file an affidavit with respect to nine issues concerning the Master Plan of Delhi nobody has filed an affidavit. Thus the Apex Court has no option but to accept whatever has been suggested by the learned Amicus and conclude that none of the requirements recorded in the order dated 09.02.2018 have been fulfilled by any of these authorities. That being the position, further progress in the Amendment of the Master Plan is stayed.

subject: Forests
title: Supreme Court order regarding land claims under Forest Rights Act 2006, India, 07/03/2018
judge_name: Madan B. Lokur, Kurian Joseph, Deepak Gupta
summary: Supreme Court directs all the State Governments to file an affidavit indicating :- (i) The number of claims for the grant of land under the provisions of the Scheduled Tribes and Other Traditional Forest Dwellers (Recognition of Forest Rights) Act, 2006; (ii) The claims should be divided into claims made by the Scheduled Tribes and separately by other traditional forest dwellers; (iii) The number of claims rejected by the State Government in respect of each category. The information shall be furnished within a period of four weeks.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: Supreme Court order regarding solid waste management in India, 07/03/2018
petitioner: In Re: Outrage as Parents End Life After Child's Dengue Death
judge_name: Madan B. Lokur, Kurian Joseph, Deepak Gupta
summary: The Union of India has filed a compilation of information pursuant to Court's order dated 6th February, 2018 which indicates that it has received a communication from 28 out of 36 State Governments and Union Territories. It is stated that the State Level Advisory Boards (SLABs) have been constituted in 27 out of 36 States and Union Territories as per information received by the Central Pollution Control Board. However, as per Rule 23 of the Solid Waste Management Rules, 2016 only in 20 out of 36 States and Union Territories SLABs have been constituted. Supreme Court notes that meetings of the SLABs have been held only by 17 State Governments and Union Territories. Apex Court expresses displeasure on the lack of interest of State Governments and the Union Territories on the issue of waste management and issues notice to all State Governments and Union Territories.

subject: Air Pollution
title: Supreme Court order regarding ban on sales and use of furnace oil and pet coke in Delhi NCR, 08/03/2018
judge_name: Madan B. Lokur, Kurian Joseph, Deepak Gupta
summary: Assistant Solicitor General (ASG) says that he will file an affidavit on behalf of the Ministry of Environment, Forests and Climate Change. ASG has also shown a copy of the affidavit that is proposed to be filed which shows that certain issues are pending with the ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas for almost a month. Apex Court directs the Ministry of Environment, Forests and Climate Change to take up the question of delay with the Ministry of Petroleum " in view of urgency in tackling the problem of air pollution in the country".

subject: Wildlife and Biodiversity
title: Supreme Court order regarding illegal activities in forests and tiger reserves of India, 09/03/2018
summary: Counsel for the petitioner has suggested certain solutions for saving of tiger, elephants and leopards. Supreme Court directs the Petitioner to give a detailed note with regard to each solution so that the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change can look into it.
case_status_comments: Next hearing on after four weeks

subject: Health, Food Safety, Pesticides
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding euthanasia, March 09, 2018
summary: Judgement of the Supreme Court of India in the matter of Common Cause Vs Union of India & Others dated March 09, 2018 regarding euthanasia. Supreme Court said that the right to die with dignity as fundamental right and declared that an  "adult human being having mental capacity to take an informed decision has right to refuse medical treatment including withdrawal from life saving devices and that a person of competent mental faculty is entitled to execute an advance medical directive in accordance with safeguards as referred to above".

subject: Land, Agriculture, Animal Care and Fisheries
title: Supreme Court order regarding declaration of Matheran land in Maharashtra as an eco-sensitive zone, 09/03/2018
petitioner: In Re: T. N. Godavarman Thirumulpad
summary: Learned Additional Solicitor General says that he would like to file a detailed affidavit indicating the background and the present status.

subject: Forests
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding felling of trees for the construction of 850 KW Mini Hydro Power project, Gurdaspur, Punjab, 09/03/2018
judge_name: Jawad Rahim, Raghuvendra S. Rathore, Satyawan Singh Garbyal
summary: This application is moved by M/s Preetech Power Pvt. Ltd., seeking approval of this Tribunal for felling of trees on the private land. In support of the relief, it is averred that the applicant has undertaken the project for construction of 850 KW Mini Hydro Power project at Sabraon Branch Canal RD 34160 on L/s Village Tuglawala, Tehsil Shri Hargobindpur Forest Division and District, Gurdaspur, Punjab. Punjab Forest Service Divisional Forest Officer, Gurdaspur submitted before the Court that they found the request made for felling trees could be granted as there is no legal impediment. NGT allows the project proponent for the felling of trees "as it has compiled with all legal formalities".

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: Supreme Court order regarding sealing drive in Delhi against illegal properties, 12/03/2018
summary: Supreme Court asks the Delhi Development Authority and other civic agencies in Delhi the steps taken "to ensure that whatever construction is made is in accordance with the provisions of the Environment (Protection) Act, 1986 and the notifications therein relating to environmental clearance; fire clearance including fire safety measures; availability of water supply which should be made available to everybody in the city and not just to few people; electricity supply which should be made available to everybody and not to few people, adequate foot paths, adequate parking area for parking of vehicles for both two wheelers and four wheelers".

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding identification and declaration of wetlands in Uttar Pradesh, 12/03/2018
judge_name: Jawad Rahim, S.P. Wangdi, Nagin Nanda
summary: The State of Uttar Pradesh submits before NGT the publication of the notification under the Provisions of Rule 7 of the Wetland ( Conservation and Management) Rules, 2017 on 09th March, 2018. Ministry of Environment, Forest & Climate Change submits that State Government acted under the provisions of the new Wetland Rules. Therefore, if the State submits report with regard to the draft notification then further action will be taken by the Ministry of Environment, Forest & Climate Change in accordance with law. NGT accepts the request of the State of Uttar Pradesh for the adjournment of the case by 60 days for filing statement of further action that will be taken by the State in this regard.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding management of bio-medical waste, Bihar, 12/03/2018
petitioner: Veterans Forum for Transparency in Public Life
respondent: Department of Health and Family Welfare, Govt. of Bihar & Others
judge_name: Jawad Rahim, S.P. Wangdi, Nagin Nanda
summary: The Applicant (Veterans Forum for Transparency in Public Life) have sought enforcement/ compliance of the NGT order dated 24th October, 2017 requiring Central Pollution Control Board, State of Bihar and Bihar Pollution Control Board to prepare an inventory of the Unit generating bio-medical waste, its collection and disposal as to whether it is being done in accordance with Bio-Medical Waste Management Rules, 2016. But all the three Respondents have failed to file the report. NGT directs issuance of notice of show cause as to why, apart from taking such penal action as permissible under provision of the National Green Tribunal Act, 2010, environmental compensation shall not be imposed as the adverse impact is relatable directly to their inaction.

subject: Land, Agriculture, Animal Care and Fisheries
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding acquisition of 912 acres of land, District Gurgaon, Haryana, 12/03/2018
summary: The matter deals with the land acquisition of 912 acres from three villages namely, Manesar, Lakhnoula and Naurangpur, Tehsil and District Gurgaon for setting up Chaudhari Devi Lal Industrial Township, to be planned as an Integrated Complex for residential, recreational and other public purposes. Supreme Court while annulling the decisions dated 24.08.2007 and 29.01.2010 said the transactions entered into between the landholders and the concerned builders/private entities could not be said to be voluntary and free from any influence. The unnatural and unreasonable bargain was forced upon the landholders by creating façade of impending acquisition and the motive was to confer undue advantage on the builders/private entities.

subject: Forests
title: Supreme Court order regarding the annual felling of khair trees, Jammu & Kashmir, 13/03/2018
judge_name: Madan B. Lokur, Kurian Joseph, Deepak Gupta
summary: Supreme Court directs the State of Jammu & Kashmir to file an affidavit indicating the persons to whom licences have been granted, the date of the licences as well as the volume of felling of trees permitted.

subject: Forests
title: Supreme Court order regarding encroachment of Pachmarhi Cantonment, Madhya Pradesh, 13/03/2018
petitioner: In Re: T. N. Godavarman Thirumulpad
judge_name: Madan B. Lokur, Kurian Joseph, Deepak Gupta
summary: Supreme Court notes that the matter is being extremely casually by the Ministry of Defence. Court directs the Joint Secretary (Works) to hold a meeting within the month of March 2018 and one representative of Yuva Tarang who represents the civil residents of the area may also be permitted to participate in the meeting and place his point of view.

subject: Health, Food Safety, Pesticides
title: Order of the Supreme Court of India to treat toddy as liquor while enforcing the highway liquor ban in Kerala, 13/03/2018
summary: Supreme Court while disposing of the Applications stated that the Court has not "addressed to the issue whether toddy would be covered under the definition of liquor. The said issue of law is kept open".

subject: Water Resources
title: Order of the Delhi High Court regarding supply of water to Delhi, 13/03/2018
summary: Delhi High Court emphasised on the importace of repairs to the water carrying canal (Delhi Sub Branch Canal) as the present condition is stated to be causing loss and wastage of precious water which is badly needed by the citizens of this city. High Court also directs for scrutiny of the supply of water which is being provided by the State of Haryana to Delhi.

subject: Environment
title: Supreme Court order regarding utilisation of Compensatory Afforestation Management and Planning Authority (CAMPA) Funds, 14/03/2018
petitioner: In Re: T. N. Godavarman Thirumulpad
judge_name: Madan B. Lokur, Kurian Joseph, Deepak Gupta
summary: Supreme Court states that from the information given by the ASG as well as the Amicus, there are at least 10 or 12 funds that have been created as a result of orders passed by the Supreme Court from time to time. The total amount in these funds is tentatively put in the region of Rs.70,000-75,000 crores approximately. This, according to the ASG as well as the Amicus, is likely to go higher.
case_status_comments: Next hearing on first week of July 2018

subject: Health, Food Safety, Pesticides
title: Supreme Court order regarding effective implementation of the provisions of the Pre-conception and Pre-natal Diagnostic Techniques (Prohibition of Sex Selection) Act 1994, 14/03/2018
respondent: Indian Radiological And Imaging Association & Others
judge_name: Dipak Misra, A.M. Khanwilkar, D.Y. Chandrachud
summary: Supreme Court stays the Judgement of the Delhi High Court dated 17 February 2016 which had set aside the compulsory six months training for a person desirous of setting up a Genetic Clinic / Ultrasound Clinic / Imaging Centre and which the Apex Court feels "impinges upon the directions issued by this Court". Supreme Court makes it clear that the Parliament has conferred upon the Central government rule making authority to specify minimum qualification for persons to be employed at genetic counselling centres, laboratories and clinics. The rationale for this is that the training would sensitize the person concerned to the salutary object and purpose of the legislation which has been enacted by Parliament to deal with a serious social evil and be conscious of the misuse of sex-selection tests. Pre-natal diagnostic procedures are susceptible to grave misuse.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: Order of the Delhi High Court regarding defacement of walls of the Tis Hazari Court complex, Delhi, 14/03/2018
summary: The matter deals with defacement of walls of the Tis Hazari Court complex due to posters put up for the bar elections. A status report has been received from the District & Sessions Judge, North and North-West from the District Courts, Rohini informing this court that all defacing material has been removed.

subject: Health, Food Safety, Pesticides
title: Order of the Delhi High Court regarding sterilisation of stray dogs, Delhi, 14/03/2018
summary: SDMC shall place before this court the possibility of video recording the sterilisations so as to verify the correctness of claims made by the contractors who undertake the same on behalf of the Corporation to ensure that the body parts of dogs are actually placed before the Municipal Corporation.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: Order of the Delhi High Court regarding the issue of waste management in Delhi, 14/03/2018
respondent: Government of NCT of Delhi & Others
summary: Delhi High Court finds that the issue of e-waste has not been addressed and directs the municipal corporations to place before the Court any measures/policies/rules in existence regarding the management and disposal of e-waste. Also notice to be issued to Sunita Narain, Director in the Centre for Science & Environment to enable her to report regarding the disposal of e-waste. Court also asks Ankit Gupta (reporter with the ABP News appointed as local commissioner by the Delhi High Court) to submit a report, regarding the status of garbage in the different districts and areas in Delhi.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: Supreme Court order regarding constructions in the city of Mumbai, Maharashtra, 15/03/2018
respondent: Municipal Corporation of Greater Mumbai & Others
summary: Supreme Court lifts the ban on construction in Mumbai imposed by the Bombay High Court with a direction to deal with and safely dispose of the solid waste and construction debris that is generated by the activities of construction of buildings and further no construction debris will be carried for disposal to the Deonar and Mulund dumping sites. Supreme Court also clearly stated that any construction that is permitted shall be only after adequate safeguards are employed by the builders for preventing dispersal of particles through the air. This shall be incorporated in the IOD, unless it is already so incorporated.
case_status_comments: Next hearing on after six months

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding environmental clearance for building projects, Kolkata, 16/03/2018
respondent: Ministry of Environment Forest & Climate Change
judge_name: Jawad Rahim, S.P. Wangdi, Nagin Nanda
summary: NGT disposes of the Applications with the direction to MOEF & CC / SEIAA (whichever is the Competent Authority) to pass appropriate order within a period of six weeks on the issue of environment clearance to the building projects.

subject: Forests
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding construction of road through Aravalli Range, Haryana, 16/03/2018
judge_name: Jawad Rahim, S.P. Wangdi, Nagin Nanda
summary: NGT puts on hold the clearing of forested area of the Aravalli Range.

subject: Industry
title: Supreme Court judgement regarding construction workers in the unorganized sector of India, 19/03/2018
petitioner: National Campaign Committee for Central Legislation on Construction Labour (NCC-CL)
act_referred: Building and Other Construction Workers Act 1996
summary: Supreme Court emphasized that construction workers do not assist only in building infrastructure, but they also assist in building the nation, in their own small way. Once that realization dawns upon those required to implement the BOCW (Building and Other Construction Workers) Act and the Cess Act, perhaps due respect will be shown to Article 21 of the Constitution and to Parliamentary statutes.

subject: Wildlife and Biodiversity
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding destruction of mangroves in Kutch District by Deendayal Port Trust, Gujarat, 19/03/2018
judge_name: Jawad Rahim, S.P. Wangdi, Nagin Nanda
summary: NGT directs a joint inspection to be conducted and a report be filed by the Gujarat State Pollution Control Board and Central Pollution Control Board.

subject: Water Resources
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding drying up of the river Yamuna in Delhi due to lack of sufficient water release, 19/03/2018
judge_name: Jawad Rahim, S.P. Wangdi, Nagin Nanda
summary: NGT calls for an inspection of Reservoir/ barrage at Tajewala, Wazirabad and Okhla by the team of Members from the Irrigation Department, Union of India, Upper Yamuna River Board and Irrigation Department of State of Haryana and NCT of Delhi and Central Pollution Control Board. The teams shall inspect the said barrage/ reservoirs and give opinion as to what is the quantity of water release for the past one month from the said barrage and whether there is any extraction of water from these barrage by anybody.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding illegal running of slaughter houses in Belgavi, Karnataka, 22/03/2018
respondent: Commissioner Corporation of the City of Belgavi & Others
judge_name: Jawad Rahim, S.P. Wangdi, Nagin Nanda
summary: State Pollution Control Board has been directed to file statement after inspection as to the number of slaughter houses which are running with proper license and authorization and list of those who have no such permission to run or sanction.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: Supreme Court order regarding felling of trees in the area of Taj Trapezium Zone, Uttar Pradesh, 22/03/2018
judge_name: Madan B. Lokur, Kurian Joseph, Deepak Gupta
summary: Supreme Court has been informed by the State of Uttar Pradesh that a vision document is likely to be prepared in consultation with the School of Planning and Architecture. A Project Committee has also been constituted for this purpose. It is stated by learned counsel for the State of Uttar Pradesh that the first draft of the vision document will take about four months. Until then, there will be a status quo in the Taj Trapezium Zone (TTZ).

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding municipal solid waste, sewage and trade effluent management in the city of Gaurakhpur, Uttar Pradesh, 22/03/2018
judge_name: Jawad Rahim, S.P. Wangdi, Nagin Nanda
summary: Court holds Gaurakhpur Nagar Nigam responsible for its failure to manage municipal solid waste to prevent pollution of rivers and failure to properly maintain and manage the sewage, polluting the rivers in question, the Gaurakhpur Nagar Nigam has exposed citizens to severe health hazards. Court also pointed to the State of Uttar Pradesh's failure to get medical checkup done of the people. CGWA was directed to examine the water samples which has also failed. Cumulatively all the Authorities have failed to ensure health of the people resulting in severe risk to life. National Green Tribunal imposes a cost of Rs. 5 lacs on Gaurakhpur Nagar Nigam for its failure to comply with Court's direction issued on 30th January, 2018 as well as its failure to file statement.

subject: Land, Agriculture, Animal Care and Fisheries
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding rehabilitation of mule operators operating between between Katra and Vaishno Devi shrine, Jammu & Kashmir, 22/03/2018
judge_name: Jawad Rahim, S.P. Wangdi, Nagin Nanda
summary: NGT makes it clear that the rehabilitation scheme is for providing for rehabilitation to the persons who were earning through mules and for but the animal as well. National Green Tribunal refuses to grant time of four weeks to the State and instead impose the cost of Rs. 50 lacs to be deposited within one week from now and to ensure that the scheme is finalised complying with all directions of the Tribunal within two weeks from now.

subject: Forests
title: Supreme Court order regarding utilization of 12.28 hectares of Delhi Ridge for the widening of National Highway from Dhaula Kuan, Delhi, 22/03/2018
petitioner: In Re: T. N. Godavarman Thirumulpad
judge_name: Madan B. Lokur, Kurian Joseph, Deepak Gupta
summary: CEC has recommended and accepted all the submissions made by the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI), subject to the following conditions: (a) The NHAI shall deposit 5% of the project cost with the Ridge Management Board Fund and which amount shall be used for conservation and protection of Delhi Ridge under the close supervision of the Forest Department of Delhi Government. (b) The 21.52 hectares of land in Yamuna Flood Plain allotted by DDA for compensatory afforestation shall be handed over, free from all encumbrances, to the Forest Department of Government of NCT of Delhi; and 9c) the cost of raising 21,500 plants including chainlink fencing of 21.52 hectares of land referred to above shall be deposited in advance with the Forest Department of NCT of Delhi by the NHAI. Supreme Court accepts the Report and recommendations made by the CEC.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: Supreme Court order regarding the state of garbage in Gazipur, Delhi, 22/03/2018
petitioner: In Re: T. N. Godavarman Thirumulpad
judge_name: Madan B. Lokur, Kurian Joseph, Deepak Gupta
summary: The affidavit filed by the East Delhi Municipal Corporation reveals that the height of the garbage/malba in Gazipur has reached 60 mts. with steep slope. Supreme Court while rejecting the affidavit directs East Delhi Municipal Corporation to file a detailed affidavit what the East Delhi Municipal Corporation proposes to do with regard to huge amount of garbage which is lying at Gazipur.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: Supreme Court order regarding solid waste management in Aurangabad, Maharashtra, 23/03/2018
summary: Supreme Court has been informed that the Directorate Maharashtra Urban Development Mission had a meeting with the concerned authorities on the basis of which a plan on how to deal with solid waste has been prepared which lists the measures that are to be taken on immediate basis, short term basis as well as on long terms basis. Counsel appearing for the Maharashtra State Pollution Control Board submits that it has a plan as to what should be done in the interregnum. Apex Court directs this plan be exchanged between the parties.

subject: Mining
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding illegal transportation of mineral Bajari from the state of Gujarat into the State of Rajasthan, 23/03/2018
judge_name: Raghuvendra S. Rathore, Satyawan Singh Garbyal
summary: NGT (Central Zone) dismisses the Application on the ground that the Zonal Bench of the Tribunal has no jurisdiction to adjudicate the Application on two counts, namely, for want of territorial jurisdiction and that the present matter does not involve a substantial question relating to environment.

subject: Air Pollution
title: Supreme Court order regarding Comprehensive Action Plan for air pollution control, 26/03/2018
summary: The Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas on behalf of Union of India has stated on affidavit that BS VI will be available in the National Capital Territory of Delhi in all retail outlets with effect from 01.04.2018. Supreme Court directs Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas to ensure that the concerned oil marketing companies (IOCL, HPCL, BPCL) examine the possibility of introduction of BS VI auto fuels in the whole NCR area with effect from 01.04.2019 and furnish a report to the Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas within two weeks. ASG has also been asked to file an affidavit indicating the status and feasibility of introduction of BS VI fuel in 13 metro cities apart from Delhi with effect from 01.04.2019. ASG has also been asked to state on affidavit the price of diesel vehicles as compared to petrol vehicles which are in excess of 2000 CC and those which are in the middle segment and lower segment.

subject: Waste Management, Disposal
title: Supreme Court order regarding solid waste management strategy, India, 27/03/2018
petitioner: In Re: Outrage as Parents End Life After Child's Dengue Death
summary: Assistant Solicitor General (ASG) has drawn Supreme Court's attention to Solid Waste Management Rules, 2016 where it is mentioned that the Secretary, Urban Development Department in the State is responsible for preparing solid waste management strategy and also ensuring implementation of the provisions of the Rules by all local authorities. Since there is no response nor any appearance on behalf of the States of Haryana, Jharkhand, Manipur and Meghalaya, Apext Court issues a direction to the Secretary, Urban Development Department of these States to be present in Court on the next date of hearing i.e. 24th April, 2018 to inform the Court the steps taken for implementation of Solid Waste Management Rules, 2016.

subject: Mining
title: Supreme Court order regarding illegal extraction of coal in the State of Meghalaya, 28/03/2018
petitioner: Ka Hima Nongstoin Land Owners, Coal Traders And Producers Association
respondent: All Dimasa Students Union, Dima Hasao District Committee & Other
summary: On 21.09.2016 Supreme Court passed a order which allowed the petitioners as well as the respondents who have mined the coal permission to transport the coal on payment of royalty and other fees. The extracted coal can be transported from 1st October, 2016 till 31st May, 2017. It is further directed that no other extraction shall take place in the meantime. The State of Meghalaya has filed the instant application wherein it is stated that approximately 5.00 lakhs MT of coal is still lying on various places and time up to 31st May, 2018 be granted to transport the aforesaid coal. Supreme Court extends the time for transportation of the extracted quantity of approximately 5.00 lakhs MT lying in various places in the State of Meghalya, upto 31.05.2018 in the same terms and conditions as contained in the order dated 21.09.2016. It shall also be ensured that while transporting the aforesaid quantity of coal, it shall not lead to creation of any type of pollution.

subject: Mining
title: Order of the High Court of Kerala regarding violation of the Kerala Protection of River Banks and Regulation of Removal of Sand Act 2001, 03/04/2018
summary: The case has been filed under Sections 20 & 23 of the Kerala Protection of River Banks and Regulation of Removal of Sand Act, 2001. The petitioner was found transporting stolen river sand without any permit or pass. The Judge Raja Vijayaraghavan V. taking a stern view of the case said that the ramifications of the illegal sand mining and the adverse impact that it would have on the ecology and the environment are matters which concern every citizen of this Country. If taken lightly, it may cause the river to change its track, affect ground water table and adversely impact the habitat of micro organisms. Court directs the petitioner to surrender as expeditiously as possible.

subject: Habitat & Urbanisation
title: Judgement of the National Green Tribunal regarding environmental clearance for construction of the International Exhibition cum Conventions Centre, Dwarka, Delhi, 04/04/2018
judge_name: Raghuvendra S. Rathore, Satyawan Singh Garbyal
act_referred: Environment Act 1986, Forest Act 1980, Biological Diversity Act 2002
summary: NGT opines that the Ministry of Environment and Forest and Department of Environment and Forest Government of NCT of Delhi have properly examined the proposal of Project Proponent from the point of view of the impact the proposal is likely to have on the environment and have therefore imposed necessary conditions to mitigate the adverse impact on it. Apart from requiring to raise compensatory plantation 19610 trees in Yamuna Bank plains the project proponents are also required to plant a minimum of 1 tree for every 80 sq meter of land that is 11215 trees considering project area of 89.72 ha. and 5883 trees for 1961 trees cut (three trees for every one tree cut) in other words 17098 trees will be planted at the project site in Dwarka. NGT made it clear that non compliance of directions to plant trees in Dwarka site by the project proponent will attract environmental compensation.

subject: Wildlife and Biodiversity
title: National Green Tribunal order regarding environmental clearance for Char Dham project, Uttarakhand, 04/04/2018
judge_name: Jawad Rahim, S.P. Wangdi, Nagin Nanda
